<item>
            <title>[CONFIGURATION-809] different of result with java.util.property in case of duplicate key.</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CONFIGURATION-809</link>
                <project id="12310467" key="CONFIGURATION">Commons Configuration</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;Considering I have a property file with a duplicate configuration key.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
# abc.properties

key1 = value1
key2 = value2

key1 = value3&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;with&#160;FileBasedConfigurationBuilder it will print the configuration value as &lt;b&gt;value1.&lt;/b&gt;&#160;while with java.util.properties the values will be &lt;b&gt;value3&lt;/b&gt;.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13399523">CONFIGURATION-809</key>
            <summary>different of result with java.util.property in case of duplicate key.</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>

<item>
            <title>[CONFIGURATION-808] DefaultListDelimiterHandler.escapeList working only for List&lt;String&gt;</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CONFIGURATION-808</link>
                <project id="12310467" key="CONFIGURATION">Commons Configuration</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;When DefaultListDelimiterHandler.escapeList is invoked with list of anything except String, it is throwing exception:&lt;/p&gt;



&lt;p&gt;java.lang.ArrayStoreException: java.lang.Integer at org.apache.commons.configuration2.convert.DefaultListDelimiterHandler.escapeList(DefaultListDelimiterHandler.java:110)&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Reason: &lt;font color=&quot;#000000&quot;&gt;escapedValues&lt;/font&gt; is created as String array, but assigned to Object array&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&lt;font color=&quot;#0033b3&quot;&gt;final &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font color=&quot;#000000&quot;&gt;Object&lt;/font&gt;[] &lt;font color=&quot;#000000&quot;&gt;escapedValues &lt;/font&gt;= &lt;font color=&quot;#0033b3&quot;&gt;new &lt;/font&gt;String&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;values.size()&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;later Object returned from escape is attempted to store into (String) array:&lt;/p&gt;



&lt;p&gt;&lt;font color=&quot;#000000&quot;&gt;escapedValues&lt;/font&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;idx++&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt; = escape(&lt;font color=&quot;#000000&quot;&gt;v&lt;/font&gt;, transformer);&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Suggested solution is to create escapedValues as Object array:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&lt;font color=&quot;#0033b3&quot;&gt;final &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font color=&quot;#000000&quot;&gt;Object&lt;/font&gt;[] &lt;font color=&quot;#000000&quot;&gt;escapedValues &lt;/font&gt;= &lt;font color=&quot;#0033b3&quot;&gt;new &lt;/font&gt;Object&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;values.size()&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;;&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13384693">CONFIGURATION-808</key>
            <summary>DefaultListDelimiterHandler.escapeList working only for List&lt;String&gt;</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="4" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/minor.svg">Minor</priority>
                        <status id="5" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/resolved.png" description="A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.">Resolved</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="cigaly">Cedomir Igaly</reporter>

<item>
            <title>[CONFIGURATION-807] Method addProperty don&apos;t work if the property not exist in the file</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CONFIGURATION-807</link>
                <project id="12310467" key="CONFIGURATION">Commons Configuration</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;The method addProperty not append a NEW property in the file when the property not exist.&lt;br/&gt;
 I work with java 7.&lt;br/&gt;
 I see that the new property don&apos;t compare in keys list, and when the property is new.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Example:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
PropertiesConfiguration config = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; PropertiesConfiguration();
PropertiesConfigurationLayout layout = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; PropertiesConfigurationLayout(); 
layout.load(config, &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; InputStreamReader(&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; FileInputStream(zookeeper))); 
&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt; port = instance.getPort();

config.setProperty(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;clientPort&quot;&lt;/span&gt;, port); 
config.addProperty(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;prova&quot;&lt;/span&gt;,&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;prova&quot;&lt;/span&gt;); 
layout.save(config, &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; FileWriter(zookeeper));
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;The property &apos;prova&apos; don&apos;t appear in the file property after the save.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I see in&#160;PropertiesConfigurationLayout.save, line 565, that the method&#160; &apos;getKeys&apos; don&apos;t contain the property &apos;prova&apos;, and the save lost this property.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13377147">CONFIGURATION-807</key>
            <summary>Method addProperty don&apos;t work if the property not exist in the file</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="5" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/resolved.png" description="A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.">Resolved</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="vega883">Marco Di Falco</reporter>

                            <comment id="17340605" author="vega883" created="Fri, 7 May 2021 06:37:28 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Hi Christian.&lt;br/&gt;
I&apos;m sorry, i don&apos;t have idea. I am a user same you &lt;img class=&quot;emoticon&quot; src=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/emoticons/sad.png&quot; height=&quot;16&quot; width=&quot;16&quot; align=&quot;absmiddle&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; border=&quot;0&quot;/&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="17340693" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Fri, 7 May 2021 09:22:42 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;The problem is that you use the wrong method to save the modified configuration. Do not call &lt;em&gt;save()&lt;/em&gt; on the layout, but on the configuration object. See &lt;a href=&quot;https://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-configuration/userguide_v1.10/howto_properties.html#Saving&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-configuration/userguide_v1.10/howto_properties.html#Saving&lt;/a&gt;.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="17340710" author="vega883" created="Fri, 7 May 2021 10:09:38 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Hi Oliver&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I use this library&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
&amp;lt;dependency&amp;gt;
 &amp;lt;groupId&amp;gt;org.apache.commons&amp;lt;/groupId&amp;gt;
 &amp;lt;artifactId&amp;gt;commons-configuration2&amp;lt;/artifactId&amp;gt; 
 &amp;lt;version&amp;gt;2.7&amp;lt;/version&amp;gt; 
&amp;lt;/dependency&amp;gt;&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;and i dont&apos;have the costructor that you see me&lt;br/&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;image-wrap&quot; style=&quot;&quot;&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/13025151/13025151_image-2021-05-07-12-06-03-339.png&quot; style=&quot;border: 0px solid black&quot; /&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br/&gt;
and&#160; i don&apos;t have the method save in PropertiesConfiguration Object&lt;br/&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;image-wrap&quot; style=&quot;&quot;&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/13025152/13025152_image-2021-05-07-12-09-33-450.png&quot; style=&quot;border: 0px solid black&quot; /&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br/&gt;
mistake i the library?&lt;br/&gt;
Thanks.&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="17340900" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Fri, 7 May 2021 15:47:23 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Sorry, my bad. I sent you a link to the old version of the user guide. &lt;a href=&quot;https://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-configuration/userguide/howto_filebased.html#File_Operations_on_Configurations&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;This page&lt;/a&gt; describes how to save a configuration object. But the fundamental problem remains that you need to save the configuration and not the layout object.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>

<item>
            <title>[CONFIGURATION-799] getKeys() can throw NoSuchElementException</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CONFIGURATION-799</link>
                <project id="12310467" key="CONFIGURATION">Commons Configuration</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;&lt;tt&gt;AbstractConfiguration#getKeys()&lt;/tt&gt; can throw &lt;tt&gt;NoSuchElementException&lt;/tt&gt;&#160;for certain configurations. Example is below, note &lt;tt&gt;addConfiguration(conf1, null, &quot;&quot;)&lt;/tt&gt; where &lt;tt&gt;at&lt;/tt&gt; argument is blank.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
BaseConfiguration conf1 = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; BaseConfiguration();
conf1.addProperty(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;x1&quot;&lt;/span&gt;, 1);

CombinedConfiguration conf2 = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; CombinedConfiguration();
conf2.addConfiguration(conf1, &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;null&lt;/span&gt;, &quot;&quot;);

&lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// Following line &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;throws&lt;/span&gt; NoSuchElementException
&lt;/span&gt;conf2.getKeys();
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</description>
                <environment>&lt;p&gt;Java 11&lt;/p&gt;</environment>
        <key id="13366526">CONFIGURATION-799</key>

<item>
            <title>[CONFIGURATION-798] &quot;Cannot locate configuration source&quot; When server reboot</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CONFIGURATION-798</link>
                <project id="12310467" key="CONFIGURATION">Commons Configuration</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;I have a Jetty proxy server. When the process is started, the plug-ins in the /service directory are loaded. Each plug-in directory contains a spring context.xml file and a configuration file. After the Linux host is restarted, the following exception occurs when the proxy server is started to load the configuration file:&lt;br/&gt;
 org.apache.commons.configuration.ConfigurationException: Cannot locate configuration source /opt/oss/proxy/service/ram/ram.properties&lt;br/&gt;
 at org.apache.commons.configuration.AbstractFileConfiguration.load(AbstractFileConfiguration.java:259)&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;My code is as follows. Another point of confusion is that I define the configuration file in the context.xml file of spring, and the file can be loaded properly. Could you help me with that? Thank you very much.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;public void onAddNew(File dir, String pluginName, ProxyServletContext context) {&lt;br/&gt;
 try&lt;/p&gt;

{ String location = &quot;file:&quot; + dir.getPath() + File.separator + pluginName + CONTEXT_SUFFIX; ClassPathXmlApplicationContext context = new ClassPathXmlApplicationContext(location); PropertiesConfiguration config = new PropertiesConfiguration(directory.getCanonicalPath() + File.separator + pluginName + File.separator + pluginName+ &quot;.properties&quot;); contextHandler.addServlet(context.createServlet(), context.getPathSpec()); }

&lt;p&gt;catch (Exception e) {&lt;br/&gt;
 LOGGER.warn(&quot;unexpected exception while adding new servlet: {} &quot;, context.getName(), e);&lt;br/&gt;
 }&lt;br/&gt;
 }&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The configuration in the ram-context.xml file is as follows:&lt;br/&gt;
 &amp;lt;context:property-placeholder&lt;br/&gt;
 location=&quot;file:#{systemProperties&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;&amp;#39;rootDir&amp;#39;&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;}/service/ram/ram.properties&quot;/&amp;gt;&lt;/p&gt;</description>

            <title>[CONFIGURATION-796] commons-configuration2 2.7 Parameters properties() failed on NoSuchMethodError  org.apache.commons.text.lookup.StringLookupFactory.base64DecoderStringLookup()</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CONFIGURATION-796</link>
                <project id="12310467" key="CONFIGURATION">Commons Configuration</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;Updating from commons-configuration2 2.2 to 2.7&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The code below&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
Parameters params = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; Parameters(); Parameters params = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; Parameters(); FileBasedConfigurationBuilder&amp;lt;FileBasedConfiguration&amp;gt; builder = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; FileBasedConfigurationBuilder&amp;lt;FileBasedConfiguration&amp;gt;( MyPropertiesConfiguration.class).configure(params.properties().setFileName(fileName));&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

                            <comment id="17222897" author="doryo" created="Thu, 29 Oct 2020 13:16:09 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;In my tests I checked that other common-text will not exists from other dependencies and put commons-configuration2 first in the dependency order.&lt;/p&gt;

<item>
            <title>[CONFIGURATION-795] Blank lines before always 0 for first property despite header comment</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CONFIGURATION-795</link>
                <project id="12310467" key="CONFIGURATION">Commons Configuration</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;Given a properties file like the one described in &lt;a href=&quot;https://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-configuration/apidocs/org/apache/commons/configuration2/PropertiesConfigurationLayout.html&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;PropertiesConfigurationLayout&lt;/a&gt;:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;preformatted panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;preformattedHeader panelHeader&quot; style=&quot;border-bottom-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;b&gt;demo.properties&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;preformattedContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre&gt; # A demo configuration file
 # for Demo App 1.42

 # Application name
 AppName=Demo App

 # Application vendor
 AppVendor=DemoSoft


 # GUI properties
 # Window Color
 windowColors=0xFFFFFF,0x000000

 # Include some setting
 include=settings.properties
 # Another vendor
 AppVendor=TestSoft
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;The documentation states&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;blockquote&gt;&lt;p&gt;For the property &lt;tt&gt;AppName&lt;/tt&gt; one comment line and one leading blanc line is stored.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/blockquote&gt;
&lt;p&gt;But the format actually thinks there is no leading blank line for &lt;tt&gt;AppName&lt;/tt&gt; :&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; PropertiesConfiguration properties = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; Configurations().properties(&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; File(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;demo.properties&quot;&lt;/span&gt;));

&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;int&lt;/span&gt; blankLinesBefore = properties.getLayout().getBlancLinesBefore(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;AppName&quot;&lt;/span&gt;);
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;assert&lt;/span&gt; blankLinesBefore == 1 : &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;Blank lines before &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;for&lt;/span&gt; first property not correct&quot;&lt;/span&gt;;
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13336888">CONFIGURATION-795</key>
            <summary>Blank lines before always 0 for first property despite header comment</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="daniel@peger.de">Daniel H. Peger</reporter>

                    </labels>

                                    <component>Format</component>
                        <due></due>

Peger&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

<item>
            <title>[CONFIGURATION-794] Unclosed file handle when reading config from JAR file URL</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CONFIGURATION-794</link>
                <project id="12310467" key="CONFIGURATION">Commons Configuration</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;We read a properties file which is included in a JAR file. Unfortunately we cannot find any method to close the opened file handle after reading the properties.&lt;br/&gt;
This currently means that the JAR file can only be deleted after the JVM shuts down. I&apos;ll open a PR which shows the behavior.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;We currently run our code mostly on Windows systems and Oracle JDK8.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;PR: &lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/apache/commons-configuration/pull/76&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://github.com/apache/commons-configuration/pull/76&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13334365">CONFIGURATION-794</key>
            <summary>Unclosed file handle when reading config from JAR file URL</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="5" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/resolved.png" description="A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.">Resolved</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="jansohn">Robin Jansohn</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Thu, 8 Oct 2020 07:19:46 +0000</created>
                <updated>Sat, 30 Jan 2021 19:49:00 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Tue, 13 Oct 2020 00:37:31 +0000</resolved>
                                    <version>2.7</version>
                                    <fixVersion>2.8.0</fixVersion>
                                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>3</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="17210100" author="jansohn" created="Thu, 8 Oct 2020 09:27:22 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Seems to be Windows specific as we cannot reproduce the behavior when running on Linux...&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="17211801" author="garydgregory" created="Sat, 10 Oct 2020 23:39:28 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Added test testGetConfigurationLoadFromJarFile().&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="17211870" author="sebb@apache.org" created="Sun, 11 Oct 2020 10:19:04 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Windows locks JAR files when it opens them; this prevents deletion.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Linux does not prevent deletion of open files.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="17211884" author="spoor" created="Sun, 11 Oct 2020 11:47:51 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;I&apos;ve done some investigation, and the problem lies here, in &lt;tt&gt;FileHandler.load&lt;/tt&gt;:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;        InputStream in = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;null&lt;/span&gt;;

        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;try&lt;/span&gt;
        {
            in = FileLocatorUtils.obtainFileSystem(locator).getInputStream(url);
            loadFromStream(in, locator.getEncoding(), url);
        }
        ...
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;finally&lt;/span&gt;
        {
            closeSilent(in);
        }
    }&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;&lt;tt&gt;closeSilent&lt;/tt&gt; calls the following &lt;tt&gt;close&lt;/tt&gt; method:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;    &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;class &lt;/span&gt;JarURLInputStream &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;extends&lt;/span&gt; java.io.FilterInputStream {
        JarURLInputStream (InputStream src) {
            &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;super&lt;/span&gt; (src);
        }
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; void close () &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;throws&lt;/span&gt; IOException {
            &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;try&lt;/span&gt; {
                &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;super&lt;/span&gt;.close();
            } &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;finally&lt;/span&gt; {
                &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;if&lt;/span&gt; (!getUseCaches()) {
                    jarFile.close();
                }
            }
        }
    }&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;Here, &lt;tt&gt;getUseCaches()&lt;/tt&gt; returns &lt;tt&gt;true&lt;/tt&gt;, so the JAR file is not closed.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;A quick fix, in &lt;tt&gt;DefaultFileSystem.getInputStream&lt;/tt&gt;:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;//            &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;return&lt;/span&gt; url.openStream();
&lt;/span&gt;            URLConnection connection = url.openConnection();
            connection.setUseCaches(&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;false&lt;/span&gt;);
            &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;return&lt;/span&gt; connection.getInputStream();&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;However, this definitely requires more consideration, as it disables caching and therefore will open the JAR file every time.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="17211911" author="garydgregory" created="Sun, 11 Oct 2020 13:20:12 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;We should surface this option IMO so that we can disable caching in tests at least. We can keep the default behavior as is if this ends up working.  &lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;WDYT?&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="17211957" author="spoor" created="Sun, 11 Oct 2020 16:05:10 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Do you mean adding a flag somewhere to disable the caching, with caching enabled by default? Because I ran the failing test, and it succeeded with the quick fix applied. I didn&apos;t try any of the other tests so it&apos;s possible there could be failures, although I think it isn&apos;t likely.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I think a flag would make sense. In most cases, there is no need to replace JAR files while the JVM is active. I&apos;ve never had this problem when using Commons Configuration inside JEE applications on Windows; EARs could be redeployed without any issues. If people need the option to have JAR files hot-swappable, then they could just set the flag, accepting the (possible) performance hit.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="17212750" author="garydgregory" created="Tue, 13 Oct 2020 00:37:31 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;This fix requires you to disable caching, you will need to update code (from the test), from, for example:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; FileBasedConfigurationBuilder&amp;lt;PropertiesConfiguration&amp;gt; builder = 
            &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; FileBasedConfigurationBuilder&amp;lt;&amp;gt;(PropertiesConfiguration.class)
                .configure(&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; FileBasedBuilderParametersImpl()
                .setURL(url));
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;to:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; FileBasedConfigurationBuilder&amp;lt;PropertiesConfiguration&amp;gt; builder = 
            &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; FileBasedConfigurationBuilder&amp;lt;&amp;gt;(PropertiesConfiguration.class)
                .configure(&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; FileBasedBuilderParametersImpl()
                .setURL(url, &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; URLConnectionOptions().setUseCaches(&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;false&lt;/span&gt;)));
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;Note the use of &lt;tt&gt;FileBasedBuilderProperties&lt;/tt&gt;&apos;s&lt;br/&gt;
 &lt;tt&gt;setURL(URL, URLConnectionOptions)&lt;/tt&gt; &lt;br/&gt;
 instead of &lt;br/&gt;
 &lt;tt&gt;setURL(URL)&lt;/tt&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="17213080" author="jansohn" created="Tue, 13 Oct 2020 12:04:57 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Thanks for investigating and fixing!&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                    </comments>

<item>
            <title>[CONFIGURATION-793] Error reading a list of complex objects from JSON after 2.3</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CONFIGURATION-793</link>
                <project id="12310467" key="CONFIGURATION">Commons Configuration</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;We have just attempted to move from version 2.2 to 2.7 and have encountered and issue whilst attempting to read a List from a JSON formatted configuration file.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The issue appears to have been introduced in 2.3.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Adding the following tests to org.apache.commons.configuration2.TestJSONConfiguration will demonstrate the change.&#160; These tests will pass against 2.2 but fail agains 2.3 (and 2.7.)&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CONFIGURATION-686&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CONFIGURATION-686&lt;/a&gt; appears to have fixed access to lists of complex objects using the dot notation for strings (see testGetProperty_dictionaryInList() in TestJSONConfiguration) but has broken access to the list of complex objects.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;preformatted panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;preformattedContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre&gt;@Test
public void testGetList_nested_with_list()
{
    assertEquals(Arrays.asList(&quot;col1&quot;, &quot;col2&quot;),
                 jsonConfiguration.getList(String.class, &quot;key4.key5&quot;));
}

@Test
public void testGetList() {
    final List&amp;lt;Map&amp;gt; configList = jsonConfiguration.getList(Map.class, &quot;capitals&quot;);

    assertEquals(configList.size(), 2);
    assertEquals(configList.get(0).get(&quot;country&quot;), &quot;USA&quot;);
    assertEquals(configList.get(0).get(&quot;capital&quot;), &quot;Washington&quot;);
    assertEquals(configList.get(1).get(&quot;country&quot;), &quot;UK&quot;);
    assertEquals(configList.get(1).get(&quot;capital&quot;), &quot;London&quot;);
}
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment>&lt;p&gt;JDK 11.0.4&lt;/p&gt;</environment>
        <key id="13329773">CONFIGURATION-793</key>
            <summary>Error reading a list of complex objects from JSON after 2.3</summary>

<item>
            <title>[CONFIGURATION-792] commons-configuration 1.10 breaks code that worked with 1.9</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CONFIGURATION-792</link>
                <project id="12310467" key="CONFIGURATION">Commons Configuration</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CONFIGURATION-556&quot; title=&quot;Regression with SystemProperties in 1.8 and 1.9&quot; class=&quot;issue-link&quot; data-issue-key=&quot;CONFIGURATION-556&quot;&gt;&lt;del&gt;CONFIGURATION-556&lt;/del&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&#160;changed how ConfigurationConverter.getConfiguration works: in 1.9, the Properties content was read into a newly created HashMap but in 1.10 this was changed to use the Properties as backing.&#160; While this allows to have changes to the Properties immediately reflected in the configuration, it breaks code that adds new entries to such a configuration.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Example:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
Properties properties = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; Properties();
properties.load(Files.newInputStream(Paths.get(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;sample.properties&quot;&lt;/span&gt;)));
Configuration conf = ConfigurationConverter.getConfiguration(properties);
conf.setProperty(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;version&quot;&lt;/span&gt;, &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;1.10&quot;&lt;/span&gt;);
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;will work in 1.9 but result in a NPE in 1.10.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I understand that there are conflicting goals (compatibility with 1.7 or 1.9) but I think this should minimally be listed as a potential problem for upgrades to 1.10&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13321376">CONFIGURATION-792</key>

<item>
            <title>[CONFIGURATION-791] ReloadingCombinedConfigurationBuilder not properly initialized upon definition changed</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CONFIGURATION-791</link>
                <project id="12310467" key="CONFIGURATION">Commons Configuration</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;I think I found an issue in &lt;tt&gt;ReloadingCombinedConfigurationBuilder&lt;/tt&gt; when configuration definition had changed. When definition being changed, the builder&apos;s &lt;tt&gt;reset()&lt;/tt&gt; method is called causing the builder&apos;s configuration parameters are resetted as well. That causes the builder cannot create the Configuration object, when some custom configuration has been used.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;For example this code causes the problem, because when reset occurs, additional providers are forgotten.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
Parameters parameters = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; Parameters();
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;return&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; CustomCombinedConfigurationBuilder()
    .configure(parameters.combined()
        .setDefinitionBuilderParameters(parameters.hierarchical()
            .setFile(file)
            .setExpressionEngine(expressionEngine)
            .setListDelimiterHandler(listDelimiterHandler))
        .registerProvider(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;database&quot;&lt;/span&gt;, &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; DatabaseConfigurationProvider())
        .registerProvider(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;yaml&quot;&lt;/span&gt;, &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; YamlConfigurationProvider()));
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;Moreover, when the definition structure had changed, the new child builders are created, but the existing combined builder&apos;s &lt;tt&gt;ReloadingController&lt;/tt&gt; still holds the original child builders but not the newly created. This causes the child configuration builders do not detect changes anymore. &lt;br/&gt;
 This can be simply solved by resetting the reloading controller in &lt;tt&gt;resetParameters()&lt;/tt&gt; method to force its re-creation. Following code can fix that:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;class &lt;/span&gt;ReloadingCombinedConfigurationBuilder &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;extends&lt;/span&gt;
        CombinedConfigurationBuilder &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;implements&lt;/span&gt; ReloadingControllerSupport {
    
    @Override
    &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;synchronized&lt;/span&gt; void resetParameters() {
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;super&lt;/span&gt;.resetParameters();
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;this&lt;/span&gt;.reloadingController = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;null&lt;/span&gt;;
    }
}
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13316767">CONFIGURATION-791</key>
            <summary>ReloadingCombinedConfigurationBuilder not properly initialized upon definition changed</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="4" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/minor.svg">Minor</priority>
                        <status id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/open.png" description="The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.">Open</status>
                    <statusCategory id="2" key="new" colorName="blue-gray"/>
                                    <resolution id="-1">Unresolved</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="havis">Tomas Havelka</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Tue, 14 Jul 2020 20:10:08 +0000</created>
                <updated>Wed, 15 Jul 2020 14:54:26 +0000</updated>
                                            <version>2.7</version>
                                                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>2</watches>
                                                                <comments>

&lt;p&gt;May you please provide a PR on GitHub at&#160;&lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/apache/commons-configuration&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://github.com/apache/commons-configuration&lt;/a&gt;&#160;?&lt;/p&gt;</comment>

<item>
            <title>[CONFIGURATION-788] AbstractHierarchicalFileConfiguration can lose data when #save() is interrupted by JVM abort/power failure</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CONFIGURATION-788</link>
                <project id="12310467" key="CONFIGURATION">Commons Configuration</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;When saving the current configuration, either using any of the #save() Methods or when setting a property while auto-save is enabled the method AbstractFileConfiguration#save(URL) effectively wipes the file content when opening the OutputStream.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;If the JVM gets destroyed or the machine powered down before the new configuration has been serialized to the file an empty file remains with no configuration at all.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I&apos;ve created a patch on top of the RELEASE_1_10_BRANCH which introduces a mitigation. The mitigation consists of a &quot;keep backup&quot; flag in AbstractFileConfiguration which, if set, creates a copy of the current configuration file before writing into it.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;When a configuration exception occurs upon loading the configuration again the exception will be caught and loading of the backup is attempted first before rethrowing the exception when this fails as well.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;To allow existing implementations to profit from this without touching all instances a global flag has been added to AbstractHierarchicalFileConfiguration which is then inherited by all future delegates added to any instance of AbstractHierarchicalFileConfiguration.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Four unit tests for this mitigation feature have been added to TestHierarchicalXMLConfiguration.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I&apos;ve uploaded a repository with the commit to github: &lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/noamik/commons-configuration/tree/RELEASE_1_11_BRANCH&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://github.com/noamik/commons-configuration/tree/RELEASE_1_11_BRANCH&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment>&lt;p&gt;This occurs in any environment with any use of AbstractFileConfiguration#save(), AbstractFileConfiguration#save(URL) or AbstractFileConfiguration#save(File).&lt;/p&gt;</environment>
        <key id="13295052">CONFIGURATION-788</key>
            <summary>AbstractHierarchicalFileConfiguration can lose data when #save() is interrupted by JVM abort/power failure</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="2">Won&apos;t Fix</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="cnoamik">Michael Noack</reporter>
                        <labels>
                            <label>newbie</label>
                    </labels>
                <created>Mon, 30 Mar 2020 17:03:49 +0000</created>
                <updated>Mon, 27 Apr 2020 13:52:15 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Mon, 27 Apr 2020 13:52:15 +0000</resolved>
                                    <version>1.10</version>
                                                    <component>File reloading</component>
                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>2</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="17071156" author="cnoamik" created="Mon, 30 Mar 2020 17:11:05 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;I didn&apos;t go all the way to make the new feature available for JDK1.5. I&apos;ve used features from Java 7 (notably java.nio). I&apos;ve used fully qualified class name though, thus any user of JDK1.5 should still be able to use the binary result. The new feature can&apos;t be used without a JDK 1.7 or newer. To compile a JDK 1.7 is needed as well.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;This might not meet requirements. I still wanted to share the code and issue description as the actual issue has been plaguing us for quite some time before I found the root cause. Someone else might profit from this, even if the patch gets rejected.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="17071250" author="garydgregory" created="Mon, 30 Mar 2020 20:17:23 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Hi&#160;&lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/ViewProfile.jspa?name=cnoamik&quot; class=&quot;user-hover&quot; rel=&quot;cnoamik&quot;&gt;Michael Noack&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Please provide your proposal as a PR here&#160;&lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/apache/commons-configuration&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://github.com/apache/commons-configuration&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="17071589" author="cnoamik" created="Tue, 31 Mar 2020 08:26:54 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Found and fixed a potential NPE when using the new feature. Patch 0002 addresses the issue.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="17071595" author="cnoamik" created="Tue, 31 Mar 2020 08:40:55 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;I&apos;ve created the pull request against branch RELEASE_1_10_BRANCH because this is the branch I&apos;ve been working of from: &lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/apache/commons-configuration/pull/44&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://github.com/apache/commons-configuration/pull/44&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Since repositories out there already contain a release version 1.10 one might want to add this to a new RELEASE_1_11_BRANCH though. At least that is what I&apos;ve done internally. As much as I can tell the public build system for this branch no longer works. It reports 37 failed unit tests. For our own use I&apos;ve resorted to monkey patching the 1.10-release jars to work around this issue.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="17071675" author="cnoamik" created="Tue, 31 Mar 2020 10:53:40 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;To clarify: I&apos;ve resorted to monkey patching because I was unable to get the workspace to build without deleting some other unrelated features which were using dependencies which aren&apos;t declared in the pom. From the name of the missing classes and some googling I suspect that the missing dependencies are actually classes introduced in commons-configuration 2.x. Since I&apos;ve only touched four files I&apos;ve decided to use the 1.10 release as is and to only update the classes in question.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I was able to get the unit tests testing the files I&apos;ve changed to work and have been able to add working unit tests for the new feature. I&apos;ve then build a jar file ignoring the tests during the build process. After building this jar I&apos;ve extracted the classes created by those four changed files and repackaged the 1.10-release jar with those new files as a 1.11 version manually updating the Manifests and pom files. After manually injecting them into our internal Artifactory I was able to use this monkey patched version in our product and able to verify it still works as expected.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;If there was a way to get the old branch to compile in its entirety and to run all unit tests successfully this would of course be the preferred way to build a new release. So far I&apos;ve been unsuccessful to do this with the RELEASE_1_10_BRANCH and it looks like the public build system used by Apache isn&apos;t able to run all unit tests either. If I&apos;m not mistaken it reports 37 failed unit tests.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="17071700" author="cnoamik" created="Tue, 31 Mar 2020 11:39:37 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;The class which I was unable to get to build was &quot;org.apache.commons.configuration.plist.PropertyListConfiguration&quot; where PropertyListConfiguration#load(Reader) was unable to resolve the classes &quot;PropertyListParser&quot; and the exception thrown by it &quot;ParseException&quot;. The best match I could find was: &lt;a href=&quot;https://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-configuration/xref/org/apache/commons/configuration2/plist/PropertyListParser.html&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-configuration/xref/org/apache/commons/configuration2/plist/PropertyListParser.html&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="17071715" author="cnoamik" created="Tue, 31 Mar 2020 12:05:35 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Source for build failing: &lt;a href=&quot;https://travis-ci.org/github/apache/commons-configuration/builds/226884677&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://travis-ci.org/github/apache/commons-configuration/builds/226884677&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I misinterpreted the build number of the failed build as the number of failed unit tests.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="17071820" author="garydgregory" created="Tue, 31 Mar 2020 14:11:58 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Hi&#160;&lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/ViewProfile.jspa?name=cnoamik&quot; class=&quot;user-hover&quot; rel=&quot;cnoamik&quot;&gt;Michael Noack&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;WRT&#160;&lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CONFIGURATION-788?focusedCommentId=17071156&amp;amp;page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-17071156&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CONFIGURATION-788?focusedCommentId=17071156&amp;amp;page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-17071156&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;If you look at the POM, you&apos;ll see that Commons Configuration requires Java 8 or higher. No any talk or work about Java 5 through 7 is a waste.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="17071829" author="garydgregory" created="Tue, 31 Mar 2020 14:21:49 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Oops, I did not realize that you are talking about the 1.x branch; is that really the case? As opposed to 2.x?&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I am doubtful that we&apos;ll release anything from the 1.x line unless a CVE shows up. At least 1.x is nowhere on my to-do list.&#160;&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="17071868" author="cnoamik" created="Tue, 31 Mar 2020 15:05:18 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Yes, I&apos;m specifically talking about 1.x&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I know it&apos;s really really old. We just had so much trouble with this that I thought it would be a good idea to leave some trace of what we found publicly available and researchable to anyone affected by this as well. I really don&apos;t mind if you wouldn&apos;t do any further 1.x releases.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I on the other hand do have updating to current version of commons-* on my TODO list, but unfortunately that&apos;s way down. That&apos;s why I invested the time to track down the source of the issues we saw. I&apos;m totally fine with this getting closed as &quot;Won&apos;t fix&quot; or something.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="17072017" author="garydgregory" created="Tue, 31 Mar 2020 17:49:40 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Thank you for clarifying. 2.x should be the way forward, especially if you are expecting new features or fixes.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="17072056" author="cnoamik" created="Tue, 31 Mar 2020 18:33:58 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;I just wanted to add that we didn&apos;t build anything new with it. The product using it is itself almost two decades old. It has had this dependency for at least a decade. We have worked around the issue externally in the past but it kept reappearing as new developers joined the project unaware of it. This is why I decided to fix it where it occurs to have anyone profit from it automatically.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;We certainly will move up to 2.x as soon as we can. Should the 2.x version be susceptible to it as well I will most likely provide a similar fix.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>

<item>
            <title>[CONFIGURATION-786] ReloadingCombinedConfigurationBuilder needs to clear the reloadingController on resetParameters()</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CONFIGURATION-786</link>
                <project id="12310467" key="CONFIGURATION">Commons Configuration</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;Modifying the &lt;em&gt;configuration definition file&lt;/em&gt; causes &lt;tt&gt;CombinedConfigurationBuilder.resetParameters()&lt;/tt&gt; to be called. This cleans up and clears the &lt;tt&gt;sourceData&lt;/tt&gt; variable which causes the next invocation of&#160;&lt;tt&gt;initResultInstance()&lt;/tt&gt; to create new child &lt;tt&gt;ConfigurationBuilder&lt;/tt&gt; instances.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;However,&#160;&lt;tt&gt;ReloadingCombinedConfigurationBuilder.reloadingController&lt;/tt&gt; is not cleared (not set to null) and, as such, reloading stops working until a full restart.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I have worked around this by using reflection to set&#160;&lt;tt&gt;ReloadingCombinedConfigurationBuilder.reloadingController&lt;/tt&gt; to null when&#160;&lt;tt&gt;resetParameters()&lt;/tt&gt; is called, but perhaps further thought is required vis-a-vis a fix because re-creating the&#160;&lt;tt&gt;reloadingController&#160;&lt;/tt&gt; means that any attached&#160;&lt;tt&gt;PeriodicReloadingTrigger&lt;/tt&gt; instances need to be shut down and re-created too (which is what I&apos;m currently doing to make all this work).&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13292569">CONFIGURATION-786</key>
            <summary>ReloadingCombinedConfigurationBuilder needs to clear the reloadingController on resetParameters()</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>

<item>
            <title>[CONFIGURATION-782] OverrideCombiner does not work properly when key contains list</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CONFIGURATION-782</link>
                <project id="12310467" key="CONFIGURATION">Commons Configuration</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;It seems that the&#160;OverrideCombiner does not work properly in some cases when key contains a list. The problem is best illustrated with an example:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;In your Base Config File you following key values:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;idp.auth.methods = NO-BANKID, NO-BANKID-MOBILE&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;And in our Specialty configuration, the one that overrides duplicates in the base config file contains following key:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;idp.auth.methods.1443 =&#160;SE-BANKID, SE-BANKID-MOBILE&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The expected result after combining these two configuration files would be:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;idp.auth.methods = NO-BANKID, NO-BANKID-MOBILE&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;idp.auth.methods.1443 =&#160;SE-BANKID, SE-BANKID-MOBILE&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;However the actual result of current implementation is as follows:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;idp.auth.methods.1443 =&#160;SE-BANKID, SE-BANKID-MOBILE&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;So even though that the config file that overrides the base configuration file does not have any overriding configuration for idp.auth.methods. The config in the base config connected to key idp.autyh.methods are not added to the combined configuration.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;If this is not a bug but a feature, then i would like to know which combiner i should use as it is not obvious from the documentation. The objective is to be able to have one file that contains extra configuration which also can include configuration keys that should override configuration keys from the base configuration file.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13289479">CONFIGURATION-782</key>
            <summary>OverrideCombiner does not work properly when key contains list</summary>

                                            <priority id="4" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/minor.svg">Minor</priority>
                        <status id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/open.png" description="The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.">Open</status>
                    <statusCategory id="2" key="new" colorName="blue-gray"/>
                                    <resolution id="-1">Unresolved</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="gisle.grimen@evry.com">Gisle Grimen</reporter>

<item>
            <title>[CONFIGURATION-781] The conversion handler is not inherited by children</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CONFIGURATION-781</link>
                <project id="12310467" key="CONFIGURATION">Commons Configuration</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;If a setting is requested from a configuration with a custom converter, the custom converter will be invoked for all conversions as expected, even if the key points to an element in a INI section/XML child element, etcetera.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;If the INI section or XML child element is requested using the&#160;ImmutableHierarchicalConfiguration.immutableConfigurationAt() or a similar method and the property is requested from the child configuration, then the DefaultConversionHandler is used to perform the conversion.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The attached source demonstrates this behaviour: the last get() causes a&#160;ConversionException instead of returning the requested Duration.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I noticed that the conversion handler is not copied in BaseHierarchicalConfiguration.initSubConfiguration(). It should probably be added there, but I do not know if there are more locations were the conversion handler should be copied as well.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

<item>
            <title>[CONFIGURATION-769] commons configuration addProperty method replaces &lt; &gt; with &amp;lt &amp;gt</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CONFIGURATION-769</link>
                <project id="12310467" key="CONFIGURATION">Commons Configuration</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;I am using latest Apache commons configuration 2 version 2.6 and when trying to invoke addProperty it replaces &amp;lt; &amp;gt; with &amp;amp;lt &amp;amp;gt.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;example :&lt;br/&gt;
cfg.addProperty(&quot;data.array(0).var(0)&quot;,&#160;&#160;&quot;&amp;lt;var name=myds1&amp;gt;&quot;&#160;);&lt;br/&gt;
cfg.write(new FileWriter(this.XmlFile));&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Here cfg is XMLConfiguration Object&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The resulting xml is :&lt;br/&gt;
&#160;{{            &amp;lt;var&amp;gt;&amp;lt;var name=myds1&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/var&amp;gt;}}&lt;br/&gt;
Expected is :&lt;br/&gt;
&#160;{{            &quot;&amp;lt;var name=myds1&amp;gt;&quot;}}&lt;br/&gt;
&#160;&lt;br/&gt;
&#160;&lt;br/&gt;
&#160;&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13268080">CONFIGURATION-769</key>

            <title>[CONFIGURATION-768] XMLConfiguration#write does not indent XML elements.</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CONFIGURATION-768</link>
                <project id="12310467" key="CONFIGURATION">Commons Configuration</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;The method&#160;&lt;tt&gt;XMLConfiguration#write&lt;/tt&gt; does not indent XML elements.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13266008">CONFIGURATION-768</key>

                                                    <fixVersion>2.7</fixVersion>
                                        <due></due>

                            <comment id="16966307" author="garydgregory" created="Sun, 3 Nov 2019 23:40:13 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;In git master.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                    </comments>
                    <attachments>

<item>
            <title>[CONFIGURATION-767] NullPointerException in XMLConfiguration#createTransformer() when no FileLocator is set</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CONFIGURATION-767</link>
                <project id="12310467" key="CONFIGURATION">Commons Configuration</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;You get a &lt;tt&gt;NullPointerException&lt;/tt&gt; in &lt;tt&gt;XMLConfiguration#createTransformer()&lt;/tt&gt; when no&#160;&lt;tt&gt;FileLocator&lt;/tt&gt; is set.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;For example:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
        XMLConfiguration xmlConfig = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; XMLConfiguration();
        xmlConfig.setRootElementName(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;IAmRoot&quot;&lt;/span&gt;);
        StringWriter sw = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; StringWriter();
        xmlConfig.write(sw);
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;Yields:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;preformatted panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;preformattedContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre&gt;java.lang.NullPointerException
	at org.apache.commons.configuration2.XMLConfiguration.createTransformer(XMLConfiguration.java:884)
	at org.apache.commons.configuration2.XMLConfiguration.write(XMLConfiguration.java:1045)
	...
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13266003">CONFIGURATION-767</key>
