<item>
            <title>[CONFIGURATION-766] BigDecimal(double) should not be used</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CONFIGURATION-766</link>
                <project id="12310467" key="CONFIGURATION">Commons Configuration</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;Static analysis with SonarQube shows a violation of rule&#160;[S2111|&lt;a href=&quot;https://rules.sonarsource.com/java/type/Bug/RSPEC-2111&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://rules.sonarsource.com/java/type/Bug/RSPEC-2111&lt;/a&gt;] - a dangerous use of the BigDecimal constructor.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Fixed by using BigDecimal.valueOf(param) instead.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment>&lt;p&gt;A single occurrence in file PropertyConverter.java, line 393:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;return&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; BigDecimal(n.doubleValue());
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</environment>
        <key id="13265002">CONFIGURATION-766</key>
            <summary>BigDecimal(double) should not be used</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="4" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/minor.svg">Minor</priority>
                        <status id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/open.png" description="The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.">Open</status>
                    <statusCategory id="2" key="new" colorName="blue-gray"/>
                                    <resolution id="-1">Unresolved</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="chtompki">Rob Tompkins</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="HarisAdzemovic">Haris Adzemovic</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Tue, 29 Oct 2019 10:18:50 +0000</created>
                <updated>Tue, 29 Oct 2019 23:00:07 +0000</updated>
                                                                                <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>3</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="16961865" author="harisadzemovic" created="Tue, 29 Oct 2019 10:19:57 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;This is my first issue + (soon to be) PR so if there are any issues with the submission, please let me know!&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16961867" author="garydgregory" created="Tue, 29 Oct 2019 10:21:45 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;PR on GitHub is welcome, with a unit test &lt;img class=&quot;emoticon&quot; src=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/emoticons/wink.png&quot; height=&quot;16&quot; width=&quot;16&quot; align=&quot;absmiddle&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; border=&quot;0&quot;/&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16961869" author="harisadzemovic" created="Tue, 29 Oct 2019 10:30:12 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Thank you for the quick reply!&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Seeing as how it is a one-line change and the error only shows up on static analysis, is a unit test necessary? The unit test would then show how the usage &lt;em&gt;could&lt;/em&gt; be dangerous and not really &quot;relate&quot; to the commons-configuration lib. It would be something akin to:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;assertEquals(new BigDecimal(0.1), 0.1)) &amp;lt;-- Fails&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;assertEquals(BigDecimal.valueOf(0.1), 0.1)) &amp;lt;-- Passes&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Should that still be included? Or is attaching a screenshot of the Sonarqube analysis showing the violation to this ticket a more suitable solution?&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16961890" author="alexherbert" created="Tue, 29 Oct 2019 10:54:50 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Just write the same test targeting the method in PropertyConverter. This currently fails:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
/**
 * Tests conversion to BigDecimal avoids the use of the BigDecimal constructor using a &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;double&lt;/span&gt;.
 */
@Test
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; void testToBigDecimal()
{
    &lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// If the conversion uses &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; BigDecimal(0.1) the result is not exact due to round off.
&lt;/span&gt;    &lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// The result is 0.1000000000000000055511151231257827021181583404541015625.
&lt;/span&gt;    &lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// See Sonar rule: https://rules.sonarsource.com/java/type/Bug/RSPEC-2111
&lt;/span&gt;    &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;double&lt;/span&gt; d = 0.1;
    assertEquals(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;Incorrect BigDecimal value&quot;&lt;/span&gt;, &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; BigDecimal(&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;Double&lt;/span&gt;.toString(d)), 
        PropertyConverter.toBigDecimal(d));
}
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16961933" author="harisadzemovic" created="Tue, 29 Oct 2019 12:03:55 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Thanks, Alex, that works wonderfully.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I also failed a test in&#160;testNumberConversions() with the error that &quot;42&quot; != &quot;42.0&quot;:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
assertEquals(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;Wrong DigDecimal returned&quot;&lt;/span&gt;, &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; BigDecimal(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;42&quot;&lt;/span&gt;), config .getBigDecimal(KEY_NUMBER));
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;The reason is that the .equals() method of BigDecimal, when comparing two BigDecimals, not only compares the numeric value but also their scale. Meanwhile, toBigDecimal makes the conversion Number.doubleValue() which will always return a number with one decimal (42.0).&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;So I wonder if it would be acceptable to change the test to &quot;42.0&quot; or if I should expand it to use the compareTo method and make sure that the numeric difference is 0?&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16961984" author="alexherbert" created="Tue, 29 Oct 2019 13:02:15 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;So there is an issue that conversion using Double.toString(double) always puts a decimal point in the output string. This results in BigDecimal having a different scale when constructed using &apos;BigDecimal.valueOf(double)&apos; rather than &apos;new BigDecimal(double)&apos;. This is even documented in the BigDecimal source code as a problem when using BigDecimal.valueOf(0.0) that it cannot return BigDecimal.ZERO.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;So in the following you test the double has a fractional part:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;static&lt;/span&gt; BigDecimal toBigDecimal(&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;Object&lt;/span&gt; value) &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;throws&lt;/span&gt; ConversionException
{
    &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;Number&lt;/span&gt; n = toNumber(value, BigDecimal.class);
    &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;if&lt;/span&gt; (n &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;instanceof&lt;/span&gt; BigDecimal)
    {
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;return&lt;/span&gt; (BigDecimal) n;
    }
    &lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// Avoid &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&apos;&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; BigDecimal(&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;double&lt;/span&gt;)&apos;&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;for&lt;/span&gt; non-integer valued doubles due to floating-point
&lt;/span&gt;    &lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// conversion errors.
&lt;/span&gt;    &lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// The BigDecimal constructor is used when a mathematical integer as the scale will
&lt;/span&gt;    &lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// be set appropriately without a forced decimal point.
&lt;/span&gt;    &lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// Note: &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;Math&lt;/span&gt;.rint(&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;double&lt;/span&gt;) works &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;for&lt;/span&gt; values outside the range of a &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;long&lt;/span&gt; but will ignore
&lt;/span&gt;    &lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// non-finite numbers. These will result in an exception from BigDecimal which cannot
&lt;/span&gt;    &lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// represent them.
&lt;/span&gt;    &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;double&lt;/span&gt; d = n.doubleValue();
    &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;return&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;Math&lt;/span&gt;.rint(d) == d ? &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; BigDecimal(d) : BigDecimal.valueOf(d);
}
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;This may not be the best solution but would fix the regression error. It may introduce a &apos;doubles should not be compared using equals&apos; alert from sonar which we can ignore; this is exactly what we intend.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Note that Math.rint will return the same value if the number is NaN or infinite and usually this should be tested for using Double.isFinite(double). However these have no meaning in BigDecimal and result in a NumberFormatException being thrown. This can be tested:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
@Test(expected = NumberFormatException.class)
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; void testToBigDecimalWithInfinity() {
    PropertyConverter.toBigDecimal(&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;Double&lt;/span&gt;.POSITIVE_INFINITY);
}
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;The alternative is to update the other failing test as you state to test against &quot;42.0&quot;.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/ViewProfile.jspa?name=ggregory&quot; class=&quot;user-hover&quot; rel=&quot;ggregory&quot;&gt;Gary D. Gregory&lt;/a&gt; What do you think?&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;ol&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;Use the simple fix to always use BigDecimal.valueOf(double) and update the other failing test.&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;Use a detection of the type of double to be represented and avoid the regression failure.&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;/ol&gt;
</comment>
                            <comment id="16962005" author="garydgregory" created="Tue, 29 Oct 2019 13:21:41 +0000"  >&lt;blockquote&gt;&lt;p&gt;Seeing as how it is a one-line change and the error only shows up on static analysis, is a unit test necessary?&#160;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/blockquote&gt;
&lt;p&gt;Never underestimate the side-effects of what might seem like a &quot;simple&quot; change. Had you run a build, you would have seen it fail &lt;img class=&quot;emoticon&quot; src=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/emoticons/wink.png&quot; height=&quot;16&quot; width=&quot;16&quot; align=&quot;absmiddle&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; border=&quot;0&quot;/&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16962018" author="garydgregory" created="Tue, 29 Oct 2019 13:36:46 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;I:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;ul&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;Added a test to document current behavior.&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;Added an ignored test from this ticket.&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;/ul&gt;


&lt;p&gt;Please rebase your PR on master.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The proposed change will break behavioral compatibility of course. I am wondering if we should:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;ul&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;Change the behavior per the proposal, or&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;Provide the new behavior via a new API (like &lt;tt&gt;toBigDecimalFoo&lt;/tt&gt; where &lt;tt&gt;Foo&lt;/tt&gt; is not meaningful post fix.&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;/ul&gt;


&lt;p&gt;I&apos;d also like feedback from &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/ViewProfile.jspa?name=chtompki&quot; class=&quot;user-hover&quot; rel=&quot;chtompki&quot;&gt;Rob Tompkins&lt;/a&gt;.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16962024" author="harisadzemovic" created="Tue, 29 Oct 2019 13:44:33 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;&lt;cite&gt;Had you run a build, you would have seen it fail&#160;&lt;/cite&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Indeed, it is quite embarrassing. Especially as I thought I did my due diligence but must have accidentally run the tests on un-altered code.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;But I learned that you have patience for newbies and will make sure to be more thorough next time! &lt;img class=&quot;emoticon&quot; src=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/emoticons/smile.png&quot; height=&quot;16&quot; width=&quot;16&quot; align=&quot;absmiddle&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; border=&quot;0&quot;/&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16962040" author="garydgregory" created="Tue, 29 Oct 2019 14:11:02 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/ViewProfile.jspa?name=HarisAdzemovic&quot; class=&quot;user-hover&quot; rel=&quot;HarisAdzemovic&quot;&gt;Haris Adzemovic&lt;/a&gt;,&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;All is well, that&apos;s what is great about having our builds run in GitHub Actions and Travis-CI, we can see if a PR breaks anything &lt;img class=&quot;emoticon&quot; src=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/emoticons/smile.png&quot; height=&quot;16&quot; width=&quot;16&quot; align=&quot;absmiddle&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; border=&quot;0&quot;/&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16962517" author="alexherbert" created="Tue, 29 Oct 2019 23:00:07 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;If this method is to be made more correct then the use of the BigDecimal double constructor does not allow all long integer values to be converted either (since double cannot represent every long). Same for BigInteger. These also fail in the current method:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
@Test
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; void testToBigDecimalLongConstructor()
{
    &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;long&lt;/span&gt; l = &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;Long&lt;/span&gt;.MAX_VALUE;
    assertEquals(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;Incorrect BigDecimal value&quot;&lt;/span&gt;, &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; BigDecimal(l), 
        PropertyConverter.toBigDecimal(l));
}

@Test
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; void testToBigDecimalBigIntegerConstructor()
{
    &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; BigInteger value = BigInteger.ONE.shiftLeft(64).add(BigInteger.ONE);
    assertEquals(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;Incorrect BigDecimal value&quot;&lt;/span&gt;, &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; BigDecimal(value), 
        PropertyConverter.toBigDecimal(value));
}
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;To fix this we can handle the expected return values from toNumber. These are either a BigDecimal (already done), a BigInteger or the object was already a Number instance. The case of BigInteger requires another instanceof check. To determine how to convert the remaining Number instances is a choice between the long or double representation. A simple solution is to round-trip to string and construct from that:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;static&lt;/span&gt; BigDecimal toBigDecimal(&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;Object&lt;/span&gt; value) &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;throws&lt;/span&gt; ConversionException
{
    &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;Number&lt;/span&gt; n = toNumber(value, BigDecimal.class);
    &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;if&lt;/span&gt; (n &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;instanceof&lt;/span&gt; BigDecimal)
    {
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;return&lt;/span&gt; (BigDecimal) n;
    }
    &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;if&lt;/span&gt; (n &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;instanceof&lt;/span&gt; BigInteger)
    {
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;return&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; BigDecimal((BigInteger) n);
    }
    &lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// At &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;this&lt;/span&gt; point the returned &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;Number&lt;/span&gt; from toNumber() was already an &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;instanceof&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;Number&lt;/span&gt;.
&lt;/span&gt;    &lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// The BigDecimal can be constructed from the number&apos;s &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;long&lt;/span&gt; or &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;double&lt;/span&gt; representation.
&lt;/span&gt;    &lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// Use the &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt; constructor to allow all &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;long&lt;/span&gt; values to be represented and correctly
&lt;/span&gt;    &lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// round &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;double&lt;/span&gt; values (avoiding the BigDecimal(&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;double&lt;/span&gt;) constructor).
&lt;/span&gt;    &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;return&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; BigDecimal(n.toString());
}
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</comment>
                    </comments>
                    <attachments>
                    </attachments>

<item>
            <title>[CONFIGURATION-764] Default date lookup can not work for some specific format</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CONFIGURATION-764</link>
                <project id="12310467" key="CONFIGURATION">Commons Configuration</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;When default date lookup is like: &lt;b&gt;${date:yyyyMM}/${date:ddHHmmss}&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;It will encounter one exception like:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&lt;em&gt;java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Illegal pattern character &apos;t&apos;&lt;/em&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;But if change date lookup format to : /&lt;b&gt;${date:yyyyMM}/${date:ddHHmmss}&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;There will be not such issue anymore.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;After investigation, found it is caused by &lt;em&gt;interpolate&lt;/em&gt; method in &lt;em&gt;ConfigurationInterpolator.java&lt;/em&gt;.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;For the input date lookup format, it is will be taken as single variable via &lt;em&gt;looksLikeSingleVariable&lt;/em&gt;,&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;so default date lookup will try to format the date directly then throw one exception.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Attached patch is trying to catch the exception then return null, substitutor will continue to work.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;PR: &lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/apache/commons-configuration/pull/36&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://github.com/apache/commons-configuration/pull/36&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment>&lt;p&gt;Java 1.8.0_144,&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Windows 10/Linux&lt;/p&gt;</environment>
        <key id="13261254">CONFIGURATION-764</key>
            <summary>Default date lookup can not work for some specific format</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/open.png" description="The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.">Open</status>
                    <statusCategory id="2" key="new" colorName="blue-gray"/>
                                    <resolution id="-1">Unresolved</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="ningzhangnj">Ning Zhang</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Wed, 9 Oct 2019 07:26:47 +0000</created>

<item>
            <title>[CONFIGURATION-762] Use variable arguments.</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CONFIGURATION-762</link>
                <project id="12310467" key="CONFIGURATION">Commons Configuration</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;Use variable arguments. A few APIs define their only or last argument as a array, for example &lt;tt&gt;String[]&lt;/tt&gt; but can be defined as &lt;tt&gt;String...&lt;/tt&gt; to make call sites less verbose.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13259687">CONFIGURATION-762</key>
            <summary>Use variable arguments.</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>

<item>
            <title>[CONFIGURATION-761] Single argument DataConfiguration APIs always create empty arrays</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CONFIGURATION-761</link>
                <project id="12310467" key="CONFIGURATION">Commons Configuration</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;The following single argument APIs in &lt;tt&gt;org.apache.commons.configuration2.DataConfiguration&lt;/tt&gt; always create empty arrays:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;ul&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;&lt;tt&gt;org.apache.commons.configuration2.DataConfiguration.getBigDecimalArray(String)&lt;/tt&gt;&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;&lt;tt&gt;org.apache.commons.configuration2.DataConfiguration.getBigIntegerArray(String)&lt;/tt&gt;&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;&lt;tt&gt;org.apache.commons.configuration2.DataConfiguration.getByteArray(String)&lt;/tt&gt;&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;&lt;tt&gt;org.apache.commons.configuration2.DataConfiguration.getCalendarArray(String)&lt;/tt&gt;&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;&lt;tt&gt;org.apache.commons.configuration2.DataConfiguration.getColorArray(String)&lt;/tt&gt;&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;&lt;tt&gt;org.apache.commons.configuration2.DataConfiguration.getDateArray(String)&lt;/tt&gt;&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;&lt;tt&gt;org.apache.commons.configuration2.DataConfiguration.getDoubleArray(String)&lt;/tt&gt;&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;&lt;tt&gt;org.apache.commons.configuration2.DataConfiguration.getFloatArray(String)&lt;/tt&gt;&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;&lt;tt&gt;org.apache.commons.configuration2.DataConfiguration.getIntArray(String)&lt;/tt&gt;&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;&lt;tt&gt;org.apache.commons.configuration2.DataConfiguration.getLocaleArray(String)&lt;/tt&gt;&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;&lt;tt&gt;org.apache.commons.configuration2.DataConfiguration.getLongArray(String)&lt;/tt&gt;&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;&lt;tt&gt;org.apache.commons.configuration2.DataConfiguration.getShortArray(String)&lt;/tt&gt;&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;&lt;tt&gt;org.apache.commons.configuration2.DataConfiguration.getURIArray(String)&lt;/tt&gt;&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;&lt;tt&gt;org.apache.commons.configuration2.DataConfiguration.getURLArray(String)&lt;/tt&gt;&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;/ul&gt;


&lt;p&gt;Instead of always creating new empty arrays like &lt;tt&gt;new BigInteger&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;0&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/tt&gt;, save these in constants.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13259678">CONFIGURATION-761</key>
            <summary>Single argument DataConfiguration APIs always create empty arrays</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="ggregory">Gary D. Gregory</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="ggregory">Gary D. Gregory</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Mon, 30 Sep 2019 14:08:04 +0000</created>
                <updated>Mon, 30 Sep 2019 14:27:54 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Mon, 30 Sep 2019 14:27:54 +0000</resolved>
                                                    <fixVersion>2.7</fixVersion>
                                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>1</watches>

                        <customfieldname>Rank (Obsolete)</customfieldname>
                        <customfieldvalues>
                            <customfieldvalue>9223372036854775807</customfieldvalue>
                        </customfieldvalues>
                    </customfield>
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                <customfield id="customfield_12310222" key="com.atlassian.jira.ext.charting:timeinstatus">

<item>
            <title>[CONFIGURATION-760] Properties file using cyclical includes cause a StackOverflowError instead of detecting the misconfiguration</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CONFIGURATION-760</link>
                <project id="12310467" key="CONFIGURATION">Commons Configuration</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;Properties file using cyclical includes cause a StackOverflowError instead of detecting the misconfiguration.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;For example, see &lt;tt&gt;org.apache.commons.configuration2.TestPropertiesConfiguration.testIncludeLoadAllCycliclaReference()&lt;/tt&gt;:&lt;/p&gt;

	at org.apache.commons.configuration2.PropertiesConfiguration.read(PropertiesConfiguration.java:602)

	at org.apache.commons.configuration2.io.FileHandler.loadFromTransformedStream(FileHandler.java:1119)
	at org.apache.commons.configuration2.io.FileHandler.loadFromStream(FileHandler.java:1058)
	at org.apache.commons.configuration2.io.FileHandler.load(FileHandler.java:989)
	at org.apache.commons.configuration2.io.FileHandler.load(FileHandler.java:749)
	at org.apache.commons.configuration2.PropertiesConfiguration.loadIncludeFile(PropertiesConfiguration.java:1899)
	at org.apache.commons.configuration2.PropertiesConfiguration.propertyLoaded(PropertiesConfiguration.java:664)

	at org.apache.commons.configuration2.io.FileHandler.loadFromStream(FileHandler.java:1058)
	at org.apache.commons.configuration2.io.FileHandler.load(FileHandler.java:989)
	at org.apache.commons.configuration2.io.FileHandler.load(FileHandler.java:749)
	at org.apache.commons.configuration2.PropertiesConfiguration.loadIncludeFile(PropertiesConfiguration.java:1899)
	at org.apache.commons.configuration2.PropertiesConfiguration.propertyLoaded(PropertiesConfiguration.java:664)
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;Instead, we&apos;ll throw a &lt;tt&gt;ConfigurationException&lt;/tt&gt; as soon as a cycle is detected.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;See &lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/apache/commons-configuration/pull/35&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://github.com/apache/commons-configuration/pull/35&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13256389">CONFIGURATION-760</key>
            <summary>Properties file using cyclical includes cause a StackOverflowError instead of detecting the misconfiguration</summary>

<item>
            <title>[CONFIGURATION-753] Handling of interpolation is inconsistent</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CONFIGURATION-753</link>
                <project id="12310467" key="CONFIGURATION">Commons Configuration</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;If a key is repeated in a configuration and then used in an interpolation elsewhere, the behaviour is inconsistent. There are other tickets/discussions about whether it should just pick the first value or not, but I don&apos;t think it should do both.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeHeader panelHeader&quot; style=&quot;border-bottom-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;b&gt;/tmp/test.properties&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
abc = hello
abc = world
foo.one = ${abc}
foo.two = prefix ${abc} suffix
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeHeader panelHeader&quot; style=&quot;border-bottom-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;b&gt;Demo.java (main)&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
Parameters params = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; Parameters();
FileBasedConfigurationBuilder&amp;lt;FileBasedConfiguration&amp;gt; builder = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; FileBasedConfigurationBuilder&amp;lt;FileBasedConfiguration&amp;gt;(PropertiesConfiguration.class)
    .configure(params.fileBased()
        .setFileName(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;/tmp/test.properties&quot;&lt;/span&gt;)
      );
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;try&lt;/span&gt; {
    FileBasedConfiguration config = builder.getConfiguration();
    &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;System&lt;/span&gt;.out.println(config.getString(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;foo.one&quot;&lt;/span&gt;));
    &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;System&lt;/span&gt;.out.println(config.getString(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;foo.two&quot;&lt;/span&gt;));
} &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;catch&lt;/span&gt; (ConfigurationException cex) {
    &lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// pass
&lt;/span&gt;}
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;The output from the above is&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;preformatted panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;preformattedContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre&gt;hello 
prefix [hello, world] suffix
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;In the first case, only the first value is being matched, in the second both values (and &lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;, &amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;) are used.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I&apos;d expect the output to either be&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;preformatted panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;preformattedHeader panelHeader&quot; style=&quot;border-bottom-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;b&gt;First value only&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;preformattedContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre&gt;hello
prefix hello suffix
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;or&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;preformatted panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;preformattedHeader panelHeader&quot; style=&quot;border-bottom-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;b&gt;Both values used&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;preformattedContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre&gt;[hello, world]
prefix [hello, world] suffix
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;I can work around whichever style is chosen but think it&apos;d be much more intuitive if both cases were handled the same.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment>&lt;p&gt;Java 8, Configurations2 2.5&lt;/p&gt;</environment>
        <key id="13251057">CONFIGURATION-753</key>
            <summary>Handling of interpolation is inconsistent</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/open.png" description="The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.">Open</status>
                    <statusCategory id="2" key="new" colorName="blue-gray"/>
                                    <resolution id="-1">Unresolved</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="tpoliaw">Peter</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Thu, 15 Aug 2019 16:27:37 +0000</created>
                <updated>Wed, 25 Aug 2021 13:11:50 +0000</updated>
                                            <version>2.5</version>
                                                    <component>Interpolation</component>
                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>3</watches>
                                            <timeestimate seconds="0">0h</timeestimate>
                            <timespent seconds="600">10m</timespent>
                                <comments>
                            <comment id="16909578" author="garydgregory" created="Sat, 17 Aug 2019 04:43:30 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;I agree that the behavior should be consistent. Feel free to provide a PR on Github &lt;img class=&quot;emoticon&quot; src=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/emoticons/wink.png&quot; height=&quot;16&quot; width=&quot;16&quot; align=&quot;absmiddle&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; border=&quot;0&quot;/&gt;&#160;(with a unit test).&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16913190" author="tpoliaw" created="Thu, 22 Aug 2019 09:40:33 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Ok, I&apos;ll try and get a PR together to fix it. My preference would be to go with the first example (first value only) so that it matches the return of &lt;tt&gt;getString(String key)&lt;/tt&gt;.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16925602" author="yuji.k" created="Mon, 9 Sep 2019 11:24:03 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;This is &quot;First value only&quot;.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;hr /&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;class &lt;/span&gt;Demo {
	&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;static&lt;/span&gt; void main(&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt;[] args) {
		Parameters params = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; Parameters();
		FileBasedConfigurationBuilder&amp;lt;FileBasedConfiguration&amp;gt; builder = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; FileBasedConfigurationBuilder&amp;lt;FileBasedConfiguration&amp;gt;(
				MyPropertiesConfiguration.class).configure(params.fileBased().setFileName(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;/tmp/test.properties&quot;&lt;/span&gt;));
		&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;try&lt;/span&gt; {
			FileBasedConfiguration config = builder.getConfiguration();
			&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;System&lt;/span&gt;.out.println(config.getString(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;foo.one&quot;&lt;/span&gt;));
			&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;System&lt;/span&gt;.out.println(config.getString(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;foo.two&quot;&lt;/span&gt;));
		} &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;catch&lt;/span&gt; (ConfigurationException cex) {
			cex.printStackTrace();
		}
	}
}
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;hr /&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;class &lt;/span&gt;MyPropertiesConfiguration &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;extends&lt;/span&gt; PropertiesConfiguration {
	@Override
	&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;protected&lt;/span&gt; void addPropertyDirect(&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt; key, &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;Object&lt;/span&gt; value)
	{
	    &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;Object&lt;/span&gt; previousValue = getPropertyInternal(key);

	    &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;if&lt;/span&gt; (previousValue == &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;null&lt;/span&gt;)
	    {
	        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;super&lt;/span&gt;.addPropertyDirect(key, value);
	    }    	
	}	
}
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;hr /&gt;
</comment>
                            <comment id="16925760" author="tpoliaw" created="Mon, 9 Sep 2019 15:06:36 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;That only stores the first value from the file. With that configuration, &lt;tt&gt;config.getStringArray(&quot;abc&quot;)&lt;/tt&gt; would return an array containing only a single value. While this may be a potential workaround it has additional changes in behaviour that don&apos;t directly address the inconsistency.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16928567" author="garydgregory" created="Thu, 12 Sep 2019 14:10:53 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Since this does not feel fully baked, I will proceed with a release without it. We can always release again later.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="17019634" author="tpoliaw" created="Mon, 20 Jan 2020 16:56:50 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/ViewProfile.jspa?name=ggregory&quot; class=&quot;user-hover&quot; rel=&quot;ggregory&quot;&gt;Gary D. Gregory&lt;/a&gt;, we&apos;re keen to update to configurations2 and this is a blocker for us. What would it need for this to feel more fully baked? Happy to make more changes to the PR.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="17019728" author="garydgregory" created="Mon, 20 Jan 2020 20:35:58 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/ViewProfile.jspa?name=tpoliaw&quot; class=&quot;user-hover&quot; rel=&quot;tpoliaw&quot;&gt;Peter&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Looking at&#160;&lt;a href=&quot;https://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-configuration/userguide/howto_properties.html#Properties_files&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-configuration/userguide/howto_properties.html#Properties_files&lt;/a&gt;&#160;it would seem that the way to do list values in properties file is, for example:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;foo = value1, value2, value3&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;There is also&#160;&lt;a href=&quot;https://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-configuration/userguide/howto_basicfeatures.html#List_handling&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-configuration/userguide/howto_basicfeatures.html#List_handling&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;What is worrisome is that there is some code that must build a list based on repeated keys and I am not sure if that is documented or intentional. This is obviously an area where a unit test is needed if it is missing.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Maybe someone else can chime in. I find it odd that repeating keys would build a list since that is far from what a java.util.Properties object can do.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Thoughts?&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="17020155" author="tpoliaw" created="Tue, 21 Jan 2020 11:31:37 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Thanks for looking at this again. There is some documentation covering it even if it isn&apos;t the main method of creating list properties. From the &lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/apache/commons-configuration/blob/342f3b3be52bbbb188ad2fe81bb19ad688012123/src/main/java/org/apache/commons/configuration2/PropertiesConfiguration.java#L110&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;javadoc in PropertiesConfig&lt;/a&gt;: &quot;If a key is used more than once, the values are appended like if they were on the same line separated with commas.&quot;. The code implementing this is in BaseConfiguration &lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/apache/commons-configuration/blob/342f3b3be52bbbb188ad2fe81bb19ad688012123/src/main/java/org/apache/commons/configuration2/BaseConfiguration.java#L52&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;here&lt;/a&gt;. I&apos;m not sure if this is available for other file formats. There are tests for this behaviour &lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/apache/commons-configuration/blob/342f3b3be52bbbb188ad2fe81bb19ad688012123/src/test/java/org/apache/commons/configuration2/TestBaseConfiguration.java#L310&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;here&lt;/a&gt;.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;RE. the java.util.Properties comparison, I think it is an intentional extension based on &lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/apache/commons-configuration/blob/342f3b3be52bbbb188ad2fe81bb19ad688012123/src/main/java/org/apache/commons/configuration2/BaseConfiguration.java#L34&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;this&lt;/a&gt;.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Either way, I don&apos;t think it affects this issue. If you replace the two &lt;tt&gt;abc&lt;/tt&gt; keys in the sample properties file above with a single, comma separated entry, the interpolation inconsistency would still be there.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="17203222" author="tpoliaw" created="Mon, 28 Sep 2020 13:11:47 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Any chance of an update on this? I&apos;m happy to work on any changes to the PR if this isn&apos;t the preferred way of approaching it.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                    </comments>

<item>
            <title>[CONFIGURATION-750] XMLPropertyListConfiguration cannot set arrays in the correct plist form</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CONFIGURATION-750</link>
                <project id="12310467" key="CONFIGURATION">Commons Configuration</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;This is the same as&#160;&lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CONFIGURATION-427&quot; title=&quot;XMLPropertyListConfiguration cannot save arrays in the correct plist form&quot; class=&quot;issue-link&quot; data-issue-key=&quot;CONFIGURATION-427&quot;&gt;&lt;del&gt;CONFIGURATION-427&lt;/del&gt;&lt;/a&gt; except that it applies to &lt;tt&gt;setProperty&lt;/tt&gt; which was&#160;missed&#160;in the original fix.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; FileBasedConfigurationBuilder&amp;lt;FileBasedConfiguration&amp;gt; builder =
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; FileBasedConfigurationBuilder&amp;lt;&amp;gt;(XMLPropertyListConfiguration.class);
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; FileBasedConfiguration configuration = builder.getConfiguration();
configuration.setProperty(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;things&quot;&lt;/span&gt;, [&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&apos;chair&apos;&lt;/span&gt;, &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&apos;hat&apos;&lt;/span&gt;, &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&apos;door&apos;&lt;/span&gt;]);
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; FileHandler fileHandler = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; FileHandler(configuration);
fileHandler.save(&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;System&lt;/span&gt;.out);
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;results in&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-xml&quot;&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;?xml version=&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;1.0&quot;&lt;/span&gt;?&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;!DOCTYPE plist SYSTEM &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;file://localhost/System/Library/DTDs/PropertyList.dtd&quot;&lt;/span&gt;&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;plist version=&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;1.0&quot;&lt;/span&gt;&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;
    &lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;dict&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;key&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;things&lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;/key&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;string&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;chair&lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;/string&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;

        &lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;key&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;things&lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;/key&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;string&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;hat&lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;/string&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;

        &lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;key&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;things&lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;/key&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;string&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;door&lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;/string&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;
    &lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;/dict&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;/plist&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;expecting&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-xml&quot;&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;?xml version=&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;1.0&quot;&lt;/span&gt;?&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;!DOCTYPE plist SYSTEM &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;file://localhost/System/Library/DTDs/PropertyList.dtd&quot;&lt;/span&gt;&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;plist version=&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;1.0&quot;&lt;/span&gt;&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;
    &lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;dict&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;key&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;things&lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;/key&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;array&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;
          &lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;string&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;chair&lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;/string&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;
          &lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;string&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;hat&lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;/string&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;
          &lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;string&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;door&lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;/string&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;
      &lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;/array&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;
    &lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;/dict&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;/plist&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;
&lt;/pre&gt;

<item>
            <title>[CONFIGURATION-749] IniConfiguration.getSection() behaves inconsistently regarding dot escaping</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CONFIGURATION-749</link>
                <project id="12310467" key="CONFIGURATION">Commons Configuration</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;According to documentation, dots in Keys should be escaped by doubling them. IniConfiguration.getSection() does not always recognise this correctly: When the section already exists, it works as expected. When the section does not exist, escaping is ignored, so&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;getSection(&quot;section.with.dots&quot;) will create a section called section.with.dots (consequently, getSection(&quot;section..with..dots&quot;) creates a sectoin called section..with..dots).&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Additionally, the section return by the former call does behave strangely; it will only accept one call to addProperty().&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13237502">CONFIGURATION-749</key>
            <summary>IniConfiguration.getSection() behaves inconsistently regarding dot escaping</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/open.png" description="The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.">Open</status>
                    <statusCategory id="2" key="new" colorName="blue-gray"/>

<item>
            <title>[CONFIGURATION-742] Dots in ini keys corrupts nodes structure</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CONFIGURATION-742</link>
                <project id="12310467" key="CONFIGURATION">Commons Configuration</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;Example:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;preformatted panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;preformattedContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre&gt;[dots_example]
...

# only key, no value on purpose &lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;Dots as key names are &lt;a href=&quot;http://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-configuration/userguide/howto_hierarchical.html#Escaping_special_characters&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;considered as syntax error&lt;/a&gt; but no ConfigurationException is thrown and also this property is stored in data structure as a node with key=&quot;...&quot; and value=null.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;This leads to problems:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&lt;tt&gt;configParser.getSection(&quot;dots_example&quot;).getRootNode().getChildren()&lt;/tt&gt;&lt;br/&gt;
// returns Collection with one Node: &quot;...&quot;=null&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&lt;tt&gt;configParser.getSection(&quot;dots_example&quot;).getKeys()&lt;/tt&gt;&lt;br/&gt;
// returns List size=1 with &quot;...&quot; inside&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;but&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&lt;tt&gt;configParser.getSection(&quot;dots_example&quot;).containsKey(&quot;...&quot;)&lt;/tt&gt;&lt;br/&gt;
// return false&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The result of inconsistent data structure is e.g. NPE when writing to file.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13220130">CONFIGURATION-742</key>
            <summary>Dots in ini keys corrupts nodes structure</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/open.png" description="The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.">Open</status>
                    <statusCategory id="2" key="new" colorName="blue-gray"/>

                        <due></due>

                            <comment id="16786780" author="garydgregory" created="Thu, 7 Mar 2019 13:47:40 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/ViewProfile.jspa?name=mjgrzybek&quot; class=&quot;user-hover&quot; rel=&quot;mjgrzybek&quot;&gt;Michal Grzybek&lt;/a&gt;,&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;We welcome patches on GitHub &lt;img class=&quot;emoticon&quot; src=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/emoticons/wink.png&quot; height=&quot;16&quot; width=&quot;16&quot; align=&quot;absmiddle&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; border=&quot;0&quot;/&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Gary&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16925552" author="yuji.k" created="Mon, 9 Sep 2019 10:09:19 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;As &quot;.&quot; is a delimiter, it is converted to &quot;..&quot;.&lt;br/&gt;
(DefaultConfigurationKey.escapeDelimiters())&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;configParser.getSection(&quot;dots_example&quot;).containsKey(&quot;......&quot;)&lt;br/&gt;
// return true&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;See, TestINIConfiguration.testGetSectionsDottedVar()&lt;/p&gt;</comment>

<item>
            <title>[CONFIGURATION-737] JupIOFactory and trimming of newline &amp; carriage return characters</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CONFIGURATION-737</link>
                <project id="12310467" key="CONFIGURATION">Commons Configuration</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;I want to configure the&#160;line separator that should be used in my output via config file.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;E.g.&#160;using the property&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;L1=\n&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;and JupIOFactory as following:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;blockquote&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;tt&gt;&#160;public static Configuration loadConfig(String fileName) throws ConfigurationException {&lt;/tt&gt;&lt;br/&gt;
&lt;tt&gt;Parameters params = new Parameters();&lt;/tt&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&lt;tt&gt;PropertiesBuilderParameters properties = params.properties();&lt;/tt&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&lt;tt&gt;properties.setFileName(fileName)&lt;/tt&gt;&lt;br/&gt;
&lt;tt&gt;.setThrowExceptionOnMissing(true)&lt;/tt&gt;&lt;br/&gt;
&lt;tt&gt;.setIOFactory(new PropertiesConfiguration.JupIOFactory())&lt;/tt&gt;&lt;br/&gt;
&lt;tt&gt;.setListDelimiterHandler(new DefaultListDelimiterHandler(&apos;,&apos;));&lt;/tt&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&lt;tt&gt;FileBasedConfigurationBuilder&amp;lt;FileBasedConfiguration&amp;gt; builder =&lt;/tt&gt;&lt;br/&gt;
&lt;tt&gt;new FileBasedConfigurationBuilder&amp;lt;FileBasedConfiguration&amp;gt;(PropertiesConfiguration.class)&lt;/tt&gt;&lt;br/&gt;
&lt;tt&gt;.configure(properties&lt;/tt&gt;&lt;br/&gt;
&lt;tt&gt;);&lt;/tt&gt;&lt;br/&gt;
&lt;tt&gt;Configuration config = builder.getConfiguration();&lt;/tt&gt;&lt;br/&gt;
&lt;tt&gt;return config;&lt;/tt&gt;&lt;br/&gt;
&lt;tt&gt;}&lt;/tt&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/blockquote&gt;
&lt;p&gt;The value of the property gets trimmed. Java Properties (JDK 8) does not trim newline and carriage return characters.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The problem seems to arise in the method at the following code part (where the string is trimmed):&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;blockquote&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;tt&gt;protected Collection&amp;lt;String&amp;gt; splitString(final String s, final boolean trim)&lt;/tt&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;...&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&lt;tt&gt;// Add last token&lt;/tt&gt;&lt;br/&gt;
&lt;tt&gt;String t = token.toString();&lt;/tt&gt;&lt;br/&gt;
&lt;tt&gt;if (trim)&lt;/tt&gt;&lt;br/&gt;
{{{}}&lt;br/&gt;
&lt;tt&gt;t = t.trim();&lt;/tt&gt;&lt;br/&gt;
&lt;tt&gt;}&lt;/tt&gt;&lt;br/&gt;
&lt;tt&gt;list.add(t);&lt;/tt&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/blockquote&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13213857">CONFIGURATION-737</key>

<item>
            <title>[CONFIGURATION-735] XML &lt;result&gt;/&lt;listDelimiterHandler&gt; configuration doesn&apos;t work</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CONFIGURATION-735</link>
                <project id="12310467" key="CONFIGURATION">Commons Configuration</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;According to example on &lt;a href=&quot;https://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-configuration/userguide/howto_combinedbuilder.html&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-configuration/userguide/howto_combinedbuilder.html&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The following xml configuration to set DefaultListDelimiterHandler should work:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&amp;lt;configuration&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
&#160; &amp;lt;header&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
&#160;&#160;&#160; &amp;lt;result throwExceptionOnMissing=&quot;true&quot;&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; &amp;lt;listDelimiterHandler config-class=&quot;org.apache.commons.configuration2.convert.DefaultListDelimiterHandler&quot;&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; &amp;lt;config-constrarg config-value=&quot;,&quot;/&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; &amp;lt;/listDelimiterHandler&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
&#160;&#160;&#160; &amp;lt;/result&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
&#160; &amp;lt;/header&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
&#160; &amp;lt;override&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
&#160;&#160;&#160; &amp;lt;xml fileName=&quot;configuration-1.xml&quot; reloadingRefreshDelay=&quot;10000&quot; config-name=&quot;config3&quot; config-optional=&quot;false&quot; throwExceptionOnMissing=&quot;false&quot;/&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
&#160; &amp;lt;/override&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
&#160;&amp;lt;/configuration&amp;gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;configuration-1.xml:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&amp;lt;configuration&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
&#160; &amp;lt;header&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
&#160;&#160;&#160; &amp;lt;result throwExceptionOnMissing=&quot;true&quot;&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; &amp;lt;listDelimiterHandler config-class=&quot;org.apache.commons.configuration2.convert.DefaultListDelimiterHandler&quot;&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; &amp;lt;config-constrarg config-value=&quot;,&quot;/&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; &amp;lt;/listDelimiterHandler&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
&#160;&#160;&#160; &amp;lt;/result&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
&#160; &amp;lt;/header&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
&#160;&#160;&#160; &amp;lt;apples&amp;gt;macintosh,delicious&amp;lt;/apples&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
&#160;&amp;lt;/configuration&amp;gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;And get the configuration using:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; Parameters params = new Parameters();&lt;br/&gt;
&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; ReloadingCombinedConfigurationBuilder builder = new ReloadingCombinedConfigurationBuilder();&lt;br/&gt;
&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; builder.configure(params.fileBased().setFile(file)); &lt;br/&gt;
&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; CombinedConfiguration configuration = builder.getConfiguration();&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; List&amp;lt;String&amp;gt; apples = (List&amp;lt;String&amp;gt;) configuration.getList(String.class, &quot;apples&quot;);&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;But the apples list contains only a single string:&#160; &quot;macintosh,delicious&quot;.... unless I programmatically set the DefaultListDelimiterHandler using:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;builder.configure(params.fileBased().setFile(file).setListDelimiterHandler(new DefaultListDelimiterHandler(&apos;,&apos;)));&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13207965">CONFIGURATION-735</key>
            <summary>XML &lt;result&gt;/&lt;listDelimiterHandler&gt; configuration doesn&apos;t work</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/open.png" description="The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.">Open</status>
                    <statusCategory id="2" key="new" colorName="blue-gray"/>
                                    <resolution id="-1">Unresolved</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="hchen00">Hao Chen</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Mon, 7 Jan 2019 07:55:05 +0000</created>
                <updated>Mon, 7 Jan 2019 07:55:05 +0000</updated>
                                                                                <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>1</watches>
                                                                        <attachments>
                    </attachments>
                <subtasks>
                    </subtasks>
                <customfields>
                                                                            <customfield id="customfield_12310310" key="com.atlassian.jira.toolkit:attachments">
                        <customfieldname>Attachment count</customfieldname>
                        <customfieldvalues>
                            <customfieldvalue>0.0</customfieldvalue>
                        </customfieldvalues>

<item>
            <title>[CONFIGURATION-734] Inconsistent/strange configuration keys for attributes</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CONFIGURATION-734</link>
                <project id="12310467" key="CONFIGURATION">Commons Configuration</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;Given the following configuration-1.xml:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&amp;lt;configuration&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
&#160;&#160;&#160; &amp;lt;node type=&quot;test&quot; types=&quot;a,b,c&quot;/&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
&amp;lt;/configuration&amp;gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;If you get the configuration using something like:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; Parameters params = new Parameters();&lt;br/&gt;
&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; ReloadingFileBasedConfigurationBuilder&amp;lt;XMLConfiguration&amp;gt; builder = new ReloadingFileBasedConfigurationBuilder&amp;lt;XMLConfiguration&amp;gt;(XMLConfiguration.class);&lt;br/&gt;
&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; builder.configure(params.xml().setFile(&quot;configuration-1.xml &quot;).setListDelimiterHandler(new DefaultListDelimiterHandler(&apos;,&apos;)));&lt;br/&gt;
&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; XMLConfiguration configuration = builder.getConfiguration();&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Then you print the keys using configuration.getKeys(), you will get something like: node&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;@type&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;, node&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;@types&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;However, if you use a combined configuration.xml like:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&amp;lt;configuration&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
&#160; &amp;lt;override&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
&#160;&#160;&#160; &amp;lt;xml fileName=&quot;configuration-1.xml&quot; reloadingRefreshDelay=&quot;10000&quot; config-name=&quot;config3&quot; config-optional=&quot;false&quot; throwExceptionOnMissing=&quot;false&quot;/&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
&#160; &amp;lt;/override&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
&amp;lt;/configuration&amp;gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;And you get the configuration using:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; Parameters params = new Parameters();&lt;br/&gt;
&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; ReloadingCombinedConfigurationBuilder builder = new ReloadingCombinedConfigurationBuilder();&lt;br/&gt;
&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; builder.configure(params.fileBased().setFile(new File(&quot;configuration.xml &quot;)).setListDelimiterHandler(new DefaultListDelimiterHandler(&apos;,&apos;)));&lt;br/&gt;
&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; CombinedConfiguration configuration = builder.getConfiguration();&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Then when you print the configuration keys, you will get something like: node/@type, node/@types - this format seems to be the standard one and keys in the above example look very strange. &lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13207961">CONFIGURATION-734</key>

<item>
            <title>[CONFIGURATION-733] Attribute value cannot delimit to list</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CONFIGURATION-733</link>
                <project id="12310467" key="CONFIGURATION">Commons Configuration</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;Given the following configuration XML:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&amp;lt;configuration&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
&#160; &amp;lt;header&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
&#160;&#160;&#160; &amp;lt;result throwExceptionOnMissing=&quot;true&quot;&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; &amp;lt;listDelimiterHandler config-class=&quot;org.apache.commons.configuration2.convert.DefaultListDelimiterHandler&quot;&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; &amp;lt;config-constrarg config-value=&quot;,&quot;/&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; &amp;lt;/listDelimiterHandler&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
&#160;&#160;&#160; &amp;lt;/result&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
&#160; &amp;lt;/header&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; &amp;lt;node type=&quot;test&quot; types=&quot;a,b,c&quot;/&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
&amp;lt;/configuration&amp;gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;With the following test code:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; Parameters params = new Parameters();&lt;br/&gt;
&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; ReloadingFileBasedConfigurationBuilder&amp;lt;XMLConfiguration&amp;gt; builder = new ReloadingFileBasedConfigurationBuilder&amp;lt;XMLConfiguration&amp;gt;(XMLConfiguration.class);&lt;br/&gt;
&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; builder.configure(params.xml().setFile(file).setListDelimiterHandler(new DefaultListDelimiterHandler(&apos;,&apos;)));&lt;br/&gt;
&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; XMLConfiguration configuration = builder.getConfiguration();&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; List&amp;lt;String&amp;gt; types = configuration.getList(String.class, &quot;node&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;@types&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;&quot;);&lt;br/&gt;
&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; // result WRONG &amp;#8211; returns &lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;&amp;quot;a,b,c&amp;quot;&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br/&gt;
&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; org.junit.Assert.assertEquals(types.size(), 3);&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I just couldn&apos;t find any way to get the attribute value as a comma-delimited list...&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;In general, the default behavior change for list delimiter is a big headache while we are trying to upgrade to commons-configuration2...&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13207957">CONFIGURATION-733</key>
            <summary>Attribute value cannot delimit to list</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/open.png" description="The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.">Open</status>
                    <statusCategory id="2" key="new" colorName="blue-gray"/>
                                    <resolution id="-1">Unresolved</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="hchen00">Hao Chen</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Mon, 7 Jan 2019 07:21:28 +0000</created>
                <updated>Fri, 19 Jul 2019 14:16:40 +0000</updated>
                                            <version>2.4</version>
                                                        <due></due>
                            <votes>1</votes>
                                    <watches>4</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="16888887" author="p.dudkiewicz" created="Fri, 19 Jul 2019 14:01:18 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;The problem is that the ListDelimiterHandler is hardcoded to DisabledListDelimiterHandler in&#160;DefaultConversionHandler.&lt;br/&gt;
It doesn&apos;t&#160;use builder setting.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;As a workaround I had to implement my own conversion handler.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;package&lt;/span&gt; org.apache.commons.configuration2.convert;

&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;import&lt;/span&gt; java.util.Collection;

&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;class &lt;/span&gt;LegacyConversionHandler &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;extends&lt;/span&gt; DefaultConversionHandler {

    &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;private&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;static&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; LegacyListDelimiterHandler LIST_DELIMITER_HANDLER = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; LegacyListDelimiterHandler(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&apos;,&apos;&lt;/span&gt;);

    @Override
    &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;protected&lt;/span&gt; Collection&amp;lt;?&amp;gt; extractValues(&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;Object&lt;/span&gt; source, &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;int&lt;/span&gt; limit) {
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;return&lt;/span&gt; LIST_DELIMITER_HANDLER.flatten(source, limit);
    }

}

&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16888921" author="garydgregory" created="Fri, 19 Jul 2019 14:16:40 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/ViewProfile.jspa?name=p.dudkiewicz&quot; class=&quot;user-hover&quot; rel=&quot;p.dudkiewicz&quot;&gt;Piotr Dudkiewicz&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;May you&#160;provide a PR on GitHub?&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Gary&lt;/p&gt;</comment>

            <title>[CONFIGURATION-732] Fix CI build break after upgraded from Java 7 to 8</title>

                    <description>&lt;p&gt;The Travis CI build broken after upgrading from Java 7 to 8.&lt;/p&gt;
