<item>
            <title>[CONFIGURATION-716] PropertiesConfiguration: Escape sequence handling different from Properties</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CONFIGURATION-716</link>
                <project id="12310467" key="CONFIGURATION">Commons Configuration</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;The escape sequence handling in PropertiesConfiguration is different from java.util.Properties.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The Javadoc (of java.util.Properties) basically states that if an escape sequence (backslash + character) is not understood, the backslash is simply removed.&#160;PropertiesConfiguration keeps the backslash. E.g. &quot;\ &quot; (backslash + space) should result in just a space. This sequence is used by Properties to escape the first leading space in a property value when writing to a properties-file.&#160;PropertiesConfiguration does not understand this syntax. Also (which is technically a different issue but pretty close to this one) does not preserve leading spaces in property values when saving. One could use \u0020 to encode the first leading space, but it would be nicer if it could just use the simpler&#160;&quot;\ &quot;.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13186301">CONFIGURATION-716</key>
            <summary>PropertiesConfiguration: Escape sequence handling different from Properties</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="5" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/resolved.png" description="A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.">Resolved</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="Frettman">Patrick Schmidt</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Thu, 20 Sep 2018 10:38:48 +0000</created>
                <updated>Fri, 5 Oct 2018 20:06:51 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Fri, 5 Oct 2018 20:06:50 +0000</resolved>
                                    <version>2.3</version>
                                    <fixVersion>2.4</fixVersion>
                                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>3</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="16636035" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Tue, 2 Oct 2018 19:56:25 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;The patch for &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CONFIGURATION-715&quot; title=&quot;PropertiesConfiguration should not trim whitespace from the property value&quot; class=&quot;issue-link&quot; data-issue-key=&quot;CONFIGURATION-715&quot;&gt;&lt;del&gt;CONFIGURATION-715&lt;/del&gt;&lt;/a&gt; covers this issue as well.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16640294" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Fri, 5 Oct 2018 20:06:50 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Fixed together with &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CONFIGURATION-715&quot; title=&quot;PropertiesConfiguration should not trim whitespace from the property value&quot; class=&quot;issue-link&quot; data-issue-key=&quot;CONFIGURATION-715&quot;&gt;&lt;del&gt;CONFIGURATION-715&lt;/del&gt;&lt;/a&gt;.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                    </comments>
                <issuelinks>
                            <issuelinktype id="12310010">
                    <name>Incorporates</name>
                                                                <inwardlinks description="is part of">

<item>
            <title>[CONFIGURATION-715] PropertiesConfiguration should not trim whitespace from the property value</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CONFIGURATION-715</link>
                <project id="12310467" key="CONFIGURATION">Commons Configuration</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;Currently,&#160;PropertiesConfiguration will trim all trailing whitespace from property values. This is different from how&#160;java.util.Properties behaves. The Javadoc explicitly states&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
All remaining characters on the line become part of the associated element string&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;The responsible code is in the method &lt;em&gt;readProperty()&lt;/em&gt; of&#160;&lt;em&gt;PropertiesReader&lt;/em&gt;.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13186084">CONFIGURATION-715</key>
            <summary>PropertiesConfiguration should not trim whitespace from the property value</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="5" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/resolved.png" description="A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.">Resolved</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="Frettman">Patrick Schmidt</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Wed, 19 Sep 2018 15:37:48 +0000</created>
                <updated>Sun, 16 Jun 2019 10:12:15 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Fri, 5 Oct 2018 20:06:05 +0000</resolved>
                                    <version>2.3</version>
                                    <fixVersion>2.4</fixVersion>
                                        <due></due>
                            <votes>1</votes>
                                    <watches>3</watches>
                                            <timeestimate seconds="0">0h</timeestimate>
                            <timespent seconds="600">10m</timespent>
                                <comments>
                            <comment id="16622643" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Thu, 20 Sep 2018 20:01:56 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;It is not necessarily the goal of &lt;em&gt;PropertiesConfiguration&lt;/em&gt; to behave exactly like java.util.Properties.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The line trimming has been done from the very first release on. So changing this has a high potential to break client code; it would only be possible to have an option to turn this on if required.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Can you work around the issue by implementing your own &lt;em&gt;PropertiesReader&lt;/em&gt;? (The reader can be customized.) But there is an additional (and probably superflous) &lt;em&gt;trim()&lt;/em&gt; call in &lt;em&gt;readProperty()&lt;/em&gt; which would have to be removed.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16622724" author="frettman" created="Thu, 20 Sep 2018 21:15:35 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;I don&apos;t mind useful extensions to the format, but I do think it would be beneficial (for me at least &lt;img class=&quot;emoticon&quot; src=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/emoticons/wink.png&quot; height=&quot;16&quot; width=&quot;16&quot; align=&quot;absmiddle&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; border=&quot;0&quot;/&gt;)&#160;to stick to the &quot;specification&quot; as much as possible to ensure interoperability with java.util.Properties and other tools to manipulate properties files. At least as long as there&apos;s no compelling reason to deviate from that.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Backwards compatibility is important, so maybe something like an alternative&#160;IOFactory could work. That could also cover my other issues from &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CONFIGURATION-715&quot; title=&quot;PropertiesConfiguration should not trim whitespace from the property value&quot; class=&quot;issue-link&quot; data-issue-key=&quot;CONFIGURATION-715&quot;&gt;&lt;del&gt;CONFIGURATION-715&lt;/del&gt;&lt;/a&gt; without breaking existing client code.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;My current minimally invasive workaround for this specific issue is to override the method &lt;em&gt;readLine()&lt;/em&gt;&#160;of the &lt;em&gt;PropertiesReader&lt;/em&gt; and replace a trailing whitespace with its escape sequence. That won&apos;t get trimmed away and will be replaced with its original character later on. This solution is good enough for my needs.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;If you decide that compatibility with&#160;java.util.Properties is nothing you want to go for, you might at least consider escaping the first leading and last trailing space&#160;when saving. One can manually use \u0020 to avoid the trimming, but loading and saving will replace that with a regular space which will be gone the next time the file is loaded.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16624681" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Sat, 22 Sep 2018 13:49:42 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;An alternative IOFactory that tries to mimic the behavior of java.util.Properties would really be a good enhancement. Are you willing to work on this? We are happy to review and accept patches.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16625515" author="frettman" created="Mon, 24 Sep 2018 08:22:31 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;I&apos;m not saying I&apos;ll do it...but I already started.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Is there by any chance a Java formatter profile for Eclipse, so I don&apos;t have to extrapolate code conventions from existing code?&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16626056" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Mon, 24 Sep 2018 16:00:45 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;This is great!&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Regarding Eclipse formatter: There is none that I am aware of. Unfortunately, (probably for historical reasons) Commons Components do not use a uniform code format. But if you build the site with &lt;em&gt;mvn site,&lt;/em&gt; the Checkstyle report can tell you if some style guides have been violated.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16633362" author="frettman" created="Sun, 30 Sep 2018 12:39:47 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;I just created a &lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/apache/commons-configuration/pull/13&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;pull request&lt;/a&gt;&#160;that also covers &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CONFIGURATION-716&quot; title=&quot;PropertiesConfiguration: Escape sequence handling different from Properties&quot; class=&quot;issue-link&quot; data-issue-key=&quot;CONFIGURATION-716&quot;&gt;&lt;del&gt;CONFIGURATION-716&lt;/del&gt;&lt;/a&gt;, plus a bit more related to compatibility with&#160;java.util.Properties. Let me know what you think.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16633490" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Sun, 30 Sep 2018 19:57:06 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Many thanks! I will have a look (probably in a few days).&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16636032" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Tue, 2 Oct 2018 19:55:20 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Impressive patch! I have applied it (with minor changes, just added some @since tags) in revision 1842650.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Ideally, we could add a sentence to the user&apos;s guide mentioning the new IOFactory class as an alternative when stricter compatibility to java.util.Properties is required. Do you want to create a corresponding patch, too?&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Also, if you want to be added to the contributors section in pom.xml, just send us the data you want to get in.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Many thanks again!&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16638820" author="frettman" created="Thu, 4 Oct 2018 20:24:30 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;I created a &lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/apache/commons-configuration/pull/14&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;pull request&lt;/a&gt; for the user&apos;s guide and an incomplete Javadoc on&#160;JupIOFactory that I missed. For the&#160;contributors section just take the name and email address from my commit.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16640293" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Fri, 5 Oct 2018 20:06:05 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Patch was applied, and you have been added to the contributors section.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Many thanks again!&lt;/p&gt;</comment>

<item>
            <title>[CONFIGURATION-714] PropertiesConfiguration builder.getConfiguration fails</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CONFIGURATION-714</link>
                <project id="12310467" key="CONFIGURATION">Commons Configuration</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;Call to FileBasedConfigurationBuilder.getConfiguration fails with an exception:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;preformatted panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;preformattedContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre&gt;Could not locate: org.apache.commons.configuration2.io.FileLocator@57fd91c9[fileName=usergui.properties,basePath=&amp;lt;null&amp;gt;,sourceURL=,encoding=ISO-8859-1,fileSystem=&amp;lt;null&amp;gt;,locationStrategy=&amp;lt;null&amp;gt;]
org.apache.commons.configuration2.ex.ConfigurationException: Could not locate: org.apache.commons.configuration2.io.FileLocator@57fd91c9[fileName=usergui.properties,basePath=&amp;lt;null&amp;gt;,sourceURL=,encoding=ISO-8859-1,fileSystem=&amp;lt;null&amp;gt;,locationStrategy=&amp;lt;null&amp;gt;]
	at org.apache.commons.configuration2.io.FileLocatorUtils.locateOrThrow(FileLocatorUtils.java:346)
	at org.apache.commons.configuration2.io.FileHandler.load(FileHandler.java:972)
	at org.apache.commons.configuration2.io.FileHandler.load(FileHandler.java:702)
	at org.apache.commons.configuration2.builder.FileBasedConfigurationBuilder.initFileHandler(FileBasedConfigurationBuilder.java:312)
	at org.apache.commons.configuration2.builder.FileBasedConfigurationBuilder.initResultInstance(FileBasedConfigurationBuilder.java:291)
	at org.apache.commons.configuration2.builder.FileBasedConfigurationBuilder.initResultInstance(FileBasedConfigurationBuilder.java:60)
	at org.apache.commons.configuration2.builder.BasicConfigurationBuilder.createResult(BasicConfigurationBuilder.java:421)
	at org.apache.commons.configuration2.builder.BasicConfigurationBuilder.getConfiguration(BasicConfigurationBuilder.java:285)
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;


&lt;p&gt;This can be reproduced with the example code from the User Guide &lt;a href=&quot;https://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-configuration/userguide/howto_properties.html#Using_PropertiesConfiguration&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-configuration/userguide/howto_properties.html#Using_PropertiesConfiguration&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
Parameters params = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; Parameters();

FileBasedConfigurationBuilder&amp;lt;FileBasedConfiguration&amp;gt; builder = 
  &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; FileBasedConfigurationBuilder&amp;lt;FileBasedConfiguration(
    PropertiesConfiguration.class)
      .configure(params.properties()
        .setFileName(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;usergui.properties&quot;&lt;/span&gt;)
        .setListDelimiterHandler(&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; DefaultListDelimiterHandler(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&apos;,&apos;&lt;/span&gt;)));

Configuration config = builder.getConfiguration();

config.setProperty(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;colors.background&quot;&lt;/span&gt;, &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;#000000&quot;&lt;/span&gt;);

builder.save();
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</description>
                <environment>&lt;p&gt;Tested on Windows 10 with Java 10.&lt;/p&gt;</environment>
        <key id="13185849">CONFIGURATION-714</key>
            <summary>PropertiesConfiguration builder.getConfiguration fails</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="10004">Not A Bug</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="jpsacha">Jarek Sacha</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Tue, 18 Sep 2018 16:37:48 +0000</created>
                <updated>Wed, 19 Sep 2018 12:38:35 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Wed, 19 Sep 2018 12:38:35 +0000</resolved>
                                    <version>2.3</version>
                                                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>2</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="16619652" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Tue, 18 Sep 2018 20:10:34 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;According to the exception the file cannot be located. Does it exist in one of the folders that are searched for by default?&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Please note that Jira is not a support forum. If you have questions about using the library, write a mail to the user mailing list: &lt;a href=&quot;http://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-configuration/mailing-lists.html&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;http://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-configuration/mailing-lists.html&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16620524" author="jpsacha" created="Wed, 19 Sep 2018 12:38:03 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;You are correct that file did not exist. &lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I needed to save a configuration created by my code (porting from Configuration v.1*). I was confused by the title of the section in the User Guide: &lt;a href=&quot;https://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-configuration/userguide/howto_properties.html#Saving&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;&quot;Saving&quot;&lt;/a&gt;. I did not fully understand what is going on in the example. The example rather than just saving a configuration, it first loads a configuration, then saves. Since my file did not exist yet I got that exception.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;You can close this issue.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Just for the record. Here is that code that worked for me when saving a new configuration as properties:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// Create your configuration somewhere in the code
&lt;/span&gt;BaseConfiguration conf = ...

&lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// Copy source configuration to PropertiesConfiguration
&lt;/span&gt;PropertiesConfiguration properties = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; PropertiesConfiguration()
ConfigurationUtils.copy(conf, properties)

&lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// Save PropertiesConfiguration
&lt;/span&gt;FileHandler handler = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; FileHandler(properties)
handler.save(file)
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</comment>
                    </comments>

                        </customfieldvalues>
                    </customfield>
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                <customfield id="customfield_12310222" key="com.atlassian.jira.ext.charting:timeinstatus">
                        <customfieldname>Time in Status</customfieldname>
                        <customfieldvalues>
                            
                        </customfieldvalues>
                    </customfield>
                                                                                            </customfields>
    </item>


<item>
            <title>[CONFIGURATION-712] FileHandlerReloadingDetector Does Not Correctly Initialize File Last Modified</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CONFIGURATION-712</link>
                <project id="12310467" key="CONFIGURATION">Commons Configuration</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;https://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-configuration/apidocs/src-html/org/apache/commons/configuration2/reloading/FileHandlerReloadingDetector.html&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;FileHandlerReloadingDetector&lt;/a&gt; declares the following method:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
150    @Override
151    &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;boolean&lt;/span&gt; isReloadingRequired()
152    {
153        &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;long&lt;/span&gt; now = &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;System&lt;/span&gt;.currentTimeMillis();
154        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;if&lt;/span&gt; (now &amp;gt;= lastChecked + getRefreshDelay())
155        {
156            lastChecked = now;
157
158            &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;long&lt;/span&gt; modified = getLastModificationDate();
159            &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;if&lt;/span&gt; (modified &amp;gt; 0)
160            {
161                &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;if&lt;/span&gt; (lastModified == 0)
162                {
163                    &lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// initialization
&lt;/span&gt;164                    updateLastModified(modified);
165                }
166                &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;else&lt;/span&gt;
167                {
168                    &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;if&lt;/span&gt; (modified != lastModified)
169                    {
170                        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;return&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;true&lt;/span&gt;;
171                    }
172                }
173            }
174        }
175
176        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;return&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;false&lt;/span&gt;;
177    }
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;During initialization of&#160;FileHandlerReloadingDetector, lastModified is never instantiated, so the first time isReloadingRequired() is invoked lastModified will be 0.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;This results in two issues:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Test #1&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;ul&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;Scenario Steps&#160;
	&lt;ol&gt;
		&lt;li&gt;Initialize&#160;ReloadingFileBasedConfigurationBuilder without invoking builder.getConfiguration()&lt;/li&gt;
		&lt;li&gt;Wait longer than refreshDelay&lt;/li&gt;
		&lt;li&gt;Invoke&#160;builder.getReloadingController().checkForReloading(null) to notify the&#160;FileHandlerReloadingDetector to check for reload&lt;/li&gt;
		&lt;li&gt;Invoke bulider.getConfiguration()&lt;/li&gt;
		&lt;li&gt;Update the properties file&lt;/li&gt;
		&lt;li&gt;Wait longer than refreshDelay&lt;/li&gt;
		&lt;li&gt;Invoke&#160;builder.getReloadingController().checkForReloading(null) to notify the&#160;FileHandlerReloadingDetector to check for reload&lt;/li&gt;
		&lt;li&gt;Invoke bulider.getConfiguration()&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;/ol&gt;
	&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;Result - the Configuration does not have the updated value.&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;/ul&gt;


&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Test #2&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;ul&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;Scenario Steps&#160;
	&lt;ol&gt;
		&lt;li&gt;Initialize&#160;ReloadingFileBasedConfigurationBuilder without invoking builder.getConfiguration()&lt;/li&gt;
		&lt;li&gt;Invoke bulider.getConfiguration()&lt;/li&gt;
		&lt;li&gt;Update the properties file&lt;/li&gt;
		&lt;li&gt;Wait longer than refreshDelay&lt;/li&gt;
		&lt;li&gt;Invoke&#160;builder.getReloadingController().checkForReloading(null) to notify the&#160;FileHandlerReloadingDetector to check for reload&lt;/li&gt;
		&lt;li&gt;Invoke bulider.getConfiguration()&lt;/li&gt;
		&lt;li&gt;Update the properties file&lt;/li&gt;
		&lt;li&gt;Wait longer than refreshDelay&lt;/li&gt;
		&lt;li&gt;Invoke&#160;builder.getReloadingController().checkForReloading(null) to notify the&#160;FileHandlerReloadingDetector to check for reload&lt;/li&gt;
		&lt;li&gt;Invoke bulider.getConfiguration()&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;/ol&gt;
	&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;Result - For the first two invocations, the Configuration is not updated. One the third invocation of builder.getConfiguration() the property is updated to the new value.&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;/ul&gt;


&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;As potential solution, the constructor of&#160;FileHandlerReloadingDetector should either call&#160;isReloadingRequired() or&#160;updateLastModified(getLastModificationDate()) to initialize the lastModified instance variable to the file current lastModified value.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13180555">CONFIGURATION-712</key>
            <summary>FileHandlerReloadingDetector Does Not Correctly Initialize File Last Modified</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="5" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/resolved.png" description="A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.">Resolved</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="rllndhbb">Rolland Hobbie</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Wed, 22 Aug 2018 20:56:37 +0000</created>
                <updated>Sun, 16 Sep 2018 20:24:11 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Sun, 16 Sep 2018 20:24:11 +0000</resolved>
                                    <version>2.3</version>
                                    <fixVersion>2.4</fixVersion>
                                    <component>File reloading</component>
                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>2</watches>
                                    <timeoriginalestimate seconds="86400">24h</timeoriginalestimate>
                            <timeestimate seconds="86400">24h</timeestimate>
                                        <comments>
                            <comment id="16592692" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Sat, 25 Aug 2018 19:10:09 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Thanks for this report.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I am not sure whether this is a bug, however, as the behavior is documented in the class comment:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;????&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&lt;font color=&quot;#808080&quot;&gt;* To initialize an instance either {&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font color=&quot;#808080&quot;&gt;@code &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font color=&quot;#808080&quot;&gt;isReloadingRequired()} or&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font color=&quot;#808080&quot;&gt;* {&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font color=&quot;#808080&quot;&gt;@code &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font color=&quot;#808080&quot;&gt;reloadingPerformed()} can be called. The first call of&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font color=&quot;#808080&quot;&gt;* {&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font color=&quot;#808080&quot;&gt;@code &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font color=&quot;#808080&quot;&gt;isReloadingRequired} does not perform a check, but obtains the initial&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font color=&quot;#808080&quot;&gt;* modification date of the monitored file. {&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font color=&quot;#808080&quot;&gt;@code &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font color=&quot;#808080&quot;&gt;reloadingPerformed()} always&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font color=&quot;#808080&quot;&gt;* obtains the file&apos;s modification date and stores it internally.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The correct initialization of the reloading detector is indeed tricky. The solutions you describe are a bit problematic because they would require the constructor to call non-final methods on this instance.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The assumption was that the behavior as implemented will probably not be an issue in practice. Do you encounter a real problem in production or is this only a theoretical observation?&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16597622" author="rllndhbb" created="Thu, 30 Aug 2018 16:21:30 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;I&#160;saw the comment in&#160;FileHandlerReloadingDetector, however the&#160;ReloadingFileBasedConfigurationBuilder initializes this class using DefaultReloadingDetectorFactory so wouldn&apos;t the responsibility be for the&#160;factory to fully initialize FileHandlerReloadingDetector?&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I also saw other places in the documentation&#160;state, &quot;If the underlying file has not been changed, this check has no effect. However, if the file has been changed by an external source, an updated last-modified date is detected, and the reloading detector signals a need for a reload&quot;&#160;(&lt;a href=&quot;https://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-configuration/userguide/howto_reloading.html)&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-configuration/userguide/howto_reloading.html)&lt;/a&gt;, with no mention of requiring further initialization of the&#160;ReloadingDetector.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Given the example in the documentation, both test scenarios fail.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;ul&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;Test #1 behaves the same as my example - incorrectly&#160;returns the initial configuration value (&quot;1&quot; not &quot;2&quot;)&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;Test #2 behaves the same as my example - incorrectly returns the&#160;initial configuration value for both the first and second invocations, and returns the updated value for the third invocation (&quot;3&quot; and the change of &quot;2&quot; is never seen)&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;/ul&gt;


&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I am unable to take my implementation&#160;to production because these tests scenarios fail. Given Test #1, if I change the trigger period to be 24 hours, and update the properties after 24 hours, the application would&#160;not&#160;see the updated&#160;changes. And, given Test #2 the changes would only be seen if the properties were updated a second time, and&#160;then only after another cycle&#160;of the triggering&#160;period&#160;(in the case of 24 hours only after 48 hours), but the first change would never be seen by the application.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16599653" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Sat, 1 Sep 2018 15:07:38 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Letting &lt;tt&gt;DefaultReloadingDetectorFactory&lt;/tt&gt; take care for the initialization of the reloading detector is a good idea. We can change this. Do you want to create a patch for this?&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Also, if you have concrete suggestions how to improve documentation, please let us know; this is highly appreciated.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16609247" author="rllndhbb" created="Mon, 10 Sep 2018 13:59:36 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;I have attached a patch for the change fix.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I ended up creating a new refresh() method on&#160;FileHandlerReloadingDetector,&#160;which initializes the last modified field. I thought it was confusing for the factory to invoke reloadingPerformed() in order to initialize last modified.&#160;I considered other approaches for this fix, but decided on this approach as it was the most isolated change and the least impact.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;If other *ReloadingDetector implementations will&#160;need&#160;the ability of initializing state, maybe a new interface could be created to define refresh()?&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16615222" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Fri, 14 Sep 2018 18:37:35 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Thanks for the patch!&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;It looks good, and I also like the idea with the new refresh() method. The only thing I am not sure about is the change on the isReloadingRequired() method. Is this really necessary?&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;If I understand correctly, the changed method now expects that refresh() has been called before. This would change the behavior for users that create an instance of FileHandlerReloadingDetector directly without the factory. If the method was not changed, it would now still work correctly with the updated factory, wouldn&apos;t it?&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16615273" author="rllndhbb" created="Fri, 14 Sep 2018 19:21:31 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;That&apos;s a fair point, which I did not consider.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I don&apos;t think it is necessary to include the change for the isReloadingRequired() method.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I can recreate the patch and rerun the unit tests to verify.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16616366" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Sat, 15 Sep 2018 15:45:43 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Yes, this would be great. Many thanks in advance!&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16616600" author="rllndhbb" created="Sun, 16 Sep 2018 05:38:26 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;I have attached the updated patch. I reverted the change&#160;in the&#160;isReloadingRequired() method of&#160;FileHandlerReloadingDetector. I also reverted the two test methods that were changed (leaving these methods unchanged to validate the original functionality), and added two new methods to test the new functionality with invoking the refresh method after instantiation.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Since you asked about documentation, I think it would be worth&#160;adding a note to&#160;FileHandlerReloadingDetector along the lines of:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;blockquote&gt;&lt;p&gt;There is a cycle between the instantiation of&#160;FileHandlerReloadingDetector and the first invocation of&#160;isReloadingRequired() where no file changes are detected. The first file change detected by default is&#160;after the first&#160;invocation of&#160;isReloadingRequired(), and because&#160;FileHandlerReloadingDetector is recreated when the configuration is reset, this &quot;unobserved cycle&quot; is repeated after every reload of a configuration. To eliminate this &quot;unobserved cycle&quot;, the refresh() method can be invoked after instantiation to force the FileHandlerReloadingDetector to load the file&apos;s current last modified date, which is used in future calls of&#160;isReloadingRequired() to determine if the file has changed.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/blockquote&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16616885" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Sun, 16 Sep 2018 20:24:11 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Patch applied in SVN revision 1841034. Many thanks again!&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;If you want to be added to the contributor&apos;s section in pom.xml, please post the data you want to get in.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>

<item>
            <title>[CONFIGURATION-708] Not able to build the source code</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CONFIGURATION-708</link>
                <project id="12310467" key="CONFIGURATION">Commons Configuration</project>
                    <description>&lt;ol&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;Took source code from &quot;https://github.com/apache/commons-configuration/tree/CONFIGURATION_2_1_1&quot;&lt;/li&gt;

	&lt;li&gt;Got the below error:&lt;br/&gt;

 dependencies could not be resolved: Could not find artifact org.apache.maven.pl&lt;br/&gt;
ugins:maven-install-plugin:jar:2.5.2&quot;&lt;/li&gt;

<item>
            <title>[CONFIGURATION-703] xml:space=&quot;preserve&quot; does not handle blank strings properly</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CONFIGURATION-703</link>
                <project id="12310467" key="CONFIGURATION">Commons Configuration</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;When using XMLConfiguration 2, tags containing only white spaces are not handled properly when xml:space=&quot;preserve&quot; is set.&#160; &apos;null&apos; is returned instead of the actual spaces.&#160; To reproduce:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
XMLConfiguration xml = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; BasicConfigurationBuilder&amp;lt;&amp;gt;(
        XMLConfiguration.class).configure(
            &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; Parameters().xml()).getConfiguration();
FileHandler fh = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; FileHandler(xml);
fh.load(&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; StringReader(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;&amp;lt;test xml:space=\&quot;&lt;/span&gt;preserve\&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;&amp;gt;    &amp;lt;/test&amp;gt;&quot;&lt;/span&gt;));
&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;System&lt;/span&gt;.out.println(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;TEST: &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&apos;&quot;&lt;/span&gt; + xml.getString(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;&quot;) + &quot;&lt;/span&gt;&apos;&lt;/span&gt;&quot;);
&lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// Outputs   -&amp;gt; TEST: &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&apos;&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;null&lt;/span&gt;&apos;&lt;/span&gt;
&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// Should be -&amp;gt; TEST: &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&apos;    &apos;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13161965">CONFIGURATION-703</key>
            <summary>xml:space=&quot;preserve&quot; does not handle blank strings properly</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="pascal.essiembre">Pascal Essiembre</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Fri, 25 May 2018 02:59:01 +0000</created>
                <updated>Wed, 8 Aug 2018 20:28:46 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Sat, 9 Jun 2018 20:02:42 +0000</resolved>
                                    <version>2.2</version>
                                    <fixVersion>2.3</fixVersion>
                                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>2</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="16490175" author="pascal.essiembre" created="Fri, 25 May 2018 03:23:17 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Not sure if it impacts anything else negatively, but removing this change in XMLConfiguration#constructHierarchy(...) seems to do solve the issue:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
...

&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;else&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;if&lt;/span&gt; (w3cNode &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;instanceof&lt;/span&gt; Text)
{
    &lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;//START fix
&lt;/span&gt;    attributes.remove(ATTR_SPACE_INTERNAL);
    &lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;//END fix
&lt;/span&gt;    Text data = (Text) w3cNode;
    buffer.append(data.getData());
}

...&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16491674" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Sat, 26 May 2018 14:25:52 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Thanks for this report.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;From the unit tests of &lt;tt&gt;XMLConfiguration&lt;/tt&gt; I expect that the handling of the of the &lt;em&gt;xml:space&lt;/em&gt; attribute should work in principle. Your case is somewhat special as it applies this attribute to the rool element and does not have any other elements in the XML document. So the problem could be specific to this constellation.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Did you test with other documents containing multiple elements? (Just to rule out that there is a general problem.)&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;After applying your fix, do the unit tests still pass?&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16491835" author="pascal.essiembre" created="Sat, 26 May 2018 21:55:20 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;It applies&#160;on any elements, not just root.&#160; For instance, the second test fails here:&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt; xml = 
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;&amp;lt;test&amp;gt;&quot;&lt;/span&gt;
      + &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;&amp;lt;tagNoPreserve&amp;gt; &amp;lt;/tagNoPreserve&amp;gt;&quot;&lt;/span&gt;
      + &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;&amp;lt;tagPreserve xml:space=\&quot;&lt;/span&gt;preserve\&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;&amp;gt;   &amp;lt;/tagPreserve&amp;gt;&quot;&lt;/span&gt;
      + &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;&amp;lt;/test&amp;gt;&quot;&lt;/span&gt;;
 
XMLConfiguration c = XMLConfigurationUtil.newXMLConfiguration(xml);
Assert.assertEquals(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;&quot;, c.getString(&quot;&lt;/span&gt;tagNoPreserve&quot;));
Assert.assertEquals(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;   &quot;&lt;/span&gt;, c.getString(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;tagPreserve&quot;&lt;/span&gt;));
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I have not tried running unit tests from the Configuration project itself.&#160; I&apos;ll do that when I get a chance.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;FYI, ``ConfigurationUtils`` encapsulates the creation logic described&#160;in my original post.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16491853" author="pascal.essiembre" created="Sat, 26 May 2018 23:55:49 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;With my suggested fix, this test fails:&#160; TestHierarchicalXMLConfiguration#testXmlNodeTypes&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;So we probably need another one.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I also discovered that child with spaces will get returned properly if the parent tag owns the xml:space=&quot;preserve&quot;.&#160; In other words this works :&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
&amp;lt;test&amp;gt;
  &amp;lt;tagParent xml:space=&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;preserve&quot;&lt;/span&gt;&amp;gt;
    &amp;lt;tagChild&amp;gt;   &amp;lt;/tagChild&amp;gt;
  &amp;lt;/tagParent&amp;gt;
&amp;lt;/test&amp;gt;&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;White this does not:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
&amp;lt;test&amp;gt;
  &amp;lt;tagParent&amp;gt;
    &amp;lt;tagChild xml:space=&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;preserve&quot;&lt;/span&gt;&amp;gt;   &amp;lt;/tagChild&amp;gt;
  &amp;lt;/tagParent&amp;gt;
&amp;lt;/test&amp;gt;&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Shouldn&apos;t &quot;tagChild&quot; spaces be preserved in both cases?&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16492075" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Sun, 27 May 2018 16:11:21 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Yes, it should. What confuses me is that we have a test exactly for this use case: &lt;em&gt;TestXMLConfiguration.testPreserveSpaceOnElement()&lt;/em&gt;. This test has been introduced for a similar report: &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CONFIGURATION-555&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;CONFIGURATION-555&lt;/a&gt;. Not sure why this now pops up again. Maybe the solution implemented then was not complete.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16492082" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Sun, 27 May 2018 16:22:58 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Oh, found the reason: The &lt;em&gt;determineValue()&lt;/em&gt; method in &lt;tt&gt;XMLConfiguration&lt;/tt&gt; handles elements that have only whitespace as content in a special way. Space is only preserved if the element has some other text content rather than exclusively whitespace. This was obviously implemented this way to not change behavior and break existing code. This is of course still a problem.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16496051" author="pascal.essiembre" created="Thu, 31 May 2018 03:54:08 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;OK, I&apos;ve got a fix that does not break any tests.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;In XMLConfiguration#constructHierarchy, where the &quot;childrenFlag&quot; is set, the attribute size is &quot;wrongfully&quot; 2 when the &quot;xml:space&quot; attribute is present, since &quot;config-xml:space&quot; get added&#160;by the code.&#160; So the following is my fix for it, without modifying the attributes gathered so far:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;boolean&lt;/span&gt; childrenFlag = hasChildren || (attributes.size() &amp;gt; 1 &amp;amp;&amp;amp; !VALUE_PRESERVE.equals(attributes.get(ATTR_SPACE)));&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16496692" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Thu, 31 May 2018 15:13:22 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Yes, this looks good. So the actual bug was that an element was considered to have children if it had at least one &apos;real&apos; attribute, but in this case the attributes related to whitespace management were counted.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16496896" author="pascal.essiembre" created="Thu, 31 May 2018 17:38:26 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Yes, but now that I think about it, even if the tests pass, I think the following would be safer (just reducing the count when dealing with space preserve):&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;boolean&lt;/span&gt; childrenFlag = hasChildren || (attributes.size() - (VALUE_PRESERVE.equals(attributes.get(ATTR_SPACE)) ? 1 : 0)  &amp;gt; 1);
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;That makes me wonder.  I am not familiar with the entire logic, but why are we considering attributes as &quot;children&quot; for the purpose of preserving spaces?  Shouldn&apos;t we care about child &quot;elements&quot; only?  I mean, don&apos;t we want to preserve spaces in this context:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-xml&quot;&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;tag xml:space=&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;preserve&quot;&lt;/span&gt; attribute1=&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;value1&quot;&lt;/span&gt; attribute2=&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;value2&quot;&lt;/span&gt; attribute3=&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;value3&quot;&lt;/span&gt; ...&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;   &lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;/tagChild&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16498390" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Fri, 1 Jun 2018 18:35:00 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;To be honest, I do not remember why it has been implemented this way. What you say sounds logic, and I also do not see a reason why an element with attributes should not be able to preserve its spaces. How do the tests react when this is changed?&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16498902" author="pascal.essiembre" created="Sat, 2 Jun 2018 06:21:56 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Some of the tests fail when I do not consider child attributes.  The reason seems to be that some tests expect &lt;tt&gt;null&lt;/tt&gt; while others expect an empty string when we are not preserving spaces and there is no content.  Shouldn&apos;t it be consistent? If so, I have a fix, but for it to work we would have to settle on one or the other and modify a few tests accordingly.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16500824" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Mon, 4 Jun 2018 20:30:30 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Yes, it would be better if this was handled in a consistent way, and I am a bit worried that this does not seem to be the case. I remember that already for Configuration 1.0 there was a change so that one can find out whether there is an empty element or no element at all, such as &amp;lt;myElem/&amp;gt;. I think if such an element is present, a query for its value will not return &lt;b&gt;null&lt;/b&gt;, but an empty string.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16501199" author="pascal.essiembre" created="Tue, 5 Jun 2018 02:24:26 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;I did a bit of research, and it seems the XML specs says &lt;tt&gt;&amp;lt;myElem/&amp;gt;&lt;/tt&gt; and&#160;&lt;tt&gt;&amp;lt;myElem&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/myElem&amp;gt;&lt;/tt&gt; should both be treated the same: empty string.&#160; &lt;tt&gt;null&lt;/tt&gt; can be returned if the element does not exist at all.  The one that is unclear to me is when an element has an &lt;tt&gt;xsi:nil=&quot;true&quot;&lt;/tt&gt; attribute.  That attribute signifies an element is &lt;tt&gt;null&lt;/tt&gt;.  It looks as if that special flag is used to indicate no values when dealing with enums since technically an empty string is not a valid value for those.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16502381" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Tue, 5 Jun 2018 19:41:45 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Thanks for looking this up.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;However, I am still not sure how to interpret this in the context of Commons Configuration where the focus lies in providing access to configuration data and not necessarily exact XML processing. I don&apos;t think that it is a frequent use case to define configuration properties with whitespace in all possible variations. So if we can comply to the specs with reasonable effort (and do not break existing code), this is great. But IMHO it is more important to be consistent in our own API, and we do not have to support every corner case mentioned in the specs.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16502829" author="pascal.essiembre" created="Wed, 6 Jun 2018 05:22:12 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;It all makes sense.&#160; What should it be then?&#160; I think it is logical for a missing element to be null while any empty element should be an empty string, unless there are white spaces&#160;and&#160;xml:space=&quot;preserve&quot; is set.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Is that what you have in mind?&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16503784" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Wed, 6 Jun 2018 19:29:00 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Yes, I agree - and I think this is mostly in-line with the current implementation in &lt;tt&gt;XMLConfiguration&lt;/tt&gt; except for the issues with whitespace preserving. So if you could create a patch that goes in this direction, this will be highly appreciated.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16504233" author="pascal.essiembre" created="Thu, 7 Jun 2018 04:44:55 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;OK, I gave it a serious look and provided a simple fix that resolves the issue and does not break any tests:&#160;&lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/apache/commons-configuration/pull/11/&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://github.com/apache/commons-configuration/pull/11/&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16505172" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Thu, 7 Jun 2018 19:50:55 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Many thanks! I will have a look in a few days.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16507141" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Sat, 9 Jun 2018 20:02:42 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;The patch was applied (with minor tweaks) in SVN revision 1833251. Many thanks again.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;If you want to be listed in the contributors section of pom.xml, please send us the data you want to have added.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16507225" author="pascal.essiembre" created="Sun, 10 Jun 2018 01:25:41 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Sure, here you go:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-xml&quot;&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;name&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;Pascal Essiembre&lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;/name&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;

<item>
            <title>[CONFIGURATION-700] Issue With backslash(\) and Forwardslash(/)</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CONFIGURATION-700</link>
                <project id="12310467" key="CONFIGURATION">Commons Configuration</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;Dear Team,&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I am using commons-configuration-1.10.jar for updating property file in java.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I have achieve all my requirement(Preserve comment, White space) with this API.But stuck at one point.It is not working as per my expectations with slash.Below is one example.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I have below url in my properties file.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&lt;b&gt;C\:ABC.net/wsdl&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Now it is getting change to below after modification&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&lt;b&gt;C:ABC.net\/wsdl&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Means it is removing the backslash and changing forwardslash to \/.I know it is escaping character. But is there any way to prevent this. I cant not change any thing in property file. I have to handle through code only.&#160;Because of only this issue&#160;I again moved to Java util API.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Please check fix of this. Rest is excellent.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13157795">CONFIGURATION-700</key>
            <summary>Issue With backslash(\) and Forwardslash(/)</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/open.png" description="The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.">Open</status>
                    <statusCategory id="2" key="new" colorName="blue-gray"/>
                                    <resolution id="-1">Unresolved</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="amitkpandey">Amitabh Pandey</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Tue, 8 May 2018 05:08:54 +0000</created>
                <updated>Mon, 24 Sep 2018 11:07:07 +0000</updated>
                                            <version>1.10</version>
                                    <fixVersion>1.10</fixVersion>
                                    <component>Build</component>
                        <due></due>

                                    <watches>3</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="16467910" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Tue, 8 May 2018 20:06:56 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Regarding the backslash: This is a limitation of Java properties files. Commons Configuration behaves here in the same way as &lt;a href=&quot;#load-java.io.Reader-&quot; title=&quot;https://docs.oracle.com/javase/8/docs/api/java/util/Properties.html#load-java.io.Reader-.]&quot;&gt;Properties.load()&lt;/a&gt;. Please have a look at the Javadocs of this method. Basically, you have to duplicate the backslash in order to correctly escape it.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Regarding the slash: I remeber that older versions of Commons Configuration had issues with the handling of slashes and escapes. You did not show the code how the properties file was manipulated. As it is unlikely that there will be another release of the Configuration 1.x series, I can only recommend to upgrade to the most recent 2.x version. However, this version is not API-compatible with Configuration 1.10; so you will have to adapt your code. Refer to &lt;a href=&quot;http://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-configuration/userguide/upgradeto2_0.html&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;this guide&lt;/a&gt;.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16468289" author="amitkpandey" created="Wed, 9 May 2018 03:51:25 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Hi Heger,Thanks for the reply.As per your suggestion I have used commons-configuration2-2.0.jar jar.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Now found one of my issue has been resolved. Now slash is coming properly&#160;after modification.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Thanks for this.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Here is my code which I am using&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;FileBasedConfigurationBuilder&amp;lt;PropertiesConfiguration&amp;gt; &lt;font color=&quot;#6a3e3e&quot;&gt;builder&lt;/font&gt; = &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color=&quot;#7f0055&quot;&gt;new&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; FileBasedConfigurationBuilder&amp;lt;PropertiesConfiguration&amp;gt;(&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;PropertiesConfiguration.&lt;b&gt;&lt;font color=&quot;#7f0055&quot;&gt;class&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;)&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;.configure(&lt;b&gt;&lt;font color=&quot;#7f0055&quot;&gt;new&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; Parameters().properties().setFileName(&lt;font color=&quot;#2a00ff&quot;&gt;&quot;Test.properties&quot;&lt;/font&gt;)&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;.setThrowExceptionOnMissing(&lt;b&gt;&lt;font color=&quot;#7f0055&quot;&gt;true&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;));&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;PropertiesConfiguration &lt;font color=&quot;#6a3e3e&quot;&gt;config&lt;/font&gt; = &lt;font color=&quot;#6a3e3e&quot;&gt;builder&lt;/font&gt;.getConfiguration();&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&lt;font color=&quot;#6a3e3e&quot;&gt;config&lt;/font&gt;.setProperty(&lt;font color=&quot;#2a00ff&quot;&gt;&quot;Id&quot;&lt;/font&gt;, &lt;font color=&quot;#2a00ff&quot;&gt;&quot;3&quot;&lt;/font&gt;);&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&lt;font color=&quot;#6a3e3e&quot;&gt;builder&lt;/font&gt;.save();&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;System.&lt;b&gt;&lt;em&gt;&lt;font color=&quot;#0000c0&quot;&gt;out&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/em&gt;&lt;/b&gt;.println(&lt;font color=&quot;#2a00ff&quot;&gt;&quot;config.properties updated Successfully!!&quot;&lt;/font&gt;);&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Now still one issue is pending of backslash.Now it is not removing as previously but it is getting converted in two backslash. Below is the sample&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Before:&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; C\:ABC.net/wsdl&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;After updation&#160; C&lt;br/&gt;
:ABC.net/wsdl&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Please let me know if there is any fix for this also as we have already escaped value in property file with \.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;So it should not be change after any other value in property file.I have attached the screenshot for above example.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Thanks&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;.&#160;&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16468544" author="sebb@apache.org" created="Wed, 9 May 2018 08:25:50 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;If the property value represents a path name, in most cases you can use forward-slash instead of back-slash and Java will handle it the same way. This avoids the problem.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Backslashes are also special to JIRA, so if you want to be precise about file contents I suggest you create small sample files and attach them to the issue, rather than trying to use the correct number of back-slashes so that JIRA displays correctly.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16468548" author="amitkpandey" created="Wed, 9 May 2018 08:28:32 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Because of formatting issue I have attached the screenshot. Please check once.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16469021" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Wed, 9 May 2018 16:18:10 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;I am not sure whether anything can be done about the backslash. When the properties file is written with Commons Configuration it of course produces a syntactically correct output; and according to the specification (see the Javadoc link I posted before), a backslash has to be escaped. The library is fault tolerant to read the actually invalid input file, but it cannot be forced to generate invalid output.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16469888" author="amitkpandey" created="Thu, 10 May 2018 04:09:18 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;If I used Properties class of java util package then updated file getting generate correctly. Means it&apos;s not escaping anything. Only the key which I am updating is getting update.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Problem in this, that all comments and whitespaces gone.If it working with Properties class then it should work with Common Configuration also...&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Thanks&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16470155" author="sebb@apache.org" created="Thu, 10 May 2018 09:46:33 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Sorry, but it&apos;s still not entirely clear what the input and output are, and what you expect the output to be.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Can you please provide the following files:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;ul class=&quot;alternate&quot; type=&quot;square&quot;&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;original input&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;your code to transform the input&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;output file generated by your code&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;the output you are expecting&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;/ul&gt;


&lt;p&gt;That will make it much easier to investigate.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16471485" author="amitkpandey" created="Fri, 11 May 2018 04:37:50 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;1-Original Property File Content has been attached .I was not able to attach the property file here so I have attached the image file of the property file content&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;2-Code .I that I am using motioned above. In property file I have to update only id,which I am updating from 1 to 3 or any other value from code.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;3-Attached with Getting output. All backslash got converted with two backslash.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;4-Expecting output will be that only id should be updated and nothing else. No slash should be changed In any other tag.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Hope now it will be clear. Let me know if you need anything else.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16471696" author="sebb@apache.org" created="Fri, 11 May 2018 09:36:37 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;I have tried your code with the current version (2.2). It works fine.&lt;br/&gt;
However it does remove the escapes from \: and \=. AFAICT these are not needed.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;It&apos;s unlikely there will be any updates to 1.1, so I suggest you try with 2.2 and see if that solves your issue.&lt;br/&gt;
Note that you will need to migrate the code (though your sample worked without change).&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16471720" author="amitkpandey" created="Fri, 11 May 2018 10:10:51 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Can you share the output which you have generated. Can we not avoid the escaping as you have mentioned also.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I assume that you are talking about common configuration version 2.2.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I just let you know that this property file will be used by some other application. That&apos;s why i don&apos;t want any change in any other tag with escaping. This property file belongs to that system and all the values which are inside used by them. So it would not work if any this will be changed in escaping character.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16472054" author="sebb@apache.org" created="Fri, 11 May 2018 14:58:46 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Yes, I used v 2.2 (I had assumed you were using 1.10, based on the initial issue, however I now see your code was written for 2.2).&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;See the Test-input and Test-output attachments for the behaviour I am seeing.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Note that provided the code that reads the property file using standard methods (such as java.util.Properties), it won&apos;t matter that&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;preformatted panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;preformattedContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre&gt;C\:\\ANC
is replaced by
C:\\ANC
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;If it &lt;b&gt;does&lt;/b&gt; make a difference to your app, then the input file format is not a standard properties format, and you cannot expect Commons Configuration to preserve the exact syntax. In which case I suggest you use some form of text editor which can preserve the exact layout.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;To show that the two files are equivalent (apart from the value of id) I wrote a program to show how java.util.Properties processes the input: Read.java&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16472063" author="sebb@apache.org" created="Fri, 11 May 2018 15:02:03 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Looks like JIRA is currently broken for attaching files. (to this issue)&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16472076" author="sebb@apache.org" created="Fri, 11 May 2018 15:10:06 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;I created a new issue and attached the files there: &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CONFIGURATION-702&quot; title=&quot;Test issue to see if attachments are broken here&quot; class=&quot;issue-link&quot; data-issue-key=&quot;CONFIGURATION-702&quot;&gt;&lt;del&gt;CONFIGURATION-702&lt;/del&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16472126" author="sebb@apache.org" created="Fri, 11 May 2018 15:39:58 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;I&apos;ve done a bit more digging into the Properties Javadoc.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The doc for load():&lt;br/&gt;
&lt;a href=&quot;https://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/util/Properties.html#load(java.io.Reader&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/util/Properties.html#load(java.io.Reader&lt;/a&gt;)&lt;br/&gt;
does not mention escaping &apos;:&apos; and &apos;=&apos; in element values.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;However, the doc for store()&lt;br/&gt;
&lt;a href=&quot;https://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/util/Properties.html#store(java.io.Writer,%20java.lang.String&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/util/Properties.html#store(java.io.Writer,%20java.lang.String&lt;/a&gt;)&lt;br/&gt;
says: &quot;The key and element characters #, !, =, and : are written with a preceding backslash to ensure that they are properly loaded.&quot;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;As far as I can tell it&apos;s unnecessary to escape = and : in element values.&lt;br/&gt;
However it does no harm, as \x is treated the same as x if the sequence \x is not special (unlike Java which complains)&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16473766" author="amitkpandey" created="Mon, 14 May 2018 04:48:29 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Thanks Sebb for your effort.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I will check once this at my end.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16480485" author="sebb@apache.org" created="Fri, 18 May 2018 11:00:29 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Attachments seem to be working again, so copied the files from &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CONFIGURATION-702&quot; title=&quot;Test issue to see if attachments are broken here&quot; class=&quot;issue-link&quot; data-issue-key=&quot;CONFIGURATION-702&quot;&gt;&lt;del&gt;CONFIGURATION-702&lt;/del&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</comment>

<item>
            <title>[CONFIGURATION-699] HierarchicalConfiguration childConfigurationsAt(String key) method not throws exception if key is not found in XML file</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CONFIGURATION-699</link>
                <project id="12310467" key="CONFIGURATION">Commons Configuration</project>
                    <description>&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
List&amp;lt;HierarchicalConfiguration&amp;lt;ImmutableNode&amp;gt;&amp;gt; hierarchicalConfigurations = configuration.childConfigurationsAt(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;key&quot;&lt;/span&gt;);
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;will return empty list if &quot;key&quot; is not in xml file, but&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
HierarchicalConfiguration&amp;lt;ImmutableNode&amp;gt; nodeHierarchicalConfiguration = configuration.configurationAt(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;key&quot;&lt;/span&gt;);
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;will throw ConfigurationRuntimeException.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;So if you don&apos;t get an exception, you may think that there is not nodes under &quot;key&quot; (, but actually xml file not contains&#160;&quot;key&quot; (is not valid). To avoid it you have to call in try/catch&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
configuration.configurationAt(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;key&quot;&lt;/span&gt;)&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;first,&#160;that&#160;may produce an exception and then use&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
configuration.childConfigurationsAt(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;key&quot;&lt;/span&gt;);&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13155148">CONFIGURATION-699</key>
            <summary>HierarchicalConfiguration childConfigurationsAt(String key) method not throws exception if key is not found in XML file</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="2">Won&apos;t Fix</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="Reeson2003">Pavel Gavrilov</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Wed, 25 Apr 2018 14:46:12 +0000</created>
                <updated>Thu, 26 Apr 2018 19:24:59 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Thu, 26 Apr 2018 19:24:47 +0000</resolved>
                                                                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>2</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="16452944" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Wed, 25 Apr 2018 19:39:09 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;I am not sure I fully understand your point. Both methods work as they are designed and are documented in their Javadocs; so this is not a bug.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The reason why &lt;em&gt;configurationAt()&lt;/em&gt; throws an exception and &lt;em&gt;configurationsAt()&lt;/em&gt; does not is that for the former you have to select exactly one configuration node; otherwise, no sub configuration can be created. So there are not many other options than failing. For &lt;em&gt;configurationsAt()&lt;/em&gt;, which returns a List, the number of elements in the result list corresponds to the number of selected nodes. So you can easily find out if nodes have been retrieved. I do not get what you mean by XML file not valid.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I would not want to change this. For some use cases it may be desirable to receive an empty list, e.g. if configuration properties are optional. Also, a change of the behavior of this method would break existing code.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16454312" author="reeson2003" created="Thu, 26 Apr 2018 14:33:41 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Thank you for your answer. I&apos;ve understood that&apos;s not an issue. Closing this.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16454732" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Thu, 26 Apr 2018 19:24:47 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Closing as requested by the reporter.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                    </comments>
