<item>
            <title>[CONFIGURATION-640] Colon in properties file value no longer unescaped in commons configuration 2</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CONFIGURATION-640</link>
                <project id="12310467" key="CONFIGURATION">Commons Configuration</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;A properties file create with java escape a colon in for example a path like &lt;br/&gt;
C:\test as &lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;preformatted panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;preformattedContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre&gt;C\:\\test&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;When reading this property value in commons configuration the colon is unescaped, C:\test&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;When reading the property value in commons configuration 2 the colon is no longer unescaped, C\:\test.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Snipped of the code I used for reading the property&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; ConfigurationBuilder&amp;lt;PropertiesConfiguration&amp;gt; builder =                            &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; FileBasedConfigurationBuilder&amp;lt;&amp;gt;(PropertiesConfiguration.class).configure(&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; Parameters().properties().setFile(path.toFile());

&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; PropertiesConfiguration propertiesConfiguration = builder.getConfiguration();
Assert.assertEquals(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;C:\\test&quot;&lt;/span&gt;, propertiesConfiguration.getString(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;test2&quot;&lt;/span&gt;));

&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I&apos;ve read this &lt;a href=&quot;http://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-configuration/userguide_v1.10/howto_properties.html#Special_Characters_and_Escaping&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;section&lt;/a&gt; so I&apos;m aware of the changes to escaping, but I&apos;m not sure how the escaping of the colon fits into this and if there is a way around this.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13008563">CONFIGURATION-640</key>
            <summary>Colon in properties file value no longer unescaped in commons configuration 2</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="4" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/minor.svg">Minor</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="tom.byttebier">Tom Byttebier</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Thu, 29 Sep 2016 15:03:27 +0000</created>
                <updated>Mon, 28 Nov 2016 09:07:01 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Fri, 7 Oct 2016 20:08:29 +0000</resolved>
                                    <version>2.1</version>
                                    <fixVersion>2.1.1</fixVersion>
                                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>2</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="15533820" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Thu, 29 Sep 2016 19:34:42 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Thanks for the report. There have been many changes in the escaping logic between version 1.x and 2.x, so it is well possible that a bug crept in or a feature got lost. I will have a look.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15556110" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Fri, 7 Oct 2016 20:08:29 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;A fix has been applied in revision 1763821.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;In Configuration 1.x, unescaping was done for all characters except for the list delimiter character. This was changed for Configuration 2.x because here the list delimiter character is not known to the configuration, but is managed by the ListDelimiterHandler. As a side-effect, the unescaping got lost.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The fix now adds a special handling for a number of characters that are listed in the Javadocs of the &lt;em&gt;Properties.store()&lt;/em&gt; method to be always escaped:&lt;br/&gt;
&lt;a href=&quot;http://docs.oracle.com/javase/8/docs/api/java/util/Properties.html#store-java.io.Writer-java.lang.String-&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;http://docs.oracle.com/javase/8/docs/api/java/util/Properties.html#store-java.io.Writer-java.lang.String-&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15701372" author="tom.byttebier" created="Mon, 28 Nov 2016 09:07:00 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Tested on 2.2-SNAPSHOT and it is fixed&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                    </comments>
                    <attachments>
                    </attachments>
                <subtasks>
                    </subtasks>

<item>
            <title>[CONFIGURATION-639] OSGi Import-Package declaration not complete regarding optional dependencies</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CONFIGURATION-639</link>
                <project id="12310467" key="CONFIGURATION">Commons Configuration</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;common-configuration2&apos;s pom.xml correctly defines optional dependencies like vfs2 or spring with &amp;lt;optional&amp;gt;.&lt;br/&gt;
However, it does only declare a subset of those as optional OSGi-dependencies:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-xml&quot;&gt;    &lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;!-- Explicitly declare optional dependencies for the OSGi manifest. --&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;
    &lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;commons.osgi.import&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;
      org.apache.commons.beanutils.*;resolution:=optional,
      org.apache.commons.codec.*;resolution:=optional,
      org.apache.commons.jxpath.*;resolution:=optional,
      org.apache.xml.resolver.*;resolution:=optional,
      javax.servlet.*;resolution:=optional,
      org.apache.commons.jexl2.*;resolution:=optional,
      org.apache.commons.vfs2.*;resolution:=optional,
      *
    &lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;/commons.osgi.import&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;See &lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/apache/commons-configuration/blob/trunk/pom.xml&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://github.com/apache/commons-configuration/blob/trunk/pom.xml&lt;/a&gt; for both above.&lt;br/&gt;
Due to the missing &quot;resolution:=optional, commons-configuration2 cannot be deployed in an OSGi-environment not providing the optional bundles.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Example error on deploy:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;Unable to resolve Module[org.apache.commons.configuration:2.1.0]: missing requirement [Module[org.apache.commons.configuration:2.1.0]] &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;package&lt;/span&gt;; (&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;package&lt;/span&gt;=org.springframework.beans.factory)
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Please have a look if you agree and add the missing instructions for the remaining optional dependencies.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Manually fixed Import-package statement looks like this (disregarding line-breaks):&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;Import-Package: javax.naming,javax.servlet;resolution:=optional,javax.sql,javax.xml.parsers,javax.xml.transform,javax.xml.transform.dom,javax.xml.transform.stream,org.apache.commons.beanutils;resolution:=optional,org.apache.commons.codec.binary;resolution:=optional,org.apache.commons.jexl2;resolution:=optional,org.apache.commons.jxpath;resolution:=optional,org.apache.commons.jxpath.ri;resolution:=optional,org.apache.commons.jxpath.ri.compiler;resolution:=optional,org.apache.commons.jxpath.ri.model;resolution:=optional,org.apache.commons.lang3;version=&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;[3.3,4)&quot;&lt;/span&gt;,org.apache.commons.lang3.builder;version=&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;[3.3,4)&quot;&lt;/span&gt;,org.apache.commons.lang3.concurrent;version=&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;[3.3,4)&quot;&lt;/span&gt;,org.apache.commons.lang3.mutable;version=&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;[3.3,4)&quot;&lt;/span&gt;,org.apache.commons.lang3.text;version=&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;[3.3,4)&quot;&lt;/span&gt;,org.apache.commons.lang3.text.translate;version=&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;[3.3,4)&quot;&lt;/span&gt;,org.apache.commons.logging;version=&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;[1.2,2)&quot;&lt;/span&gt;,org.apache.commons.logging.impl;version=&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;[1.2,2)&quot;&lt;/span&gt;,org.apache.commons.vfs2;resolution:=optional,org.apache.commons.vfs2.provider;resolution:=optional,org.apache.xml.resolver;resolution:=optional,org.apache.xml.resolver.helpers;resolution:=optional,org.apache.xml.resolver.readers;resolution:=optional,org.apache.xml.resolver.tools;resolution:=optional,org.springframework.beans.factory;resolution:=optional,org.springframework.core.env;resolution:=optional,org.springframework.core.io;resolution:=optional,org.springframework.util;resolution:=optional,org.w3c.dom,org.xml.sax,org.xml.sax.helpers
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</description>
                <environment>&lt;p&gt;OSGi-container&lt;/p&gt;</environment>
        <key id="13003133">CONFIGURATION-639</key>
            <summary>OSGi Import-Package declaration not complete regarding optional dependencies</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="riconeubauer">Rico Neubauer</reporter>
                        <labels>
                            <label>commons-configuration</label>
                            <label>osgi</label>
                    </labels>
                <created>Wed, 7 Sep 2016 07:07:21 +0000</created>
                <updated>Wed, 8 Feb 2017 19:27:22 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Sun, 16 Oct 2016 15:14:36 +0000</resolved>
                                    <version>2.1</version>
                                    <fixVersion>2.1.1</fixVersion>
                                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>3</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="15470278" author="b.eckenfels" created="Wed, 7 Sep 2016 10:50:18 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;The bundle plugin can do that automatically. With one of the later commons-parent I have implemented an additional property which can overwrite a exclude statement (I dont know why it is needed, but if you overwrite it the import statements have the proper resolution added automatically. (We could even remove the manual resolution overwrites).&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;blockquote&gt;
&lt;p&gt;&amp;lt;!-- make sure bundle plugin has dependency informations for &apos;optional&apos; --&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
&amp;lt;commons.osgi.excludeDependencies /&amp;gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/blockquote&gt;

&lt;p&gt;When doing this the optional shows up for spring then:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;blockquote&gt;
&lt;p&gt;org.springframework.beans.factory;resolution:=optional,&lt;br/&gt;
org.springframework.core.env;resolution:=optional,&lt;br/&gt;
org.springframework.core.io;resolution:=optional,&lt;br/&gt;
org.springframework.util;resolution:=optional&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/blockquote&gt;

&lt;p&gt;However for some packages it also adds version ranges:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;org.apache.commons.beanutils;resolution:=optional;version=&quot;[1.9,2)&quot;,&lt;br/&gt;
org.apache.commons.codec.binary;resolution:=optional;version=&quot;[1.10,2)&quot;&lt;br/&gt;
,,,&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Not sure if we want to keep this or turn versions off if not?&lt;/p&gt;
</comment>
                            <comment id="15470301" author="b.eckenfels" created="Wed, 7 Sep 2016 11:02:54 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;New and old version of the Manifest after the proposed change.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15471650" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Wed, 7 Sep 2016 20:05:59 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;In an older version of the bundle plugin the optional declarations from the pom were not taken into account, and all dependencies were listed as mandatory in the import-package directive. This was the reason for the explicit import declaration in the pom. If the plugin now handles optional dependencies correctly, we could drop this block.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The versions, however, could be a problem. The dependencies (at least to other commons components) are typically set to the most recent versions, even if an older version would still work. Forcing users to always deploy the most recent version of a dependency could be too restrictive.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15474234" author="b.eckenfels" created="Thu, 8 Sep 2016 15:55:58 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Well, it was my first feeling too, but on the other hand from experience I can say this is not an issue. The dependencies in such projects are mostly not up-to-date, so if somebody uses it they have a wide range of versions which are accepted (anything more current up to the next major). If a project is quick to update the dependencies then it is also seldomly a problem since the new version of that gets only dragged in by projects updating anyway. So while it might restrict some situations it typially is not an issue. Especially given that fact that only because there is no version restriction does not mean the unrestricted artifact in a odd version actually works.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;However this might be a bigger change than a bugfix. So I guess the plugin should be configured to not provide version ranges (but optionals) for the next minor release.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15474847" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Thu, 8 Sep 2016 20:01:35 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Agreed. Can you provide a patch for the plugin configuration? Or commit it immediately?&lt;br/&gt;
Thanks!&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15556099" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Fri, 7 Oct 2016 20:02:18 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/ViewProfile.jspa?name=b.eckenfels&quot; class=&quot;user-hover&quot; rel=&quot;b.eckenfels&quot;&gt;Bernd Eckenfels&lt;/a&gt; Do you already have a working solution you can share?&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15575625" author="riconeubauer" created="Fri, 14 Oct 2016 15:14:51 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Pull-request:&lt;br/&gt;
&lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/apache/commons-configuration/pull/4&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://github.com/apache/commons-configuration/pull/4&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15580116" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Sun, 16 Oct 2016 15:14:36 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Patch applied in revision 1765165. This seems to be the easies and less invasive solution. Thanks again for the patch.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                    </comments>

<item>
            <title>[CONFIGURATION-638] After a few unit tests, a few newly created directories not cleaned completely.</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CONFIGURATION-638</link>
                <project id="12310467" key="CONFIGURATION">Commons Configuration</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;After a few unit tests, created folders and files are not deleted. It&apos;s a bad practice in software engineering, because disk shouldn&apos;t be polluted.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;After execution of the test class &apos;org.apache.commons.configuration2.TestDynamicCombinedConfiguration&apos; ,  &apos;target/test-classes/testwrite&apos; folder isn&apos;t deleted recursively.&lt;br/&gt;
After execution of the test class &apos;org.apache.commons.configuration2.TestPropertiesConfiguration&apos;,  &apos;target/sharp#1.properties&apos; and &apos;target/testsave-custom-url.properties&apos; files aren&apos;t deleted.&lt;br/&gt;
After execution of the class &apos;org.apache.commons.configuration2.TestXMLConfiguration&apos;,  &apos;target/testsample2.xml&apos; file isn&apos;t deleted.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="12997470">CONFIGURATION-638</key>
            <summary>After a few unit tests, a few newly created directories not cleaned completely.</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="4" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/minor.svg">Minor</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="ahmetcelik">Ahmet Celik</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Tue, 16 Aug 2016 04:46:11 +0000</created>
                <updated>Wed, 8 Feb 2017 19:27:22 +0000</updated>

                                                    <fixVersion>2.1.1</fixVersion>

                                        <comments>
                            <comment id="15422162" author="ahmetcelik" created="Tue, 16 Aug 2016 04:48:27 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Here I attached patch file which adds after method for JUnit test classes to clean those folders and files.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15429404" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Sat, 20 Aug 2016 14:49:44 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Thanks for the report and the patch. I fully agree that unit tests should do a proper cleanup.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I see that in your patch you delete files manually. This is fine. However, in some newer tests we use the JUnit @Rule annotation together with &lt;tt&gt;TemporaryFolder&lt;/tt&gt; to create temporary files and let JUnit take care that they are removed automatically at test end. This simplifies the affected test classes. Do you think it is possible to update your patch to make use of this functionality, too?&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15430092" author="ahmetcelik" created="Mon, 22 Aug 2016 05:52:02 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;I changed tests to use  &lt;tt&gt;TemporaryFolder&lt;/tt&gt; with &lt;tt&gt;@Rule&lt;/tt&gt; annotation like in some newer tests.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15433496" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Tue, 23 Aug 2016 19:53:20 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Many thanks for the update. I will have a look in a few days.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15439369" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Fri, 26 Aug 2016 16:42:47 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Patch applied in revision 1757891. Thanks again!&lt;/p&gt;</comment>

<item>
            <title>[CONFIGURATION-637] Oracle invalid idenitifer when using a resevered keyword for column name</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CONFIGURATION-637</link>
                <project id="12310467" key="CONFIGURATION">Commons Configuration</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;I have the following create table for oracle to store configs. Notice that the &quot;scope&quot; column name is properly escaped:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;preformatted panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;preformattedContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre&gt;create table PROPERTY_CONTROL (
  &quot;scope&quot; VARCHAR2(32),
  &quot;key&quot; VARCHAR2(128),
  &quot;value&quot; VARCHAR2(512),
  CONSTRAINT property_control_pk PRIMARY KEY (&quot;scope&quot;, &quot;key&quot;)
);
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;However, this causes the following stack trace (slightly modified for sensitive class names):&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;preformatted panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;preformattedContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre&gt;java.sql.SQLSyntaxErrorException: ORA-00904: &quot;SCOPE&quot;: invalid identifier

	at oracle.jdbc.driver.T4CTTIoer.processError(T4CTTIoer.java:457)
	at oracle.jdbc.driver.T4CTTIoer.processError(T4CTTIoer.java:400)
	at oracle.jdbc.driver.T4C8Oall.processError(T4C8Oall.java:926)
	at oracle.jdbc.driver.T4CTTIfun.receive(T4CTTIfun.java:476)
	at oracle.jdbc.driver.T4CTTIfun.doRPC(T4CTTIfun.java:200)
	at oracle.jdbc.driver.T4C8Oall.doOALL(T4C8Oall.java:543)
	at oracle.jdbc.driver.T4CPreparedStatement.doOall8(T4CPreparedStatement.java:238)
	at oracle.jdbc.driver.T4CPreparedStatement.executeForDescribe(T4CPreparedStatement.java:1244)
	at oracle.jdbc.driver.OracleStatement.executeMaybeDescribe(OracleStatement.java:1492)
	at oracle.jdbc.driver.OracleStatement.doExecuteWithTimeout(OracleStatement.java:1710)
	at oracle.jdbc.driver.OraclePreparedStatement.executeInternal(OraclePreparedStatement.java:4372)
	at oracle.jdbc.driver.OraclePreparedStatement.executeQuery(OraclePreparedStatement.java:4453)
	at oracle.jdbc.driver.OraclePreparedStatementWrapper.executeQuery(OraclePreparedStatementWrapper.java:6270)
	at com.zaxxer.hikari.proxy.PreparedStatementProxy.executeQuery(PreparedStatementProxy.java:52)
	at com.zaxxer.hikari.proxy.HikariPreparedStatementProxy.executeQuery(HikariPreparedStatementProxy.java)
	at org.apache.commons.configuration2.DatabaseConfiguration$JdbcOperation.openResultSet(DatabaseConfiguration.java:847)
	at org.apache.commons.configuration2.DatabaseConfiguration$4.performOperation(DatabaseConfiguration.java:487)
	at org.apache.commons.configuration2.DatabaseConfiguration$4.performOperation(DatabaseConfiguration.java:483)
	at org.apache.commons.configuration2.DatabaseConfiguration$JdbcOperation.execute(DatabaseConfiguration.java:742)
	at org.apache.commons.configuration2.DatabaseConfiguration.containsKeyInternal(DatabaseConfiguration.java:494)
	at org.apache.commons.configuration2.AbstractConfiguration.containsKey(AbstractConfiguration.java:1086)
	at org.apache.commons.configuration2.CompositeConfiguration.containsKeyInternal(CompositeConfiguration.java:374)
	at org.apache.commons.configuration2.AbstractConfiguration.containsKey(AbstractConfiguration.java:1086)
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</description>
                <environment>&lt;p&gt;Oracle, Java 1.8&lt;/p&gt;</environment>
        <key id="12993277">CONFIGURATION-637</key>
            <summary>Oracle invalid idenitifer when using a resevered keyword for column name</summary>

<item>
            <title>[CONFIGURATION-634] BasePath is incorrectly computed while init of CompositeConfiguration</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CONFIGURATION-634</link>
                <project id="12310467" key="CONFIGURATION">Commons Configuration</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;The base path should be just &quot;app&quot; instead of &lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;preformatted panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;preformattedContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre&gt;file:///C:/path/to/app&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt; because of which the code is trying to locate config.properties in the following path: &lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;preformatted panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;preformattedContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre&gt;C:\path\to\file:\C:\path\to\app\config.properties&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;


&lt;p&gt;In the below snippet basepath is good when handler.locate() runs but fails when running handler.load()&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeHeader panelHeader&quot; style=&quot;border-bottom-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;b&gt;org.apache.commons.configuration2.builder.FileLocatorUtils&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;protected&lt;/span&gt; void initFileHandler(FileHandler handler)
            &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;throws&lt;/span&gt; ConfigurationException
    {
        initEncoding(handler);
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;if&lt;/span&gt; (handler.isLocationDefined())
        {
            handler.locate();
            handler.load();
        }
    }
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;If you would like to see the basepath being manipulated keep a debug point at file.isFile() in the below snippet&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeHeader panelHeader&quot; style=&quot;border-bottom-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;b&gt;org.apache.commons.configuration2.io.HomeDirectoryLocationStrategy&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; URL locate(FileSystem fileSystem, FileLocator locator)
    {
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;if&lt;/span&gt; (StringUtils.isNotEmpty(locator.getFileName()))
        {
            &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt; basePath = fetchBasePath(locator);
            File file =
                    FileLocatorUtils.constructFile(basePath,
                            locator.getFileName());
            &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;if&lt;/span&gt; (file.isFile())
            {
                &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;return&lt;/span&gt; FileLocatorUtils.convertFileToURL(file);
            }
        }

        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;return&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;null&lt;/span&gt;;
    }
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Snippet failing:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;CompositeConfiguration config = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; CompositeConfiguration();
config.addConfiguration(&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; SystemConfiguration());

&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; FileBasedConfigurationBuilder&amp;lt;FileBasedConfiguration&amp;gt; homeDirConfigurationBuilder
        = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; FileBasedConfigurationBuilder&amp;lt;&amp;gt;(PropertiesConfiguration.class);
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; PropertiesBuilderParameters homeDirProperties = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; Parameters().properties();
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; FileBasedConfigurationBuilder&amp;lt;FileBasedConfiguration&amp;gt; configurationBuilder
        = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; FileBasedConfigurationBuilder&amp;lt;&amp;gt;(PropertiesConfiguration.class);
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; PropertiesBuilderParameters properties = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; Parameters().properties();

FileBasedConfigurationBuilder&amp;lt;FileBasedConfiguration&amp;gt; builder1 = homeDirConfigurationBuilder.configure(
        homeDirProperties.setLocationStrategy(&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; HomeDirectoryLocationStrategy(&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;true&lt;/span&gt;))
                .setBasePath(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;app&quot;&lt;/span&gt;)
                .setListDelimiterHandler(&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; DefaultListDelimiterHandler(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&apos;,&apos;&lt;/span&gt;))
                .setFileName(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;config.properties&quot;&lt;/span&gt;));
FileBasedConfigurationBuilder&amp;lt;FileBasedConfiguration&amp;gt; builder2 = configurationBuilder.configure(
        properties.setLocationStrategy(&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; ClasspathLocationStrategy())
                .setListDelimiterHandler(&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; DefaultListDelimiterHandler(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&apos;,&apos;&lt;/span&gt;))
                .setFileName(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;default_config.properties&quot;&lt;/span&gt;));
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;try&lt;/span&gt; {
    &lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// TODO Fails due to a bug in commons configuration FileLocatorUtils#createFullyInitializedLocatorFromURL
&lt;/span&gt;    config.addConfiguration(builder1.getConfiguration());
    config.addConfiguration(builder2.getConfiguration());
} &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;catch&lt;/span&gt; (ConfigurationException e) {
    log.warn(configMarker, &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;Failed to load the properties file, loading defaults&quot;&lt;/span&gt;, e);
}
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Stacktrace:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;preformatted panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;preformattedContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre&gt;org.apache.commons.configuration2.ex.ConfigurationException: Could not locate: org.apache.commons.configuration2.io.FileLocator@353d0772[fileName=config.properties,basePath=file:///C:/path/to/app/,sourceURL=file:/C:/path/to/app/config.properties,encoding=ISO-8859-1,fileSystem=&amp;lt;null&amp;gt;,locationStrategy=org.apache.commons.configuration2.io.HomeDirectoryLocationStrategy@10e41621]
	at org.apache.commons.configuration2.io.FileLocatorUtils.locateOrThrow(FileLocatorUtils.java:346) ~[commons-configuration2-2.0.jar:2.0]
	at org.apache.commons.configuration2.io.FileHandler.load(FileHandler.java:972) ~[commons-configuration2-2.0.jar:2.0]
	at org.apache.commons.configuration2.io.FileHandler.load(FileHandler.java:702) ~[commons-configuration2-2.0.jar:2.0]
	at org.apache.commons.configuration2.builder.FileBasedConfigurationBuilder.initFileHandler(FileBasedConfigurationBuilder.java:312) ~[commons-configuration2-2.0.jar:2.0]
	at org.apache.commons.configuration2.builder.FileBasedConfigurationBuilder.initResultInstance(FileBasedConfigurationBuilder.java:291) ~[commons-configuration2-2.0.jar:2.0]
	at org.apache.commons.configuration2.builder.FileBasedConfigurationBuilder.initResultInstance(FileBasedConfigurationBuilder.java:60) ~[commons-configuration2-2.0.jar:2.0]
	at org.apache.commons.configuration2.builder.BasicConfigurationBuilder.createResult(BasicConfigurationBuilder.java:421) ~[commons-configuration2-2.0.jar:2.0]
	at org.apache.commons.configuration2.builder.BasicConfigurationBuilder.getConfiguration(BasicConfigurationBuilder.java:285) ~[commons-configuration2-2.0.jar:2.0]
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</description>
                <environment>&lt;p&gt;Windows Server 2008 R2&lt;br/&gt;
Oracle JDK 1.8.0_92&lt;/p&gt;</environment>

            <summary>BasePath is incorrectly computed while init of CompositeConfiguration</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>

                            <comment id="15342575" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Tue, 21 Jun 2016 20:12:10 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Thanks for this report.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;So are you saying that the bug is in &lt;tt&gt;HomeDirectoryLocationStrategy&lt;/tt&gt;? Any chance you can provide a unit test (maybe a stripped-down variant of the code fragment above)?&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15342616" author="bond_" created="Tue, 21 Jun 2016 20:37:24 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;~oliver.heger@t-online.de&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;, I&apos;ve attached a sample project reproducing the same &lt;span class=&quot;nobr&quot;&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12812292/12812292_CONF634.zip&quot; title=&quot;CONF634.zip attached to CONFIGURATION-634&quot;&gt;CONF634.zip&lt;sup&gt;&lt;img class=&quot;rendericon&quot; src=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/link_attachment_7.gif&quot; height=&quot;7&quot; width=&quot;7&quot; align=&quot;absmiddle&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; border=&quot;0&quot;/&gt;&lt;/sup&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;ol&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;Prerequisite to run the code: Install gradle&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;Create a file called config.properties in your user home.
	&lt;ul&gt;
		&lt;li&gt;In windows it would be: 
&lt;div class=&quot;preformatted panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;preformattedContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre&gt;%HOMEPATH%\app\config.properties&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/li&gt;
		&lt;li&gt;In linux it would be: 
&lt;div class=&quot;preformatted panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;preformattedContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre&gt;$HOME/app/config.properties&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;/ul&gt;
	&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;Go into CONF634 folder and run 
&lt;div class=&quot;preformatted panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;preformattedContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre&gt;gradle run&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;/ol&gt;

                            <comment id="15345099" author="bond_" created="Wed, 22 Jun 2016 20:26:00 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;~garydgregory&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;, &lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;~oliver.heger@t-online.de&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt; Submitted a pull request for review: &lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/apache/commons-configuration/pull/3&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://github.com/apache/commons-configuration/pull/3&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

                            <comment id="15346387" author="bond_" created="Thu, 23 Jun 2016 13:00:03 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;~garydgregory&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;, &lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;~oliver.heger@t-online.de&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;, Good morning. Sorry if I&apos;m pushing too much, has anyone had a chance to review this code &lt;img class=&quot;emoticon&quot; src=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/emoticons/smile.png&quot; height=&quot;16&quot; width=&quot;16&quot; align=&quot;absmiddle&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; border=&quot;0&quot;/&gt;? I need this fix for my production to work smoothly.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15346760" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Thu, 23 Jun 2016 17:02:14 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Thank you very much for the patch. I agree that the problem is caused by the fact that the base path is changed when the FileLocator gets resolved. Your patch solve this.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I am just a bit worried whether this change impacts other clients because the behavior of the getBasePath() method is now slightly changed. Maybe it would be safer to add another property to FileLocator that stores the &lt;em&gt;unresolvedBasePath&lt;/em&gt;, i.e. the path that was explicitly set by the user before the &lt;em&gt;locate()&lt;/em&gt; method has been called. The locator strategy could then query this property to get the original base path while other client code calling &lt;em&gt;getBasePath()&lt;/em&gt; still sees the resolved path.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;OTOH, I don&apos;t think that many clients will be affected by the change. The exact behavior of &lt;em&gt;getBasePath()&lt;/em&gt; was not documented to that detail.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;WDYT?&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15346799" author="bond_" created="Thu, 23 Jun 2016 17:23:11 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;I don&apos;t think those changes are necessary, I feel it would be overkill to check for unresolvedBasePath. &lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I based my patch based on the javadocs found in FileLocator#fullyInitializedLocator. Ideally it should set only the ones which were not initialized.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;In general sense basepath should be set once and used any number of times. It should not be manipulated mid-way. I&apos;m also good if you wish to call in for a vote to decide what&apos;s the best fix.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Note: I ran the testcases which were triggered with &lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;preformatted panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;preformattedContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre&gt;mvn clean test&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;. If this project has good test coverage I feel this patch is good to go.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15348461" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Fri, 24 Jun 2016 15:52:34 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Okay, patch applied with slight changes in revision r1750127.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Thanks again. If you want to be listed in the &lt;em&gt;contributors&lt;/em&gt; section of the pom, just provide the data you want to have added (name, email, organization).&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15349032" author="bond_" created="Sat, 25 Jun 2016 02:56:37 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;~oliver.heger@t-online.de&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;, Yes please.&lt;/p&gt;

<item>
            <title>[CONFIGURATION-633] Interpolation with multi-valued properties does not work</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CONFIGURATION-633</link>
                <project id="12310467" key="CONFIGURATION">Commons Configuration</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;In the current implementation (making use of commons lang&apos;s &lt;tt&gt;StrSubstitutor&lt;/tt&gt;, interpolation is alway string-based. This works well for primitive property values, but not if a property has multiple values. A variable referencing such a property is replaced by the string-representation of the list of values.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="12973115">CONFIGURATION-633</key>
            <summary>Interpolation with multi-valued properties does not work</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="oheger">Oliver Heger</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Thu, 26 May 2016 16:14:20 +0000</created>
                <updated>Sun, 21 Aug 2016 19:39:31 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Thu, 26 May 2016 19:14:03 +0000</resolved>
                                    <version>2.0</version>
                                    <fixVersion>2.1</fixVersion>
                                    <component>Interpolation</component>
                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>3</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="15302327" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Thu, 26 May 2016 16:17:39 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;If a property value consists of multiple variables or a variable embedded into other content, there is probably no way around a string-based substitution. But if only a single variable is referenced, the interpolation should result in the real value of this variable and not force a string conversion.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15302719" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Thu, 26 May 2016 19:14:03 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Fixed in revision 1745634.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15353260" author="philippe.perrault@gmail.com" created="Tue, 28 Jun 2016 15:48:52 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Hi Oliver,&lt;br/&gt;
Will you fix this issue in 1.x branch?&lt;br/&gt;
thanks&lt;/p&gt;</comment>

<item>
            <title>[CONFIGURATION-632] Composite configuration list variable interpolation return first element only</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CONFIGURATION-632</link>
                <project id="12310467" key="CONFIGURATION">Commons Configuration</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;CompositeConfiguration.getStringArray, with variable interpolation returns only the first element of the list&lt;br/&gt;
e.g.&lt;br/&gt;
key1=a,b,c&lt;br/&gt;
key2=${key1}&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;CompositeConfiguration.getStringArray(key2) = a&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment>&lt;p&gt;linux&lt;/p&gt;</environment>
        <key id="12971922">CONFIGURATION-632</key>
            <summary>Composite configuration list variable interpolation return first element only</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>

                            <comment id="15298799" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Tue, 24 May 2016 20:02:20 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Thank you for the report. In order to easier reproduce the problem, could you please post a short code fragment how the composite configuration is created and initialized? Thanks.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15299315" author="philippe.perrault@gmail.com" created="Wed, 25 May 2016 01:52:48 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Hi Oliver,&lt;br/&gt;
Here is an exampe code:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;CompositeConfiguration compositeConfiguration = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; CompositeConfiguration();
compositeConfiguration.addConfiguration(&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; PropertiesConfiguration(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;props.properties&quot;&lt;/span&gt;));

&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt;[] values = compositeConfiguration.getStringArray(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;key1&quot;&lt;/span&gt;);
&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;System&lt;/span&gt;.out.println(values); &lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;a, b, c,&quot;&lt;/span&gt;
&lt;/span&gt;values = compositeConfiguration.getStringArray(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;key2&quot;&lt;/span&gt;);
&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;System&lt;/span&gt;.out.println(values); &lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;a&quot;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;with&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeHeader panelHeader&quot; style=&quot;border-bottom-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;b&gt;props.properties&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;key1 = a,b,c
key2 = ${key1}
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I am expecting the get an array &quot;a, b, c&quot; for key2 but I get only &quot;a&quot;&lt;br/&gt;
thanks!&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15302572" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Thu, 26 May 2016 17:52:15 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;When testing I found a general problem with interpolation of properties with multiple values. I created &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CONFIGURATION-633&quot; title=&quot;Interpolation with multi-valued properties does not work&quot; class=&quot;issue-link&quot; data-issue-key=&quot;CONFIGURATION-633&quot;&gt;&lt;del&gt;CONFIGURATION-633&lt;/del&gt;&lt;/a&gt; for this problem. This has to be fixed first.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15304541" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Fri, 27 May 2016 18:46:00 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;A fix has been applied to SVN. Together with the fix for &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CONFIGURATION-633&quot; title=&quot;Interpolation with multi-valued properties does not work&quot; class=&quot;issue-link&quot; data-issue-key=&quot;CONFIGURATION-633&quot;&gt;&lt;del&gt;CONFIGURATION-633&lt;/del&gt;&lt;/a&gt; interpolation should now work for variables referencing properties with multiple values.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;However, the current implementation is still limited and does not handle all possible constellations. For instance, if elements in the referenced list or array contain variables themselves, those will not be replaced. Let&apos;s wait until anybody actually needs this functionality.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>

<item>
            <title>[CONFIGURATION-630] multiple line issue</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CONFIGURATION-630</link>
                <project id="12310467" key="CONFIGURATION">Commons Configuration</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;source:&lt;br/&gt;
SOLR_HEAP=&quot;512m&quot;&lt;br/&gt;
GC_TUNE=&quot;-XX:NewRatio=3 \&lt;br/&gt;
-XX:SurvivorRatio=4&quot;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;code:&lt;br/&gt;
		FileBasedConfigurationBuilder&amp;lt;PropertiesConfiguration&amp;gt; builder =&lt;br/&gt;
			    new FileBasedConfigurationBuilder&amp;lt;PropertiesConfiguration&amp;gt;(PropertiesConfiguration.class)&lt;br/&gt;
			    .configure(new Parameters().properties().setFileName(fileName)&lt;br/&gt;
			    		.setThrowExceptionOnMissing(true));&lt;br/&gt;
			PropertiesConfiguration config = builder.getConfiguration();&lt;br/&gt;
			config.setProperty(&quot;SOLR_HEAP&quot;, &quot;\&quot;525m\&quot;&quot;);&lt;br/&gt;
			builder.save();&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;result:&lt;br/&gt;
SOLR_HEAP=&quot;525m&quot;&lt;br/&gt;
GC_TUNE=&quot;-XX:NewRatio=3 -XX:SurvivorRatio=4&quot;&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="12970330">CONFIGURATION-630</key>
            <summary>multiple line issue</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="4" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/minor.svg">Minor</priority>
                        <status id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/open.png" description="The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.">Open</status>
                    <statusCategory id="2" key="new" colorName="blue-gray"/>
                                    <resolution id="-1">Unresolved</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="julius.yang">Julius</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Tue, 17 May 2016 10:24:29 +0000</created>
                <updated>Thu, 19 May 2016 19:40:38 +0000</updated>
                                            <version>2.0</version>
                                                        <due></due>
                            <votes>1</votes>
                                    <watches>2</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="15289635" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Wed, 18 May 2016 19:22:59 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Thanks for this report. Could you please elaborate a bit: Is this only a formatting issue (the line break is lost on saving) or are there other problems (e.g. the value of the property is not correctly read)?&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15290202" author="julius.yang" created="Thu, 19 May 2016 00:53:11 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Yes,this is only a formatting issue, the line break is lost on saving.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15292011" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Thu, 19 May 2016 19:40:38 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Thanks for clarifying.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Unfortunately, I have no idea how this behavior can be fixed easily. There is the &lt;tt&gt;PropertiesConfigurationLayout&lt;/tt&gt; class which stores some information related to the formatting of the properties file. But line continuations are not stored here. They are already processed by the reader that reads the file. In the configuration only the processed value is stored (this is the value which has to be returned to requesting clients); so the original representation is lost.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;If anybody comes up with a clever solution idea, this would be highly appreciated.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                    </comments>

                    </attachments>

            <title>[CONFIGURATION-629] Fix PropertyDescriptor warning for AbstractConfiguration.setProperty</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CONFIGURATION-629</link>
                <project id="12310467" key="CONFIGURATION">Commons Configuration</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;Although it&apos;s just a warning message it should be fixed to avoid spam in logfiles:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;preformatted panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;preformattedContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre&gt;WARNUNG: Error when creating PropertyDescriptor for public final void org.apache.commons.configuration2.AbstractConfiguration.setProperty(java.lang.String,java.lang.Object)! Ignoring this property.

	at org.apache.commons.beanutils.FluentPropertyBeanIntrospector.introspect(FluentPropertyBeanIntrospector.java:140)
	at org.apache.commons.beanutils.PropertyUtilsBean.fetchIntrospectionData(PropertyUtilsBean.java:2234)

	at org.apache.commons.configuration2.beanutils.BeanHelper.isPropertyWriteable(BeanHelper.java:521)

        <key id="12969846">CONFIGURATION-629</key>
            <summary>Fix PropertyDescriptor warning for AbstractConfiguration.setProperty</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="4" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/minor.svg">Minor</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="3">Duplicate</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="deki">Dennis Kieselhorst</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Sun, 15 May 2016 17:39:07 +0000</created>
                <updated>Sun, 21 Aug 2016 19:39:30 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Mon, 27 Jun 2016 07:48:22 +0000</resolved>
                                    <version>2.0</version>
                                    <fixVersion>2.1</fixVersion>
                                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>2</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="15349035" author="bond_" created="Sat, 25 Jun 2016 03:00:05 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;This is not a issue with commons-configuration AFAIK. Refer to: &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEANUTILS-477&quot; title=&quot;Warnings from FluentPropertyBeanIntrospector when creating a CombinedConfiguration from a CombinedConfigurationBuilder&quot; class=&quot;issue-link&quot; data-issue-key=&quot;BEANUTILS-477&quot;&gt;&lt;del&gt;BEANUTILS-477&lt;/del&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</comment>

<item>
            <title>[CONFIGURATION-627] BeanHelper exception on XMLConfiguration builder.getConfiguration()</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CONFIGURATION-627</link>
                <project id="12310467" key="CONFIGURATION">Commons Configuration</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;Creating an &lt;b&gt;XMLConfiguration&lt;/b&gt; from a file with a builder:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;builder =
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; FileBasedConfigurationBuilder&amp;lt;XMLConfiguration&amp;gt;(
                XMLConfiguration.class)
                        .configure(params.xml()
                                .setFileName(
                                        propsFile.getCanonicalPath())
                                .setValidating(&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;false&lt;/span&gt;));

config = builder.getConfiguration();
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Causes a non-halting exception originating in &lt;b&gt;org.apache.commons.configuration2.beanutils.BeanHelper&lt;/b&gt;, method &lt;br/&gt;
&lt;b&gt;private static boolean isPropertyWriteable(Object bean, String propName)&lt;/b&gt; with parameters &lt;b&gt;XMLConfiguration&lt;/b&gt;, &lt;b&gt;&quot;validating&quot;&lt;/b&gt;.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The exception:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;preformatted panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;preformattedContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre&gt;    May 04, 2016 3:29:26 PM org.apache.commons.beanutils.FluentPropertyBeanIntrospector introspect
    WARNING: Error when creating PropertyDescriptor for public final void org.apache.commons.configuration2.AbstractConfiguration.setProperty(java.lang.String,java.lang.Object)! Ignoring this property.
    java.beans.IntrospectionException: bad write method arg count: public final void org.apache.commons.configuration2.AbstractConfiguration.setProperty(java.lang.String,java.lang.Object)
        at java.beans.PropertyDescriptor.findPropertyType(PropertyDescriptor.java:657)
        at java.beans.PropertyDescriptor.setWriteMethod(PropertyDescriptor.java:327)
        at java.beans.PropertyDescriptor.&amp;lt;init&amp;gt;(PropertyDescriptor.java:139)
        at org.apache.commons.beanutils.FluentPropertyBeanIntrospector.createFluentPropertyDescritor(FluentPropertyBeanIntrospector.java:177)
        at org.apache.commons.beanutils.FluentPropertyBeanIntrospector.introspect(FluentPropertyBeanIntrospector.java:140)
        at org.apache.commons.beanutils.PropertyUtilsBean.fetchIntrospectionData(PropertyUtilsBean.java:2234)
        at org.apache.commons.beanutils.PropertyUtilsBean.getIntrospectionData(PropertyUtilsBean.java:2215)
        at org.apache.commons.beanutils.PropertyUtilsBean.getPropertyDescriptor(PropertyUtilsBean.java:950)
        at org.apache.commons.beanutils.PropertyUtilsBean.isWriteable(PropertyUtilsBean.java:1466)
        at org.apache.commons.configuration2.beanutils.BeanHelper.isPropertyWriteable(BeanHelper.java:521)
        at org.apache.commons.configuration2.beanutils.BeanHelper.initProperty(BeanHelper.java:357)
        at org.apache.commons.configuration2.beanutils.BeanHelper.initBeanProperties(BeanHelper.java:273)
        at org.apache.commons.configuration2.beanutils.BeanHelper.initBean(BeanHelper.java:192)
        at org.apache.commons.configuration2.beanutils.BeanHelper$BeanCreationContextImpl.initBean(BeanHelper.java:669)
        at org.apache.commons.configuration2.beanutils.DefaultBeanFactory.initBeanInstance(DefaultBeanFactory.java:162)
        at org.apache.commons.configuration2.beanutils.DefaultBeanFactory.createBean(DefaultBeanFactory.java:116)
        at org.apache.commons.configuration2.beanutils.BeanHelper.createBean(BeanHelper.java:459)
        at org.apache.commons.configuration2.beanutils.BeanHelper.createBean(BeanHelper.java:479)
        at org.apache.commons.configuration2.beanutils.BeanHelper.createBean(BeanHelper.java:492)
        at org.apache.commons.configuration2.builder.BasicConfigurationBuilder.createResultInstance(BasicConfigurationBuilder.java:447)
        at org.apache.commons.configuration2.builder.BasicConfigurationBuilder.createResult(BasicConfigurationBuilder.java:417)
    at org.apache.commons.configuration2.builder.BasicConfigurationBuilder.getConfiguration(BasicConfigurationBuilder.java:285)
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</description>
                <environment>&lt;p&gt;JDK 1.8, Maven 3.3.9&lt;/p&gt;</environment>
        <key id="12965119">CONFIGURATION-627</key>
            <summary>BeanHelper exception on XMLConfiguration builder.getConfiguration()</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="4" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/minor.svg">Minor</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="technosf">Martin</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Wed, 4 May 2016 22:54:12 +0000</created>
                <updated>Wed, 8 Feb 2017 19:27:22 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Thu, 6 Oct 2016 19:54:41 +0000</resolved>

                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="15272563" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Thu, 5 May 2016 16:15:04 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;This is actually a problem of Commons Beanutils. Please see the discussion in the linked issue.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15401437" author="matteg" created="Mon, 1 Aug 2016 01:59:20 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;I used to be a government worker before I retired.  We were often accused of &quot;passing the buck&quot; to someone else and then calling the job done.  I always resented that accusation and so I have to protest this JIRA being flagged as &quot;Resolved&quot;.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;This JIRA accurately describes a problem that prevents XMLConfiguration builder.getConfiguration() from executing.  Deciding that the problem is caused by an error in Bean Utils (JIRA &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEANUTILS-477&quot; title=&quot;Warnings from FluentPropertyBeanIntrospector when creating a CombinedConfiguration from a CombinedConfigurationBuilder&quot; class=&quot;issue-link&quot; data-issue-key=&quot;BEANUTILS-477&quot;&gt;&lt;del&gt;BEANUTILS-477&lt;/del&gt;&lt;/a&gt; which in turn passes the buck to &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEANUTILS-492&quot; title=&quot;IndexedPropertyDescriptor not supported for List in Java 8&quot; class=&quot;issue-link&quot; data-issue-key=&quot;BEANUTILS-492&quot;&gt;&lt;del&gt;BEANUTILS-492&lt;/del&gt;&lt;/a&gt;) does not resolve the original issue.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;If you had even identified a work around for the problem there might be justification for flagging it as resolved.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;IMHOP you should return this JIRA to status &quot;Open&quot; until a fix or a work-around is identified and the issue successfully passes testing.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15402678" author="garydgregory" created="Mon, 1 Aug 2016 19:31:09 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Re-opening: Once the issue is fixed in BeanUtils, we should update our dependency on BeanUtils and test. &lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&lt;b&gt;A unit test for this issue here would be good as well.&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15402688" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Mon, 1 Aug 2016 19:41:16 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Huh? How can an exception message written to the log file prevent the getConfiguration() method from being executed?&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;There is actually a work-around: Adapt the logging configuration.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15402764" author="matteg" created="Mon, 1 Aug 2016 20:31:11 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Thanks to both of you for prompt action: &lt;br/&gt;
Gary for re-opening this JIRA and recomending a test case and &lt;br/&gt;
also thanks to Oliver for identifying the workaround - which caused me to realise this was a non halting exception and my code was actually working &lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;I retested&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15526161" author="bond_" created="Tue, 27 Sep 2016 13:43:37 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;So the linked bugs seem resolved. Can you guys let me know if the following stacktrace is related:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;preformatted panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;preformattedContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre&gt; WARN o.a.c.b.FluentPropertyBeanIntrospector - Error when creating PropertyDescriptor for public final void org.apache.commons.configuration2.AbstractConfiguration.setProperty(java.lang.String,java.lang.Object)! Ignoring this property.

        at org.apache.commons.beanutils.PropertyUtilsBean.isWriteable(PropertyUtilsBean.java:1466) ~[commons-beanutils-1.9.2.jar:1.9.2]
        at org.apache.commons.configuration2.beanutils.BeanHelper.isPropertyWriteable(BeanHelper.java:521) ~[commons-configuration2-2.1.jar:2.1]
        at org.apache.commons.configuration2.beanutils.BeanHelper.initProperty(BeanHelper.java:357) ~[commons-configuration2-2.1.jar:2.1]
        at org.apache.commons.configuration2.beanutils.BeanHelper.initBeanProperties(BeanHelper.java:273) ~[commons-configuration2-2.1.jar:2.1]

        at org.apache.commons.configuration2.beanutils.BeanHelper$BeanCreationContextImpl.initBean(BeanHelper.java:669) ~[commons-configuration2-2.1.jar:2.1]

        at org.apache.commons.configuration2.beanutils.DefaultBeanFactory.createBean(DefaultBeanFactory.java:116) ~[commons-configuration2-2.1.jar:2.1]
        at org.apache.commons.configuration2.beanutils.BeanHelper.createBean(BeanHelper.java:459) ~[commons-configuration2-2.1.jar:2.1]
        at org.apache.commons.configuration2.beanutils.BeanHelper.createBean(BeanHelper.java:479) ~[commons-configuration2-2.1.jar:2.1]
        at org.apache.commons.configuration2.beanutils.BeanHelper.createBean(BeanHelper.java:492) ~[commons-configuration2-2.1.jar:2.1]

&lt;/pre&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Sample code &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12812292/CONF634.zip&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;CONF634.zip&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15527039" author="bond_" created="Tue, 27 Sep 2016 18:33:22 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;New error message after using commons-beanutils:commons-beanutils:1.9.3 in my source code:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;preformatted panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;preformattedContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre&gt;INFO o.a.c.b.FluentPropertyBeanIntrospector - Error when creating PropertyDescriptor for public final void org.apache.commons.configuration2.AbstractConfiguration.setProperty(java.lang.String,java.lang.Object)! Ignoring this property.
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15527181" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Tue, 27 Sep 2016 19:28:17 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;This is what the fix for &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEANUTILS-477&quot; title=&quot;Warnings from FluentPropertyBeanIntrospector when creating a CombinedConfiguration from a CombinedConfigurationBuilder&quot; class=&quot;issue-link&quot; data-issue-key=&quot;BEANUTILS-477&quot;&gt;&lt;del&gt;BEANUTILS-477&lt;/del&gt;&lt;/a&gt; does: The original warning message is now logged on level INFO; the stacktrace gets logged on DEBUG level.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15527315" author="bond_" created="Tue, 27 Sep 2016 20:27:23 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;~oliver.heger@t-online.de&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;, So will Commons Configuration be fixing the root cause of the issue?&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15530629" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Wed, 28 Sep 2016 19:32:29 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;I don&apos; t think there is anything to fix in Commons Configuration.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;BeanUtils&apos;s &lt;tt&gt;FluentPropertyBeanIntrospector&lt;/tt&gt; scans classes for property access methods. If it encounters a set() method whose signature is not compatible with a property setter method, it issues this log message. When applied on a Configuration object this happens for the &lt;em&gt;setProperty()&lt;/em&gt; method (which obviously cannot be renamed).&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The original bug report was that an exception stack trace on level WARN was logged. This has been changed to a message on INFO level which might be useful for diagnostic purposes. (I am not sure whether a low-level library like BeanUtils actually needs logging, but so is the current implementation.) &lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Do you mean this INFO message is still a problem?&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15530728" author="bond_" created="Wed, 28 Sep 2016 20:06:27 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;~oliver.heger@t-online.de&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;, I was trying to understand the root cause and beanutils is still like a black box to me. In process of getting my head around the issue, I was suspecting that the error message on INFO level is still a problem.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15530778" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Wed, 28 Sep 2016 20:26:37 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;So is the root cause now clear or do you still have questions?&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I would like to update the dependency from Commons Configuration to BeanUtils to the new version and then close this ticket.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15530787" author="bond_" created="Wed, 28 Sep 2016 20:31:08 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Yep, go ahead.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15553008" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Thu, 6 Oct 2016 19:54:41 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Fixed in revision 1763651 by updating the dependency to Commons BeanUtils to the new version 1.9.3. This version does no longer log the exception stacktrace (on warning level).&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                    </comments>

<item>
            <title>[CONFIGURATION-625] Missing maven dependency</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CONFIGURATION-625</link>
                <project id="12310467" key="CONFIGURATION">Commons Configuration</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;When I use maven to include configuration 2.* in my project I get the following error:&lt;br/&gt;
Exception in thread &quot;main&quot; java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: org/apache/commons/beanutils/BeanIntrospector.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The code that crashed did nothing but loading a few .properties files and add the property configuration to a composite. How to load .properties files is different in 2.0 so all I was copying the example from the documentation and modified the parameters. &lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I fixed the problem by adding the following dependency to maven:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&amp;lt;dependency&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
            &amp;lt;groupId&amp;gt;commons-beanutils&amp;lt;/groupId&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
            &amp;lt;artifactId&amp;gt;commons-beanutils&amp;lt;/artifactId&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
            &amp;lt;version&amp;gt;1.9.2&amp;lt;/version&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
&amp;lt;/dependency&amp;gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The 1.8 version of beanutils does not fix it.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;P.S. Thanks for reviving this project. &lt;img class=&quot;emoticon&quot; src=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/emoticons/smile.png&quot; height=&quot;16&quot; width=&quot;16&quot; align=&quot;absmiddle&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; border=&quot;0&quot;/&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="12964183">CONFIGURATION-625</key>
            <summary>Missing maven dependency</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>

                                        <assignee username="joehni">Joerg Schaible</assignee>

                            <comment id="15267062" author="joehni" created="Mon, 2 May 2016 17:44:21 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Look into the POM, beanutils 1.9.2 is declared as dependency. However, since not everyone uses the BeanFactory, this dependency is optional on purpose. Therefore you have to declare beanutils as dependency yourself if you want to use the feature. Just as you already did.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>

<item>
            <title>[CONFIGURATION-622] Writing INI file, keys with . become ..</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CONFIGURATION-622</link>
                <project id="12310467" key="CONFIGURATION">Commons Configuration</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;Here is sample input config:&lt;br/&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;learningtask&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br/&gt;
trains.lp = 5&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;after new INIConfiguration(conf).write() it becomes:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;learningtask&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br/&gt;
trains..lp = 5&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;seems related to the escaping of keys in the ExpressionEngine&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="12958610">CONFIGURATION-622</key>
            <summary>Writing INI file, keys with . become ..</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="5" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/resolved.png" description="A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.">Resolved</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="sbin">Simon Bin</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Wed, 13 Apr 2016 20:59:47 +0000</created>
                <updated>Sat, 16 Apr 2016 15:02:57 +0000</updated>

                                    <version>2.0</version>

                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>

                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="15241818" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Thu, 14 Apr 2016 20:18:38 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Thanks for the report. I will have a look.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15244264" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Sat, 16 Apr 2016 15:02:57 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;The problem was in INIConfiguration.write(). Here keys that might have been escaped were written to disk. The write() method has been rewritten to operate on configuration nodes directly. These nodes have the correct names.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Fixed in SVN in revision 1739472.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>

<item>
            <title>[CONFIGURATION-620] User Guide: Invalid Code Example</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CONFIGURATION-620</link>
                <project id="12310467" key="CONFIGURATION">Commons Configuration</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;The first and third code examples on the &lt;em&gt;File-based Configurations&lt;/em&gt; page (&lt;tt&gt;howto_filebased.xml&lt;/tt&gt;) are invalid. Both example create a &lt;tt&gt;FileBasedConfigurationBuilder&lt;/tt&gt; with a Type parameter of &lt;tt&gt;Configuration&lt;/tt&gt;:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;FileBasedConfigurationBuilder&amp;lt;Configuration&amp;gt; builder =
    &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; FileBasedConfigurationBuilder&amp;lt;Configuration&amp;gt;(PropertiesConfiguration.class)
. . .
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;However, the &lt;tt&gt;Configuration&lt;/tt&gt; Type parameter is not within bounds of the &lt;tt&gt;FileBasedConfigurationBuilder&lt;/tt&gt; class since the parameter must extend &lt;tt&gt;FileBasedConfiguration&lt;/tt&gt;:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;class &lt;/span&gt;FileBasedConfigurationBuilder&amp;lt;T &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;extends&lt;/span&gt;  FileBasedConfiguration&amp;gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;extends&lt;/span&gt; BasicConfigurationBuilder&amp;lt;T&amp;gt;
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Thus the examples need to be changed to:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;FileBasedConfigurationBuilder&amp;lt;FileBasedConfiguration&amp;gt; builder =
            &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; FileBasedConfigurationBuilder&amp;lt;FileBasedConfiguration&amp;gt;(PropertiesConfiguration.class)
. . .
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I will attach a patch with the necessary corrections.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="12946313">CONFIGURATION-620</key>

                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
