<item>
            <title>[CONFIGURATION-618] Accessing missing properties of immutable subset throws UndeclaredThrowableException instead of NoSuchElementException</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CONFIGURATION-618</link>
                <project id="12310467" key="CONFIGURATION">Commons Configuration</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;When I access a non-existing property of a configuration that has ThrowExceptionOnMissing set an java.lang.reflect.UndeclaredThrowableException is thrown. I think the desired behaviour would be to pass the underlying java.util.NoSuchElementException through from the ImmutableConfigurationInvocationHandler.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Example code:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;import&lt;/span&gt; org.apache.commons.configuration2.ImmutableConfiguration;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;import&lt;/span&gt; org.apache.commons.configuration2.PropertiesConfiguration;

&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;class &lt;/span&gt;ImmutableConfigurationStacktraceTest {

	&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;static&lt;/span&gt; void main(&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt;[] args) {
		&lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;//create empty PropertiesConfiguration
&lt;/span&gt;		PropertiesConfiguration propertiesConfiguration = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; PropertiesConfiguration();
		&lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;//&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;throw&lt;/span&gt; error when non-existing property is requested
&lt;/span&gt;		propertiesConfiguration.setThrowExceptionOnMissing(&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;true&lt;/span&gt;);
		
		&lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;//get immutable subset handled by ImmutableConfigurationInvocationHandler
&lt;/span&gt;		ImmutableConfiguration subset = propertiesConfiguration.immutableSubset(&quot;&quot;);
		
		&lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;//&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;this&lt;/span&gt; should &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;throw&lt;/span&gt; java.util.NoSuchElementException
&lt;/span&gt;		subset.getString(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;whoops!&quot;&lt;/span&gt;);
	}

}
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;gives the stacktrace:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;Exception in thread &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;main&quot;&lt;/span&gt; java.lang.reflect.UndeclaredThrowableException
	at com.sun.proxy.$Proxy0.getString(Unknown Source)
	at test.main(test.java:10)
Caused by: java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:62)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:497)
	at org.apache.commons.configuration2.ImmutableConfigurationInvocationHandler.invoke(ImmutableConfigurationInvocationHandler.java:79)
	... 2 more
Caused by: java.util.NoSuchElementException: Key &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&apos;whoops!&apos;&lt;/span&gt; does not map to an existing object!
	at org.apache.commons.configuration2.AbstractConfiguration.throwMissingPropertyException(AbstractConfiguration.java:1873)
	at org.apache.commons.configuration2.AbstractConfiguration.convert(AbstractConfiguration.java:1784)
	at org.apache.commons.configuration2.AbstractConfiguration.getString(AbstractConfiguration.java:1343)
	... 7 more
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</description>
                <environment>&lt;p&gt;Oracle JDK 1.8.0_60&lt;/p&gt;</environment>
        <key id="12936977">CONFIGURATION-618</key>
            <summary>Accessing missing properties of immutable subset throws UndeclaredThrowableException instead of NoSuchElementException</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="4" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/minor.svg">Minor</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="roshh">Robert Schimansky</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Fri, 5 Feb 2016 08:07:39 +0000</created>
                <updated>Thu, 24 Mar 2016 20:20:46 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Sun, 7 Feb 2016 18:15:12 +0000</resolved>
                                    <version>2.0-beta2</version>
                                    <fixVersion>2.0</fixVersion>
                                        <due></due>
                            <votes>1</votes>
                                    <watches>2</watches>

<item>
            <title>[CONFIGURATION-617] Incorrect multi-valued property substitution</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CONFIGURATION-617</link>
                <project id="12310467" key="CONFIGURATION">Commons Configuration</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;According to &lt;a href=&quot;http://grepcode.com/file/repo1.maven.org/maven2/commons-configuration/commons-configuration/1.10/org/apache/commons/configuration/AbstractConfiguration.java#AbstractConfiguration.resolveContainerStore%28java.lang.String%29&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;AbstractConfiguration#resolveContainerStore&lt;/a&gt; code and documentation it uses only first value if array/collection property value. &lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Such behavior is broken in a trivial situation: &lt;br/&gt;
&lt;tt&gt;a=1,2,3&lt;/tt&gt;&lt;br/&gt;
&lt;tt&gt;b=${a} &#8658; b=1&lt;/tt&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The solution will be to stop using logic in &lt;tt&gt;resolveContainerStore(key)&lt;/tt&gt; and just use &lt;tt&gt;getProperty(key)&lt;/tt&gt;.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="12932969">CONFIGURATION-617</key>
            <summary>Incorrect multi-valued property substitution</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="2">Won&apos;t Fix</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="alexlopashev">Alex Lopashev</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Thu, 21 Jan 2016 04:42:16 +0000</created>
                <updated>Fri, 29 Jan 2016 01:54:26 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Fri, 29 Jan 2016 01:54:26 +0000</resolved>
                                    <version>1.10</version>
                                                    <component>Interpolation</component>
                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>2</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="15113049" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Fri, 22 Jan 2016 20:57:00 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;I am not sure whether I fully understand your problem. Is this a feature request to change the way interpolation works so that all values of a property are taken into account? But in this case, the property value is a collection, and it has to be somehow embedded into the resulting string. How should this be done?&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Also note that for the upcoming version 2.0 of Configuration the interpolation code has been changed significantly. The &lt;tt&gt;resolveContainerStore()&lt;/tt&gt; method no longer exists. So you might want to the test this version and how it behaves.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15114880" author="alexlopashev" created="Mon, 25 Jan 2016 08:05:45 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;I guess you can agree such interpolation of array/collection to only first element is broken. There are several approaches for solution:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;ol&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;Support array/collection return type for &lt;tt&gt;resolveContainerStore&lt;/tt&gt; as it&apos;s already returning &lt;tt&gt;Object&lt;/tt&gt;. This one is heavy and error-prone.&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;Joining values with delimiter into one string and add splitting value somewhere at the last step of evaluation. This seems just not right approach and source for subtle bugs.&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;Do nothing and treat such behavior as expected. This option is ok if array/container processing would be turned off by default, right now it&apos;s on and uses comma (most natural symbol for enumeration) as delimiter&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;/ol&gt;


&lt;p&gt;So this is feature request for disabling multi-valued properties by default and treat strings with commas just like any other strings (&lt;tt&gt;AbstractConfiguration#delimiterParsingDisabled&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;=true&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/tt&gt;).&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15117957" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Tue, 26 Jan 2016 20:43:01 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Well, I do not agree that the interpolation implementation is broken. It obviously worked well for numerous users over the last years.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;But this discussion is pointless. Development currently focuses exclusively on version 2.0. Here list splitting is disabled per default, and interpolation works closely together with the enhanced data type conversion facilities. So I think this is closer to what you want. Please have a look.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15122730" author="alexlopashev" created="Fri, 29 Jan 2016 01:54:06 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Interpolation with list values imo is pretty rarely used functionality that&apos;s why there is no complaints about it.&lt;br/&gt;
There is a solution for me - just set &lt;tt&gt;delimiterParsingDisabled&lt;/tt&gt; flag.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Migration to 2.0 seems to be a pretty hard task (API differs I assume) and it&apos;s not event released yet.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;~oliver.heger@t-online.de&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;, thank you for your answer, I&apos;m closing the issue.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                    </comments>

<item>
            <title>[CONFIGURATION-616] Issue about ListHandler</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CONFIGURATION-616</link>
                <project id="12310467" key="CONFIGURATION">Commons Configuration</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;This issue can be easily reproduced!&lt;br/&gt;
Create a configuration files like this:&lt;br/&gt;
config.xml:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-xml&quot;&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;?xml version=&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;1.0&quot;&lt;/span&gt; encoding=&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;ISO-8859-1&quot;&lt;/span&gt; ?&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;configuration&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;
	&lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;system /&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;
	&lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;xml  fileName=&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;myproperties.xml&quot;&lt;/span&gt; config-name=&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;properties&quot;&lt;/span&gt; /&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;/configuration&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-xml&quot;&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;?xml version=&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;1.0&quot;&lt;/span&gt; encoding=&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;UTF-8&quot;&lt;/span&gt;?&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;properties&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;
	&lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;colors.pie&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;#FF0000, #00FF00&lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;/colors.pie&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;/properties&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Java code:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;DefaultExpressionEngineSymbols symbols = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; DefaultExpressionEngineSymbols.Builder(
				DefaultExpressionEngineSymbols.DEFAULT_SYMBOLS)
&lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// Use a slash as property delimiter instead of dot
&lt;/span&gt;				.setPropertyDelimiter(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;/&quot;&lt;/span&gt;).create();

DefaultExpressionEngine engine = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; DefaultExpressionEngine(symbols);

&lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// Now create a configuration using &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;this&lt;/span&gt; expression engine
&lt;/span&gt;Parameters params = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; Parameters();
DefaultListDelimiterHandler listDelimiterHandler = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; DefaultListDelimiterHandler(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&apos;,&apos;&lt;/span&gt;);
XMLBuilderParameters xmlBuilderParameters = params.xml()				.setFileName(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;config.xml&quot;&lt;/span&gt;).setExpressionEngine(engine)				.setListDelimiterHandler(listDelimiterHandler);
dcb = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; CombinedConfigurationBuilder().configure(xmlBuilderParameters);
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;try&lt;/span&gt; {
	config = dcb.getConfiguration();
	} &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;catch&lt;/span&gt; (ConfigurationException e) {
	        &lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// TODO Auto-generated &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;catch&lt;/span&gt; block
&lt;/span&gt;		e.printStackTrace();
}
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;I could not retrieving values of colors.pie using:&lt;br/&gt;
config.getStringArray(&quot;colors.pie&quot;);&lt;br/&gt;
The result is a single string &quot;#FF0000, #00FF00&quot; instead of an array of Strings.&lt;br/&gt;
However, using Java code to add a new property like this:&lt;br/&gt;
config.addProperty(&quot;my.test.value&quot;, &quot;#FF0000, #00FF00&quot;),&lt;br/&gt;
I can get an array as the result of :&lt;br/&gt;
config.getStringArray(&quot;my.test.value&quot;);&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="12932656">CONFIGURATION-616</key>
            <summary>Issue about ListHandler</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="8">Not A Problem</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="ttp270186">Tran Thanh Phuong</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Wed, 20 Jan 2016 08:42:06 +0000</created>
                <updated>Mon, 1 Feb 2016 08:52:39 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Mon, 1 Feb 2016 08:52:39 +0000</resolved>
                                    <version>2.0-alpha1</version>
                                    <fixVersion>2.0</fixVersion>
                                    <component>Build</component>
                    <component>Expression engine</component>
                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>2</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="15109426" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Wed, 20 Jan 2016 21:15:01 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Thanks for the report, I will have a look.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Your scenario is complex (an XML configuration in a combined configuration with an adapted expression engine). Can you reproduce the problem with a more simple setup, for instance using only a plain XML configuration?&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15110016" author="ttp270186" created="Thu, 21 Jan 2016 04:19:24 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;I tested again with 2 simpler scenarios:&lt;br/&gt;
 + Only one plain xml configuration file.&lt;br/&gt;
 + CombinedConfiguration with 2 xml files(not nested like the case I reported).&lt;br/&gt;
Unfortunately, I can not reproduce this issue with 2 scenarios above. It works like a charm in such both cases.&lt;br/&gt;
So, I think this is the problem of CombinedConfiguration when we have nested configuration files. In my project, we have vast configuration, so, we need to separate them for easier to manage. On the other hand, we need one xml file to wrap all other configuration files together.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15113028" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Fri, 22 Jan 2016 20:45:20 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Thank you for this additional information, this was helpful to nail down the problem.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I found out that the cause of the problem is that the list handler is only set for the combined configuration builder. In your setup code, it is added to the XML parameters which is passed to the builder&apos;s &lt;tt&gt;configure()&lt;/tt&gt; method. However, combined configuration builders do not inherit their settings to their child configurations. Therefore, the child XML configuration uses the default disabled list delimiter handler and does not split the multi-valued property.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I could work around the problem by defining default properties for child XML configurations. The following setup works for me:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;        DefaultExpressionEngineSymbols symbols = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; DefaultExpressionEngineSymbols.Builder(
                DefaultExpressionEngineSymbols.DEFAULT_SYMBOLS)
                .setPropertyDelimiter(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;/&quot;&lt;/span&gt;).create();
        DefaultExpressionEngine engine = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; DefaultExpressionEngine(symbols);
        DefaultListDelimiterHandler listDelimiterHandler = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; DefaultListDelimiterHandler(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&apos;,&apos;&lt;/span&gt;);
        Parameters params = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; Parameters();
        XMLBuilderParameters xmlParams = params.xml()
                .setExpressionEngine(engine)
                .setListDelimiterHandler(listDelimiterHandler);
        XMLBuilderParameters definitionParams = params.xml().setFile(
                ConfigurationAssert.getTestFile(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;testCCListHandler.xml&quot;&lt;/span&gt;));
        CombinedBuilderParameters combinedParameters = params.combined()
                .setDefinitionBuilderParameters(definitionParams)
                .registerChildDefaultsHandler(XMLBuilderProperties.class,
                        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; CopyObjectDefaultHandler(xmlParams));
        builder.configure(combinedParameters, xmlParams);
        CombinedConfiguration config = builder.getConfiguration();
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;So, the builder is configured additionally with a &lt;tt&gt;CombinedBuilderParameters&lt;/tt&gt; object which has default settings defined for XML child configurations.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The current implementation of &lt;tt&gt;CombinedConfigurationBuilder&lt;/tt&gt; deliberately does not pass its settings to its child configurations because it is not clear whether this behavior is desired in all use cases. And, using the mechanism with default handlers, it is possible to configure all child configurations with specific settings. So the conclusion is that the behavior you see is not a bug.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;That said, I have to admit that the code for setting up the builder correctly becomes pretty complex. Suggestions for making this easier are really welcome.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15116643" author="ttp270186" created="Tue, 26 Jan 2016 04:11:36 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;We are using version 1.x in our projects. It works perfectly for us. &lt;br/&gt;
From my opinion, It&apos;s simply because in version 1, the list delimiter is enabled with comma separator by default.&lt;br/&gt;
I think using default settings for child configurations is OK, but by passing the settings to child configuration, you could eliminate the effort of users. &lt;br/&gt;
Let say another way, all the configurations of a system should be consistent, so, I don&apos;t think there is many user cases where the child configurations have different settings, so passing the settings to child configurations is much more preferred for me!&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15117948" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Tue, 26 Jan 2016 20:38:34 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Many thanks for this feedback. I will consider changing the current implementation with regards to passing settings to child configurations.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Is your original problem now solved? Can this ticket be closed?&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15125954" author="ttp270186" created="Mon, 1 Feb 2016 08:49:51 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Sorry for my late reply.&lt;br/&gt;
This issue is OK for me now. Many thanks for pointing out the solution.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15125958" author="ttp270186" created="Mon, 1 Feb 2016 08:52:39 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Please consider to enable passing the settings for children configuration instead of using the default settings.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                    </comments>
                    <attachments>
                    </attachments>
                <subtasks>
                    </subtasks>
                <customfields>
                                                                            <customfield id="customfield_12310310" key="com.atlassian.jira.toolkit:attachments">
                        <customfieldname>Attachment count</customfieldname>
                        <customfieldvalues>
                            <customfieldvalue>0.0</customfieldvalue>
                        </customfieldvalues>
                    </customfield>
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        <customfield id="customfield_12310220" key="com.atlassian.jira.ext.charting:firstresponsedate">
                        <customfieldname>Date of First Response</customfieldname>
                        <customfieldvalues>
                            <customfieldvalue>Wed, 20 Jan 2016 21:15:01 +0000</customfieldvalue>

                        </customfieldvalues>
                    </customfield>
                                                                <customfield id="customfield_12314020" key="com.atlassian.jira.plugins.jira-development-integration-plugin:devsummary">
                        <customfieldname>Development</customfieldname>
                        <customfieldvalues>
                            
                        </customfieldvalues>
                    </customfield>
                                                                                                                        <customfield id="customfield_12313422" key="com.atlassian.jirafisheyeplugin:jobcheckbox">
                        <customfieldname>Enable Automatic Patch Review</customfieldname>
                        <customfieldvalues>
                            <customfieldvalue><![CDATA[false]]></customfieldvalue>

                        </customfieldvalues>
                    </customfield>

<item>
            <title>[CONFIGURATION-613] MapConfiguration cannot handle property set to single \t or \n</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CONFIGURATION-613</link>
                <project id="12310467" key="CONFIGURATION">Commons Configuration</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;See the following test, written in groovy (2.4.4). Open a groovyConsole, copy/paste in this code and hit ctrl-Enter to run. You need a working internet connection.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;@Grab(group=&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&apos;commons-configuration&apos;&lt;/span&gt;, module=&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&apos;commons-configuration&apos;&lt;/span&gt;, version=&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&apos;1.9&apos;&lt;/span&gt;)
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;import&lt;/span&gt; org.apache.commons.configuration.MapConfiguration
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;import&lt;/span&gt; org.apache.commons.configuration.PropertiesConfiguration

&lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// groovy dollar-slashy-string syntax, ignores backslash
&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// as an escape character so \t remains a literal string
&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// backslash + t
&lt;/span&gt;def propsString = $/
prefix.field1=\t
prefix.field2=a\tb
/$

&lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// Java properties work
&lt;/span&gt;Properties props = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; Properties()
props.load(&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; StringReader(propsString))
&lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// OK
&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;assert&lt;/span&gt; props.getProperty(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&apos;prefix.field1&apos;&lt;/span&gt;) == &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&apos;\t&apos;&lt;/span&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// OK
&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;assert&lt;/span&gt; props.getProperty(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&apos;prefix.field2&apos;&lt;/span&gt;) == &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&apos;a\tb&apos;&lt;/span&gt;

&lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// PropertiesConfiguration works
&lt;/span&gt;PropertiesConfiguration propscfg = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; PropertiesConfiguration()
propscfg.load(&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; StringReader(propsString))
&lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// OK
&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;assert&lt;/span&gt; propscfg.getString(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&apos;prefix.field1&apos;&lt;/span&gt;) == &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&apos;\t&apos;&lt;/span&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// OK
&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;assert&lt;/span&gt; propscfg.getProperty(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&apos;prefix.field2&apos;&lt;/span&gt;) == &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&apos;a\tb&apos;&lt;/span&gt;

&lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// MapConfiguration does not work
&lt;/span&gt;MapConfiguration mapcfg = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; MapConfiguration(props)
&lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// OK
&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;assert&lt;/span&gt; mapcfg.getProperty(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&apos;prefix.field2&apos;&lt;/span&gt;) == &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&apos;a\tb&apos;&lt;/span&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// FAIL
&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// MapConfiguration loses the single tab character
&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;assert&lt;/span&gt; mapcfg.getString(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&apos;prefix.field1&apos;&lt;/span&gt;) == &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&apos;\t&apos;&lt;/span&gt;
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Output is:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;preformatted panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;preformattedContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre&gt;Exception thrown

Assertion failed: 

assert mapcfg.getString(&apos;prefix.field1&apos;) == &apos;\t&apos;
       |      |                          |
       |      &quot;&quot;                         false
       org.apache.commons.configuration.MapConfiguration@1cd4064c


	at ConsoleScript13.run(ConsoleScript13:35)
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;As you can see, once we&apos;ve &apos;converted&apos; the java.util.Properties instance to a MapConfiguration, the single \t character is lost. &lt;b&gt;Embedded&lt;/b&gt; tab characters however are retained!&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="12902091">CONFIGURATION-613</key>
            <summary>MapConfiguration cannot handle property set to single \t or \n</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="5" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/resolved.png" description="A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.">Resolved</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="8">Not A Problem</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="boekhold">Maarten Boekhold</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Fri, 2 Oct 2015 10:51:05 +0000</created>
                <updated>Fri, 20 Nov 2015 20:42:23 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Fri, 20 Nov 2015 20:42:23 +0000</resolved>
                                                                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>2</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="14942314" author="boekhold" created="Sat, 3 Oct 2015 14:10:10 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;It occurred to me that MapConfiguration is probably trying to skip leading whitespace, and a new test seems to confirm this:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;@Grab(group=&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&apos;commons-configuration&apos;&lt;/span&gt;, module=&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&apos;commons-configuration&apos;&lt;/span&gt;, version=&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&apos;1.9&apos;&lt;/span&gt;)
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;import&lt;/span&gt; org.apache.commons.configuration.MapConfiguration
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;import&lt;/span&gt; org.apache.commons.configuration.PropertiesConfiguration

&lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// groovy dollar-slashy-string syntax, ignores backslash
&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// as an escape character so \t remains a literal string
&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// backslash + t
&lt;/span&gt;def propsString = $/
prefix.field3=\tabc
/$

Properties props = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; Properties()
props.load(&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; StringReader(propsString))
&lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// OK
&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;assert&lt;/span&gt; props.getProperty(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&apos;prefix.field3&apos;&lt;/span&gt;) == &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&apos;\tabc&apos;&lt;/span&gt;

&lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// MapConfiguration does not work
&lt;/span&gt;MapConfiguration mapcfg = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; MapConfiguration(props)
&lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// But should not be!
&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;assert&lt;/span&gt; mapcfg.getString(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&apos;prefix.field3&apos;&lt;/span&gt;) == &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&apos;abc&apos;&lt;/span&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// FAIL
&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// MapConfiguration loses the single tab character
&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;assert&lt;/span&gt; mapcfg.getString(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&apos;prefix.field3&apos;&lt;/span&gt;) == &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&apos;\tabc&apos;&lt;/span&gt;
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;with output&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;preformatted panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;preformattedContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre&gt;Exception thrown

Assertion failed: 

assert mapcfg.getString(&apos;prefix.field3&apos;) == &apos;\tabc&apos;
       |      |                          |
       |      abc                        false
       org.apache.commons.configuration.MapConfiguration@64cdc026


	at ConsoleScript2.run(ConsoleScript2:23)
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;As you can see from the following assert statement:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;assert&lt;/span&gt; mapcfg.getString(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&apos;prefix.field3&apos;&lt;/span&gt;) == &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&apos;abc&apos;&lt;/span&gt;
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The MapConfiguration seems to think that &quot;prefix.field3&quot; should be &quot;abc&quot; without a leading tab character. That&apos;s not how java.util.Properties interprets this: that one keeps the leading tab character *&lt;b&gt;if it is specified as \t&lt;/b&gt;*.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;In any case, *&lt;b&gt;why&lt;/b&gt;* would MapConfiguration try to remove leading whitespace when it is initialized from a Properties instance? The Properties class would already have taken care of all of that presumably.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="14942805" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Sun, 4 Oct 2015 20:20:59 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Your analysis is correct, MapConfiguration does some trimming per default.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;There have been issues with trimming in the past. Therefore, in version 1.7 a new property &lt;em&gt;trimmingDisabled&lt;/em&gt; was introduced. If set to &lt;b&gt;true&lt;/b&gt;, no trimming should be performed. Can you test whether this solves your problem?&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="14942967" author="boekhold" created="Mon, 5 Oct 2015 06:26:32 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Hi,&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Yes, setTrimmingDisabled(true) fixes my issue. Yet, I wonder if it is not possible to do better. Bear with me.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Assume MapConfiguration is initialized from a Properties instance. That Properties instance is presumably loaded from file, which means that java.util.Properties has already applied its own &quot;trimming rules&quot;, eg leading whitespace &lt;b&gt;if it is not explicit like with \t&lt;/b&gt; has already been trimmed, and trailing whitespace has been left alone.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;For MapConfiguration there are now 2 situations to consider:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;ul&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;The property has a single, non-list, value. In this case, I expect the result of MapConfiguration.getProperty() to be &lt;b&gt;identical&lt;/b&gt; to Properties.getProperty(). So, MapConfiguration should &lt;b&gt;not&lt;/b&gt; do &lt;em&gt;any&lt;/em&gt; trimming &lt;em&gt;if the property is a single non-list value&lt;/em&gt;.&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;The property represents a list. In this case, java.util.Properties has already applied its own trimming rules, which means that any &lt;em&gt;non-explicit&lt;/em&gt; leading whitespace has already been removed. So I expect the first value of the result of MapConfiguration.getProperty() to leave any &lt;em&gt;leading&lt;/em&gt; whitespace &lt;em&gt;for the first element&lt;/em&gt; alone.&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;/ul&gt;


&lt;p&gt;I&apos;m not sure yet if this should be the behavior for any MapConfiguration instance, or only for MapConfiguration instances that have been created from a Properties object. I think there&apos;s an argument there somewhere to apply this logic as well to the MapConfiguration(Map&amp;lt;String,?&amp;gt; map constructor.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Does this sound reasonable?&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="14943894" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Mon, 5 Oct 2015 19:33:21 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Hm, I have made the experience that most of the issues reported against Commons Configuration are related to list splitting and trimming. There are so many corner cases and different use cases that there is probably no single right solution.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;That said, your arguments sound plausible. Now as version 2.0 is ante portas, there is the chance to do some changes which would otherwise not be possible (in an 1.x release, I would say, don&apos;t change it - it might break existing code).&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;So would it make sense to set the &lt;em&gt;trimmingDisabled&lt;/em&gt; flag to &lt;b&gt;true&lt;/b&gt; in the constructor that expects a Properties object or what exactly do you propose?&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="14946667" author="boekhold" created="Wed, 7 Oct 2015 10:56:52 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;I was thinking about something like (pseudo-code):&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;class &lt;/span&gt;MapConfiguration {
    ...
    &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;Object&lt;/span&gt; getProperty(&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt; key) {
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;Object&lt;/span&gt; value = map.get(key);
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;if&lt;/span&gt; ((value &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;instanceof&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt;) &amp;amp;&amp;amp; !((&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt;)value).contains(getListDelimiter())))
        {
            &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;return&lt;/span&gt; value;
        }
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;else&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;if&lt;/span&gt; ((value &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;instanceof&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt;) &amp;amp;&amp;amp; (!isDelimiterParsingDisabled()))
        {
            &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;return&lt;/span&gt; PropertyConverter.split((&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt;)value, getListDelimiter(), !isTrimmingDisabled());
        }
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;else&lt;/span&gt;
        {
            &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;return&lt;/span&gt; value;
        }
    }
}

&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;class &lt;/span&gt;PropertyConverter {
    ...
    &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;static&lt;/span&gt; List&amp;lt;&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt;&amp;gt; split(&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt; s, &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;char&lt;/span&gt; delimiter, &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;boolean&lt;/span&gt; trim) {
        ...
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// replace occurrences of &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;if&lt;/span&gt; (trim) { t = t.trim(); }&quot;&lt;/span&gt; with:
&lt;/span&gt;        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;if&lt;/span&gt; (trim) {
            &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;if&lt;/span&gt; (list.size() == 0) {
                &lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;for&lt;/span&gt; first token, &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;do&lt;/span&gt; not strip whitespace. Any whitespace that is here
&lt;/span&gt;                &lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// was left there intentionally by java.util.Properties.load()
&lt;/span&gt;                t = StringUtils.stripEnd(t, &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;null&lt;/span&gt;);
            } &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;else&lt;/span&gt; {
                t = s.trim();
            }
            list.add(t)
        }
    }
}
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Since `PropertyConverter.split()` is probably be called from many other places, this probably requires an additional argument to `split()` enable this functionality only when called from `MapConfiguration` when that was instantiated using `public MapConfiguration(Properties props)`&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="14947443" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Wed, 7 Oct 2015 19:35:00 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Can you please have a look at the most recent code in subversion? There have already some changes been applied to &lt;tt&gt;MapConfiguration&lt;/tt&gt;. Especially, the class now uses the inherited &lt;em&gt;list delimiter handler&lt;/em&gt; for splitting, and here a flag can be passed in whether trimming is enabled or not.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15005446" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Sat, 14 Nov 2015 15:58:24 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Any updates here? Does the current implementation (in subversion) fit your needs?&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15018749" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Fri, 20 Nov 2015 20:42:23 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Got no more feedback, so closing this ticket. Feel free to reopen if you think the problem still persists in the Configuration 2.x code base.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>

                                                                <customfield id="customfield_12310920" key="com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:gh-global-rank">
                        <customfieldname>Rank (Obsolete)</customfieldname>
                        <customfieldvalues>
                            <customfieldvalue>9223372036854775807</customfieldvalue>
                        </customfieldvalues>
                    </customfield>
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                <customfield id="customfield_12310222" key="com.atlassian.jira.ext.charting:timeinstatus">
                        <customfieldname>Time in Status</customfieldname>

<item>
            <title>[CONFIGURATION-610] Improve Configuration Variable Documentation</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CONFIGURATION-610</link>
                <project id="12310467" key="CONFIGURATION">Commons Configuration</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;The JavaDoc for &lt;a href=&quot;http://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-configuration/apidocs/index.html&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;Class PropertiesConfiguration &lt;/a&gt; lists a very handy feature of Configuration, which is variable substitution.  The behavior can be seen in the example file on the JavaDoc (good).&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;But it&apos;s not in the preceding list of features.  It would be nice to have a little writeup describing the intended behavior:  What is supposed to happen if you have an undefined ref?  What about nested refs?  What about circular refs? &lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;And it was interesting to find that the substitution occurred during get time rather than load (unexpected), and that if one calls the wrong get() method then the substitution will not happen.  (Is that intended behavior?)  This should be called out in the description as well as the individual method JavaDocs.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="12862841">CONFIGURATION-610</key>
            <summary>Improve Configuration Variable Documentation</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="dlamet">Dan Lamet</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Wed, 9 Sep 2015 19:06:51 +0000</created>
                <updated>Thu, 24 Mar 2016 20:20:52 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Fri, 20 Nov 2015 20:39:54 +0000</resolved>
                                    <version>2.0-alpha1</version>
                                    <fixVersion>2.0</fixVersion>
                                    <component>Documentation</component>
                        <due></due>
                            <votes>1</votes>
                                    <watches>3</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="14739240" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Thu, 10 Sep 2015 18:02:20 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;The documentation can certainly be improved. You already have thought about it, would you be willing to provide a patch with your proposed changes?&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Note that some further documentation about variable substitution is available in the user&apos;s guide at &lt;a href=&quot;http://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-configuration/userguide/howto_basicfeatures.html#Variable_Interpolation&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;http://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-configuration/userguide/howto_basicfeatures.html#Variable_Interpolation&lt;/a&gt;. So maybe it makes sense to improve this chapter and just add a link in the Javadocs? Also, as all these basic features are implemented by the base class &lt;tt&gt;AbstractConfiguration&lt;/tt&gt;, maybe it is better to add comprehensive documentation there and in the derived classes add a statement like &quot;All basic features as described for AbstractConfiguration are available as well&quot;.&lt;br/&gt;
WDYT?&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="14983797" author="dave abelgo" created="Sat, 31 Oct 2015 04:04:05 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Just a side note on Documentation, as a novice who has never used commons configuration before.  Having a basic this is how to read a properties file with with versions XXX in getting started would be help full.  I got quite confused as v1.1 has no method to build immutable configuration mentioned in the getting started section. &lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I found this &lt;br/&gt;
&lt;a href=&quot;https://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-configuration/userguide/howto_properties.html#Using_PropertiesConfiguration&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-configuration/userguide/howto_properties.html#Using_PropertiesConfiguration&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;However it took me a moment to understand the builder and that the code segment given used is using the wrong generic type. &lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt; To load this file, you&apos;ll write something like:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Parameters params = new Parameters();&lt;br/&gt;
FileBasedConfigurationBuilder&amp;lt;Configuration&amp;gt; builder =&lt;br/&gt;
    new FileBasedConfigurationBuilder&amp;lt;Configuration&amp;gt;(PropertiesConfiguration.class)&lt;br/&gt;
    .configure(params.properties()&lt;br/&gt;
        .setFileName(&quot;usergui.properties&quot;));&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt; .......  SHOULD BE  something like this if its going to compile. &lt;br/&gt;
&amp;gt;&amp;gt;&amp;gt;&amp;gt;&amp;gt;&amp;gt;&amp;gt;&lt;/p&gt;


&lt;p&gt;   private final static String PROPERTIES_FILE_NAME = &quot;system.properties&quot;;&lt;br/&gt;
   public static final Configuration config;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    public static void read_config() throws ConfigurationException&lt;/p&gt;
{
        
    Parameters params = new Parameters();
    
    FileBasedConfigurationBuilder&amp;lt;FileBasedConfiguration&amp;gt; builder;
    builder  = new FileBasedConfigurationBuilder&amp;lt;FileBasedConfiguration&amp;gt;(PropertiesConfiguration.class)
        .configure(params.properties()
        .setFileName(PROPERTIES_FILE_NAME));
    
     Configuration config = builder.getConfiguration();
    
    }
&lt;p&gt;  &lt;/p&gt;

</comment>
                            <comment id="14984170" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Sat, 31 Oct 2015 21:34:16 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Dave,&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I am not sure I fully understand your point. Do you mean that there is an error in the user guide for reading properties or that there is no clear separation between the different versions of Commons Configuration? Or both?&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="14984233" author="dave abelgo" created="Sun, 1 Nov 2015 01:45:19 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Yes sorry for being a bit long winded.  first.  The section in the example did not compile in my editor with java 1.8 as it would not accept &amp;lt;Configuration&amp;gt; as the correct generic type where as &amp;lt;FileBasedConfiguration&amp;gt; did work.   If I was able to I would have changed the documentation my self. &lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The first point was more about documentation navigation. I ended up switching back to v1.10 from configurations2 as I found it more &quot;idomatic&quot; or just easier to code.  With all the switching and googling I soon found my self reading documentation that was for the wrong version of the package and getting more confused.   To avoid confusion one project I use a lot that deals very well with documentation between different version,  is  &lt;a href=&quot;http://laravel.com/docs/5.1&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;http://laravel.com/docs/5.1&lt;/a&gt;,  When you  you google &quot;laravel validations&quot; a page come up you instantly know what version on the package you are looking at. its also in the URL and you can switch back to the documentation for the version you want.&lt;br/&gt;
Mysql has a similar setup that helps navigation. &lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Any how commons-configurations 1.10 is working great for me so no complaints once I figured out how to find the correct documentation&lt;br/&gt;
Thanks for the hard work putting it together.  &lt;/p&gt;

</comment>
                            <comment id="14984532" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Sun, 1 Nov 2015 20:16:27 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Thanks for clarification. Regarding the example that does not compile: The generic types in the builders still need some tweaking. After that the example should hopefully work as described.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15018742" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Fri, 20 Nov 2015 20:39:54 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Some more details about variable substitution have been added to the corresponding chapter in the user&apos;s guide. The Javadocs of the most important Configuration implementations now reference this chapter.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>

<item>
            <title>[CONFIGURATION-609] When using a VFSFileSystem on a PropertiesConfiguration, processing an include token defaults back to DefaultFileSystem</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CONFIGURATION-609</link>
                <project id="12310467" key="CONFIGURATION">Commons Configuration</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;I have uploaded two files to HDFS.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;hr /&gt;
&lt;p&gt;bob.properties:&lt;br/&gt;
==&lt;br/&gt;
include=fred.properties&lt;br/&gt;
==&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;hr /&gt;
&lt;p&gt;fred.properties&lt;br/&gt;
==&lt;br/&gt;
key=value&lt;br/&gt;
==&lt;br/&gt;
&amp;#8212;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;If I load fred.properties and evaluated the &quot;key&quot;, value is returned as expected. If I load bob.properties, I get a ConfigurationException.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Here is the code snippet, please change setFileName() to reflect both cases:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;		FileSystem fsTest = new VFSFileSystem();&lt;br/&gt;
		fsTest.setFileOptionsProvider(new HDFSOptionsProvider());&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;		Parameters params = new Parameters();&lt;br/&gt;
		FileBasedConfigurationBuilder&amp;lt;FileBasedConfiguration&amp;gt; builder =&lt;br/&gt;
		    new FileBasedConfigurationBuilder&amp;lt;FileBasedConfiguration&amp;gt;(PropertiesConfiguration.class)&lt;br/&gt;
		    .configure(params.fileBased()&lt;br/&gt;
		    	.setLocationStrategy(new FileSystemLocationStrategy())&lt;br/&gt;
		    	.setBasePath(&quot;hdfs://localhost:8020/user/myusername&quot;)&lt;br/&gt;
		        .setFileName(&quot;bob.properties&quot;)&lt;br/&gt;
		        .setFileSystem(fsTest));&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;		Configuration config;&lt;br/&gt;
		try &lt;/p&gt;
{
			config = builder.getConfiguration();
			System.out.println(config.getString(&quot;key&quot;));
		}
&lt;p&gt; catch (ConfigurationException e) &lt;/p&gt;
{
			e.printStackTrace();
		}

&lt;p&gt;--------------------&lt;br/&gt;
HDFSOptionsProvider.java:&lt;br/&gt;
==&lt;br/&gt;
public class HDFSOptionsProvider implements FileOptionsProvider {&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;	@Override&lt;br/&gt;
	public Map&amp;lt;String, Object&amp;gt; getOptions() &lt;/p&gt;
{
		Map&amp;lt;String, Object&amp;gt; opts = new HashMap&amp;lt;String, Object&amp;gt;();
		opts.put(&quot;DefaultProvider&quot;, HdfsFileProvider.class);
		return  opts;
	}
&lt;p&gt;}&lt;br/&gt;
==&lt;br/&gt;
-------------&lt;br/&gt;
Here is the Exception trace:&lt;br/&gt;
15/08/25 14:14:46 INFO impl.StandardFileSystemManager: Using &quot;/tmp/vfs_cache&quot; as temporary files store.&lt;br/&gt;
15/08/25 14:14:47 WARN util.NativeCodeLoader: Unable to load native-hadoop library for your platform... using builtin-java classes where applicable&lt;br/&gt;
org.apache.commons.configuration2.ex.ConfigurationException: Unable to load the configuration from the URL hdfs://localhost:8020/user/myusername/fred.properties&lt;br/&gt;

	at org.apache.commons.configuration2.PropertiesConfigurationLayout.load(PropertiesConfigurationLayout.java:494)&lt;br/&gt;

	at org.apache.commons.configuration2.io.FileHandler.loadFromReader(FileHandler.java:1124)&lt;br/&gt;
	at org.apache.commons.configuration2.io.FileHandler.loadFromTransformedStream(FileHandler.java:1110)&lt;br/&gt;
	at org.apache.commons.configuration2.io.FileHandler.loadFromStream(FileHandler.java:1049)&lt;br/&gt;
	at org.apache.commons.configuration2.io.FileHandler.load(FileHandler.java:980)&lt;br/&gt;

	at org.apache.commons.configuration2.builder.FileBasedConfigurationBuilder.initResultInstance(FileBasedConfigurationBuilder.java:291)&lt;br/&gt;
	at org.apache.commons.configuration2.builder.FileBasedConfigurationBuilder.initResultInstance(FileBasedConfigurationBuilder.java:60)&lt;br/&gt;
	at org.apache.commons.configuration2.builder.BasicConfigurationBuilder.createResult(BasicConfigurationBuilder.java:421)&lt;br/&gt;
	at org.apache.commons.configuration2.builder.BasicConfigurationBuilder.getConfiguration(BasicConfigurationBuilder.java:285)&lt;br/&gt;
	at com.secureops.config.TestLoadConf.main(TestLoadConf.java:33)&lt;br/&gt;
Caused by: java.io.IOException: VFS URLs can only be used with VFS APIs&lt;br/&gt;
	at org.apache.commons.configuration2.io.VFSFileSystem$VFSURLStreamHandler.openConnection(VFSFileSystem.java:368)&lt;br/&gt;
	at java.net.URL.openConnection(URL.java:975)&lt;br/&gt;
	at java.net.URL.openStream(URL.java:1041)&lt;br/&gt;

                            <comment id="14715391" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Wed, 26 Aug 2015 19:42:39 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;This looks indeed like a bug. I will have a look (in the next few days). Thanks for the report.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="14715398" author="nuttybrewer" created="Wed, 26 Aug 2015 19:49:40 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;I&apos;m still working this out locally, but switching to the 1.10 version with&lt;br/&gt;
similar code it seems to not be a problem. Only thing is, with the v1.10&lt;br/&gt;
I&apos;m need to using a configuration file descriptor to get this to work.&lt;br/&gt;
Haven&apos;t used a configuration file descriptor with v2 yet.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;On Wed, Aug 26, 2015 at 9:42 PM, Oliver Heger (JIRA) &amp;lt;jira@apache.org&amp;gt;&lt;/p&gt;
</comment>
                            <comment id="14725472" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Tue, 1 Sep 2015 14:27:29 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Fixed in subversion in revision 1700566.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The problem was that the FileHandler used to load the include file was newly created and only initialized with the URL of the file to be loaded. Now the handler is created as a copy from the original FileHandler and thus inherits all properties like file system or location strategy.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>

<item>
            <title>[CONFIGURATION-608] Method configure in ReloadingFileBasedConfigurationBuilder should return ReloadingFileBasedConfigurationBuilder</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CONFIGURATION-608</link>
                <project id="12310467" key="CONFIGURATION">Commons Configuration</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;I think configure method of ReloadingFileBasedConfigurationBuilder  should return ReloadingFileBasedConfigurationBuilder instead of FileBasedConfigurationBuilder otherwise I have to explicitly cast &lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;ReloadingFileBasedConfigurationBuilder a = (ReloadingFileBasedConfigurationBuilder&amp;lt;XMLConfiguration&amp;gt;)&lt;br/&gt;
                new ReloadingFileBasedConfigurationBuilder&amp;lt;&amp;gt;(XMLConfiguration.class).configure(params.xml().setFile(fileToDefaults));&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="12858576">CONFIGURATION-608</key>
            <summary>Method configure in ReloadingFileBasedConfigurationBuilder should return ReloadingFileBasedConfigurationBuilder</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="4" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/minor.svg">Minor</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="Dzmitry Shylovich">Dzmitry Shylovich</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Tue, 25 Aug 2015 10:54:16 +0000</created>
                <updated>Thu, 24 Mar 2016 20:21:00 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Tue, 1 Sep 2015 14:24:54 +0000</resolved>
                                                    <fixVersion>2.0</fixVersion>
                                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>2</watches>

<item>
            <title>[CONFIGURATION-606] Version 2.0-beta1 not published to maven repository as documented</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CONFIGURATION-606</link>
                <project id="12310467" key="CONFIGURATION">Commons Configuration</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;The webpage at&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;https://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-configuration/dependency-info.html&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-configuration/dependency-info.html&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;documents the following maven dependency snippet for version 2.0-beta1, but it does not work since this version has not actually been published to the maven repos:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&amp;lt;dependency&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
  &amp;lt;groupId&amp;gt;org.apache.commons&amp;lt;/groupId&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
  &amp;lt;artifactId&amp;gt;commons-configuration2&amp;lt;/artifactId&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
  &amp;lt;version&amp;gt;2.0-beta1&amp;lt;/version&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
&amp;lt;/dependency&amp;gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Please consider either correctly publish the jars as documented, or remove this documentation from the website, as it is misleading to users.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="12855372">CONFIGURATION-606</key>
            <summary>Version 2.0-beta1 not published to maven repository as documented</summary>

                            <comment id="14700105" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Mon, 17 Aug 2015 19:42:20 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Okay, I understand that the current situation can be confusing.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The release has deliberately not be published to Maven central because breaking changes cannot be excluded until the final release. Having multiple binary incompatible versions in central with the same group and artifact IDs is very problematic.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;OTOH, the &lt;em&gt;Dependency Information&lt;/em&gt; page you are referring to is automatically generated. I guess, it is possible to override it temporarily, but do you think a corresponding note on the main page would be sufficient?&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15210894" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Thu, 24 Mar 2016 20:23:41 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;This issue should be fixed now with the availability of Commons Configuration 2.0 final.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>

<item>
            <title>[CONFIGURATION-605] XMLConfiguration drops configuration key immediately following one whose value contains a comma</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CONFIGURATION-605</link>
                <project id="12310467" key="CONFIGURATION">Commons Configuration</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;The following XML document:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;preformatted panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;preformattedContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre&gt;StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder(&quot;&amp;lt;configuration&amp;gt;&quot;);}}
sb.append(&quot;&amp;lt;test1&amp;gt;a,b,c&amp;lt;/test1&amp;gt;&quot;);
sb.append(&quot;&amp;lt;test2&amp;gt;a&amp;lt;/test2&amp;gt;&quot;);
sb.append(&quot;&amp;lt;test3&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/test3&amp;gt;&quot;);
 sb.append(&quot;&amp;lt;test4&amp;gt;a,b\\,b,c&amp;lt;/test4&amp;gt;&quot;);
sb.append(&quot;&amp;lt;/configuration&amp;gt;&quot;);
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;when passed into &lt;tt&gt;XMLConfiguration#load(Reader)&lt;/tt&gt; and then to &lt;tt&gt;ConfigurationUtils#toString(Configuration)&lt;/tt&gt;, comes out like this:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;preformatted panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;preformattedContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre&gt;test1=[a, b, c]
test3=
test4=[a, b,b, c]
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I&apos;m assuming this is a bug.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I&apos;ve found two workarounds to this:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt; 1. Inserting any character between the &lt;tt&gt;test1&lt;/tt&gt; and &lt;tt&gt;test2&lt;/tt&gt; tags, i.e. &lt;tt&gt;&amp;lt;test1&amp;gt;a,b,c&amp;lt;/test1&amp;gt; &amp;lt;test2&amp;gt;a&amp;lt;/test2&amp;gt;&lt;/tt&gt;&lt;br/&gt;
 2. Calling &lt;tt&gt;setDelimiterParsingDisabled(true)&lt;/tt&gt; on the XMLConfiguration before loading the document&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;For reproduction with a minimal example and some additional test cases, see &lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/emlun/commons-xmlconfiguration-ignored-key/&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;this GitHub repo&lt;/a&gt;. I also posted this as &lt;a href=&quot;https://stackoverflow.com/questions/31516549&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;a question on Stack Overflow&lt;/a&gt; before posting here.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment>&lt;p&gt;$ uname -a&lt;br/&gt;
Linux 4.1.2-2-ARCH #1 SMP PREEMPT Wed Jul 15 08:30:32 UTC 2015 x86_64 GNU/Linux&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;$ java -version&lt;br/&gt;
openjdk version &quot;1.8.0_45&quot;&lt;br/&gt;
OpenJDK Runtime Environment (build 1.8.0_45-b14)&lt;br/&gt;
OpenJDK 64-Bit Server VM (build 25.45-b02, mixed mode)&lt;/p&gt;</environment>
        <key id="12846267">CONFIGURATION-605</key>
            <summary>XMLConfiguration drops configuration key immediately following one whose value contains a comma</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="4" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/minor.svg">Minor</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="emlun">Emil Lundberg</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Mon, 20 Jul 2015 13:02:37 +0000</created>
                <updated>Thu, 24 Mar 2016 20:21:00 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Mon, 3 Aug 2015 19:49:11 +0000</resolved>
                                    <version>1.3</version>
                    <version>1.4</version>
                    <version>1.5</version>
                    <version>1.6</version>
                    <version>1.7</version>
                    <version>1.8</version>
                    <version>1.9</version>
                    <version>1.10</version>
                                    <fixVersion>2.0</fixVersion>
                                    <component>Format</component>
                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>2</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="14635695" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Tue, 21 Jul 2015 19:43:03 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Thanks for the report. I will have a look (in a couple of days).&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;To make sure: The key is not really gone, i.e. it can be accessed via getProperty()? It is just dropped by the toString() method?&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;One other remark: In the upcoming version 2.0 of Commons Configuration the list delimiter parsing has been reworked. So it may well be possible that this version behaves differently.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="14637006" author="emlun" created="Wed, 22 Jul 2015 14:26:55 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Yes, the key is really gone - I discovered this issue because my tests were failing with NullPointerExceptions. The linked GitHub repo contains some JUnit tests that expose the problem by checking &lt;tt&gt;Configuration.containsKey(String)&lt;/tt&gt;.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="14641754" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Sat, 25 Jul 2015 18:59:31 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;With the help of your test project (thanks again very much) I was able to figure out what is going wrong: The problem was in the &lt;tt&gt;handleDelimiters()&lt;/tt&gt; method of &lt;tt&gt;XMLConfiguration&lt;/tt&gt;. Here nodes with multiple values are handled in a special way. The node with the first value is removed from the parent node, then for each value a new node is added. Removing of the first node caused the bug because this operation also affected the DOM currently processed.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;In Configuration 2.0 the code has been reworked. List delimiter parsing and management of references to DOM elements are now handled in a different way. I adapted your unit test for the new version and committed it. It runs successfully showing that the issue does no longer exist. So can we mark this issue as resolved in version 2.0?&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="14642440" author="emlun" created="Mon, 27 Jul 2015 08:32:14 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Good to hear, thanks! I haven&apos;t tested with version 2.0 since I&apos;m doing this at work and 2.0 is still in alpha. If you judge it&apos;s resolved I&apos;ll take your word for it, so do go ahead and mark it as resolved in 2.0.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="14652364" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Mon, 3 Aug 2015 19:49:11 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;A unit test has been committed demonstrating that the problem no longer exists in version 2.0.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="14653497" author="emlun" created="Tue, 4 Aug 2015 11:50:10 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Great! If nobody objects, I&apos;ll feel free to delete the demo repository from GitHub starting 2015-08-11.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                    </comments>
                    <attachments>
                    </attachments>
                <subtasks>
                    </subtasks>
