<item>
            <title>[CONFIGURATION-570] Passing SystemConfiguration() into PropertiesConfiguration() can cause a ConcurrentModificationException</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CONFIGURATION-570</link>
                <project id="12310467" key="CONFIGURATION">Commons Configuration</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;This was encountered in a release of Accumulo. I&apos;m not sure if this is in the realm of commons configuration, but I figured I should put in a ticket-&lt;br/&gt;
A. just in case it is or&lt;br/&gt;
B. So others can be aware of this issue&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;We had a piece of code which interpolates java properties (SystemConfiguration) with other variables. This code worked as follows&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;      PropertiesConfiguration pconf = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; PropertiesConfiguration();
      pconf.append(&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; SystemConfiguration());
      pconf.addProperty(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;hack_default_value&quot;&lt;/span&gt;, &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;this&lt;/span&gt;.defaultValue);
      &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt; v = pconf.getString(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;hack_default_value&quot;&lt;/span&gt;);
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;However, after we added a monitor thread which calls System.setProperty before this code is hit, we would occasionally get a ConcurrentModificationException.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I traced it down to pconf.append doing an iteration over the Configuration (AbstractConfiguration, line 1233 in 1.6). The configuration being passed in, SystemConfiguration, is just a MapConfiguration from the result of System.getProperties. This is an exact copy of the map the System maintains.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;There are two accessors to that map, setProperty and setProperties in System. Set property basically just falls to Properties.setProperty, while setProperties will copy the existing properties, add new ones, and then replace the object. We are using setProperty in our code.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Properties.setProperty is a synchronized call, so we resolved it by replacing our code with&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;      PropertiesConfiguration pconf = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; PropertiesConfiguration();
      Properties systemProperties = &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;System&lt;/span&gt;.getProperties();
      &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;synchronized&lt;/span&gt; (systemProperties) {
        pconf.append(&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; MapConfiguration(systemProperties));
      }
      pconf.addProperty(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;hack_default_value&quot;&lt;/span&gt;, &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;this&lt;/span&gt;.defaultValue);
      &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt; v = pconf.getString(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;hack_default_value&quot;&lt;/span&gt;);
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I&apos;m not quite sure if/how it should be handled in commons configuration. I&apos;m thinking if it IS in the scope of this project, then SystemConfiguration should create a snapshot of System.getProperties. Or a new Configuration/configuration flag should be added to create a snapshot of it instead of the map directly.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="12699269">CONFIGURATION-570</key>
            <summary>Passing SystemConfiguration() into PropertiesConfiguration() can cause a ConcurrentModificationException</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="vines">John Vines</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Thu, 6 Mar 2014 21:34:20 +0000</created>
                <updated>Thu, 24 Mar 2016 20:20:43 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Tue, 9 Sep 2014 18:00:06 +0000</resolved>
                                    <version>1.6</version>
                                    <fixVersion>2.0</fixVersion>
                                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>2</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="13926176" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Mon, 10 Mar 2014 20:38:15 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;This is an interesting report. I am also not sure how to handle it.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;First of all, you have entered 1.6 as affected version. The current version is 1.10. There has been some work on &lt;tt&gt;SystemConfiguration&lt;/tt&gt;, but to be honest, I doubt that the problem is solved in this version.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;IMHO, situation is similar to the synchronized collections provided by the JDK (which can be obtained via Collections.synchronizedSet/Map etc.). Here the Javadocs explicitly state that iteration over the elements has to be manually synced. We could think about creating a snapshot for the iteration, but this would affect every caller - a manual synchronization in opposite can be added if needed dependent on the current use case.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Another thought: There is an alternative way for accessing system properties. In configuration files you can use a special method for variable interpolation to access system properties. Details can be found here: &lt;a href=&quot;http://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-configuration/userguide/howto_basicfeatures.html#Variable_Interpolation&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;http://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-configuration/userguide/howto_basicfeatures.html#Variable_Interpolation&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br/&gt;
Maybe this makes the append operation unnecessary?&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="13926256" author="vines" created="Mon, 10 Mar 2014 21:36:11 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;I checked, and the code around this bug was not fixed as of 1.9. I did not look at trunk to see if it changed.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;And that seems to work as well, that was a good tip!&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="13930896" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Tue, 11 Mar 2014 20:27:55 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Glad to hear this.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;However, it occurred to me that we probably have to do something about this problem because we might also be affected when constructing a combined configuration using &lt;tt&gt;DefaultConfigurationBuilder&lt;/tt&gt;. This class allows combining multiple configuration sources to a single combined configuration. During this process, an iteration over the keys of the single sources is performed. So if there are concurrent modifications on system properties, the mentioned exception can be thrown.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="14127299" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Tue, 9 Sep 2014 18:00:06 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Fixed in SVN in revision 1623863.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The &lt;tt&gt;getKeys()&lt;/tt&gt; implementation in &lt;tt&gt;SystemConfiguration&lt;/tt&gt; was changed to return a snapshot of the keys currently stored in the system properties. Thus &lt;tt&gt;ConcurrentModificationExceptions&lt;/tt&gt; can no longer occur.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                    </comments>

<item>
            <title>[CONFIGURATION-567] XMLBeanDeclaration.getNestedBeanDeclarations() doesn&apos;t escape the node name when query the child node</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CONFIGURATION-567</link>
                <project id="12310467" key="CONFIGURATION">Commons Configuration</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;When query the nested bean declaration, the child name may contain the special character. So when call &quot;HierarchicalConfiguration.configurationsAt()&quot;, the node name should be escaped by the expression engine first as the following&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;getConfiguration().getExpressionEngine().nodeKey(node,&quot;&quot;)
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Call sequence to the problem code:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;preformatted panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;preformattedContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre&gt;getNestedBeanDeclarations()
-&amp;gt;nested.put(child.getName(), createBeanDeclaration(child));
   -&amp;gt;List&amp;lt;HierarchicalConfiguration&amp;gt; list = getConfiguration().configurationsAt(node.getName());
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="12693380">CONFIGURATION-567</key>
            <summary>XMLBeanDeclaration.getNestedBeanDeclarations() doesn&apos;t escape the node name when query the child node</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>

<item>
            <title>[CONFIGURATION-566] BeanHelper.createBean() can&apos;t support Map&lt;&gt; bean property loading from file</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CONFIGURATION-566</link>
                <project id="12310467" key="CONFIGURATION">Commons Configuration</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;The issue is BeanUtils.setProperty() can support the java Map bean to set the (key, value) entry. But the BeahHelper.initProperty() add 1 more PropertyUtils.isWriteable() check. While this PropertyUtils.isWriteable() doesn&apos;t support java Map bean. &lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The check &quot;PropertyUtils.isWriteable()&quot; is quite redundant and unnecessary.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Is it better to remove the check &quot;PropertyUtils.isWriteable()&quot; since the BeanUtils.setProperty() has various ways to set the properties?&lt;/p&gt;


&lt;div class=&quot;preformatted panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;preformattedContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre&gt;BeanHelper.createBean() 
 -&amp;gt; DefaultBeanFactory.createBean()
      -&amp;gt; DefaultBeanFactory.initBeanInstance()
           -&amp;gt; BeanHelper.initBean()
                -&amp;gt;BeahHelper.initProperty()
                   {
                        if (!PropertyUtils.isWriteable(bean, propName))
                        ...
                        BeanUtils.setProperty(bean, propName, value);
                   }
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="12693361">CONFIGURATION-566</key>
            <summary>BeanHelper.createBean() can&apos;t support Map&lt;&gt; bean property loading from file</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/open.png" description="The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.">Open</status>
                    <statusCategory id="2" key="new" colorName="blue-gray"/>
                                    <resolution id="-1">Unresolved</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="dreamershl">Shen liang</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Wed, 5 Feb 2014 14:46:23 +0000</created>
                <updated>Sun, 27 Apr 2014 17:51:34 +0000</updated>
                                            <version>1.10</version>
                                                    <component>Type conversion</component>
                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>2</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="13902482" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Sat, 15 Feb 2014 18:02:19 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;I am not sure whether I fully understand your problem. Could you provide a short test case which is failing and demonstrates what you are trying to achieve - and ideally a proposed patch for fixing this issue?&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="13902608" author="dreamershl" created="Sun, 16 Feb 2014 01:35:31 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;How to repeat the issue:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Define a bean as a child class of HashMap&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;class &lt;/span&gt;Setting &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;extends&lt;/span&gt; HashMap&amp;lt;&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt;, Setting.Configuration&amp;gt;
{
     &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;static&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;class &lt;/span&gt;Configuration()
     {
            &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt; item;
     }    
} 
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The above bean will cause the error when try to load it from the XML file.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;FIX: &lt;br/&gt;
comment out the additional check in the BeanHelper::initProperty() like the following&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;private&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;static&lt;/span&gt; void initProperty(&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;Object&lt;/span&gt; bean, &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt; propName, &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;Object&lt;/span&gt; value)
            &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;throws&lt;/span&gt; ConfigurationRuntimeException
    {

        &lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;//It is redundant and &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;case&lt;/span&gt; the Map bean can&apos;t be set properly
&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;//        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;if&lt;/span&gt; (!PropertyUtils.isWriteable(bean, propName))
&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;//        {
&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;//            &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;throw&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; ConfigurationRuntimeException(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;Property &quot;&lt;/span&gt; + propName
&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;//                                                            + &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot; cannot be set on &quot;&lt;/span&gt; + bean.getClass().getName());
&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;//        }
&lt;/span&gt;
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;try&lt;/span&gt;
        {
            BeanUtils.setProperty(bean, propName, value);
        }
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;catch&lt;/span&gt; (IllegalAccessException iaex)
        {
            &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;throw&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; ConfigurationRuntimeException(iaex);
        }
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;catch&lt;/span&gt; (InvocationTargetException itex)
        {
            &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;throw&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; ConfigurationRuntimeException(itex);
        }
    }
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="13902847" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Sun, 16 Feb 2014 21:26:26 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;But does this really solve the problem? The documentation of BeanUtils.setProperty() says:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&quot;If the property is read only then the method returns without throwing an exception.&quot;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;So this means, if the isWriteable() check is removed, the property will not be set, but the caller does not get any feedback about the problem. I think, this is worse.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="13902882" author="dreamershl" created="Sun, 16 Feb 2014 23:45:40 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;I already use that fix in my current project and it works as expected.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Point1:&lt;br/&gt;
Yes, it does. Because inside the BeanUtils.setProperty(), it will check whether the caller is try to set &amp;lt;key, value&amp;gt; for the Map&amp;lt;&amp;gt;. The process on the map key value pair is different from the normal property. &lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Point2:&lt;br/&gt;
Whether the property is writable or not, is handled by the BeanUtils.setProperty(), no need add another check just before it. If it is not writable, BeanUtils.setProperty() itself will throw the exception, with the detail error cause. No different from the current code. &lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Step back, the current check function is using &quot;PropertyUtils.isWriteable()&quot;, but actual job is done by &quot;BeanUtils.setProperty()&quot;, apparently the logic is different since they are different function. &lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;To make my point2 more clearer, BeanUtils.setProperty() will throw the exception if really can&apos;t set the value. The error message is so similar!!!&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;preformatted panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;preformattedContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre&gt;BeanUtils.setProperty()
   call BeanUtilsBean.getInstance().setProperty()
          {
               ...
               // Invoke the setter method
        try {
          getPropertyUtils().setProperty(target, name, newValue);
        } catch (NoSuchMethodException e) {
            throw new InvocationTargetException
                (e, &quot;Cannot set &quot; + propName);
        } 
          }
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;BeanUtils.setProperty() will handle the map object differently.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;preformatted panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;preformattedContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre&gt;BeanUtils.setProperty()
   call BeanUtilsBean.getInstance().setProperty()
         call getPropertyUtils().setProperty(target, name, newValue);
                call setNestedProperty()
                 {
                      ...
                      if (bean instanceof Map) {
                 }
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="13906041" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Wed, 19 Feb 2014 20:36:52 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;So there also seems to be a problem with BeanUtils: The &lt;tt&gt;isWriteable()&lt;/tt&gt; method is not in sync with &lt;tt&gt;setProperty()&lt;/tt&gt;, and the documentation is obviously wrong, too.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;My preferred solution would be to fix &lt;tt&gt;isWriteable()&lt;/tt&gt; in BeanUtils. However, there is not much activity on this component, and it is not likely that such a fix happens in a near future. So changing the code in &lt;tt&gt;BeanHelper&lt;/tt&gt; seems to be the option to go.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Can you verify that the tests still run after you have removed the &lt;tt&gt;isWriteable()&lt;/tt&gt; call?&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="13906680" author="dreamershl" created="Thu, 20 Feb 2014 06:52:05 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;If you mean the full unit testing, I didn&apos;t really run them after remove &quot;isWriteable()&quot; but from the source code, I don&apos;t think the removing will cause any issue. From the configuration library angle, the removing is better since it can increase range of supported type. &lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Hope soon can see the upgrade version so I can remove my own fix classes. Thanks. &lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="13982407" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Sun, 27 Apr 2014 17:51:34 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;When the &lt;tt&gt;isWriteable()&lt;/tt&gt; check is removed the test case &lt;tt&gt;testInitBeanWithInvalidProperty&lt;/tt&gt; fails. This test tries to set a value for a non-existing property. Obviously, &lt;tt&gt;setProperty()&lt;/tt&gt; does not throw an exception in this case, but ignores the property it cannot resolve - this is in-line with the documentation of this method.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;However, for Commons Configuration it is desired that an invalid or non-existing property causes an exception to be thrown. So the proposed fix cannot be applied.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I fear, it is not possible to implement a satisfying work-around in Configuration. This is really an issue for BeanUtils.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                    </comments>

<item>
            <title>[CONFIGURATION-564] PropertiesReader.doParseProperty() version 1.8+ not backward compatible</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CONFIGURATION-564</link>
                <project id="12310467" key="CONFIGURATION">Commons Configuration</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;We have a legacy application using a library with properties configuration files where some properties are only keys; Example:&lt;br/&gt;
property.key&lt;br/&gt;
instead of &lt;br/&gt;
property.key=value or property.key=&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Until version 1.7 those properties where present with no value in our CompositeConfiguration instance.&lt;br/&gt;
Starting with version 1.8 (introducing a private not overridable regex pattern) those properties are now left out of our application configuration.&lt;br/&gt;
Since we don&apos;t own the lib we can&apos;t move to latest version of commons-configuration and are stuck with version 1.7&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="12692060">CONFIGURATION-564</key>
            <summary>PropertiesReader.doParseProperty() version 1.8+ not backward compatible</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="paskos">pascal gehl</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>

                                    <version>1.8</version>
                    <version>1.9</version>
                    <version>1.10</version>
                                    <fixVersion>2.0</fixVersion>
                                    <component>Format</component>
                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>

<item>
            <title>[CONFIGURATION-561] Configuration.getList signature incorrect and incompatible change</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CONFIGURATION-561</link>
                <project id="12310467" key="CONFIGURATION">Commons Configuration</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;In &lt;tt&gt;commons-configuration&lt;/tt&gt; 1.7 &lt;tt&gt;Configuration.getList&lt;/tt&gt; had signature:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; List getList(&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt; key, List defaultValue)
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;But it was changed in 1.8 to:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; List&amp;lt;&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;Object&lt;/span&gt;&amp;gt; getList(&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt; key, List&amp;lt;&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;Object&lt;/span&gt;&amp;gt; defaultValue)
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;So something like this:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;Configuration conf = ...; &lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// some configuration
&lt;/span&gt;List&amp;lt;&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt;&amp;gt; defaults = ...; &lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// some &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;default&lt;/span&gt; value
&lt;/span&gt;
List&amp;lt;&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;Object&lt;/span&gt;&amp;gt; value = conf.getList(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;id&quot;&lt;/span&gt;, defaults);
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;will fail at compile-time.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;To fix this signature should change to&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; List&amp;lt;&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;Object&lt;/span&gt;&amp;gt; getList(&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt; key, List&amp;lt;? &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;extends&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;Object&lt;/span&gt;&amp;gt; defaultValue)
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;in &lt;tt&gt;Configuration&lt;/tt&gt; and all its implementations.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment>&lt;p&gt;Linux 3.12.2, Oracle JDK 7u40&lt;/p&gt;</environment>
        <key id="12683875">CONFIGURATION-561</key>
            <summary>Configuration.getList signature incorrect and incompatible change</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/blocker.svg">Blocker</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="3">Duplicate</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="grossws">Konstantin Gribov</reporter>
                        <labels>
                            <label>easyfix</label>
                            <label>newbie</label>
                    </labels>
                <created>Tue, 10 Dec 2013 17:11:02 +0000</created>
                <updated>Tue, 10 Dec 2013 17:25:31 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Tue, 10 Dec 2013 17:25:31 +0000</resolved>
                                    <version>1.8</version>
                    <version>1.9</version>
                                                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>1</watches>
                                    <timeoriginalestimate seconds="600">10m</timeoriginalestimate>
                            <timeestimate seconds="600">10m</timeestimate>
                                        <comments>
                            <comment id="13844438" author="grossws" created="Tue, 10 Dec 2013 17:24:47 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Issue &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CONFIGURATION-558&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CONFIGURATION-558&lt;/a&gt; wasn&apos;t found by searching &lt;tt&gt;getList&lt;/tt&gt;. As I see, it was fixed there.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                    </comments>
                <issuelinks>
                            <issuelinktype id="10020">
                    <name>Cloners</name>

<item>
            <title>[CONFIGURATION-560] Receiving duplicate list entries for XPATH expression on XML document via org.apache.commons.configuration.HierarchicalConfiguration.configurationsAt</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CONFIGURATION-560</link>
                <project id="12310467" key="CONFIGURATION">Commons Configuration</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;The XPATH expression used selects only one element, but getList and configurationsAT retrieves the same element twice ... or I am simply not getting the manual &lt;img class=&quot;emoticon&quot; src=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/emoticons/smile.png&quot; height=&quot;16&quot; width=&quot;16&quot; align=&quot;absmiddle&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; border=&quot;0&quot;/&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Please see the simple example code attached below.&lt;/p&gt;


&lt;p&gt;Fedora Linux FC 17&lt;br/&gt;
Java 1.7&lt;br/&gt;
Apache Commons Components used:&lt;br/&gt;
commons-collections-3.2.1.jar&lt;br/&gt;
commons-configuration-1.10.jar&lt;br/&gt;
commons-jxpath-1.3.jar&lt;br/&gt;
commons-lang-2.6.jar&lt;br/&gt;
commons-logging-1.1.3.jar&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;XML document &quot;sample.xml&quot;:&lt;br/&gt;
____________________________________________&lt;br/&gt;
&amp;lt;?xml version=&quot;1.0&quot; encoding=&quot;UTF-8&quot;?&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
&amp;lt;config&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
	&amp;lt;names&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
		&amp;lt;firstname id=&quot;1&quot;&amp;gt; Peter   &amp;lt;/firstname&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
		&amp;lt;firstname id=&quot;2&quot;&amp;gt; Michael &amp;lt;/firstname&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
		&amp;lt;firstname id=&quot;3&quot;&amp;gt; Alex    &amp;lt;/firstname&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
	&amp;lt;/names&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
&amp;lt;/config&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
____________________________________________&lt;/p&gt;


&lt;p&gt;Java code:&lt;br/&gt;
____________________________________________&lt;br/&gt;
import java.util.List;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;import org.apache.commons.configuration.ConfigurationException;&lt;br/&gt;
import org.apache.commons.configuration.HierarchicalConfiguration;&lt;br/&gt;
import org.apache.commons.configuration.XMLConfiguration;&lt;br/&gt;
import org.apache.commons.configuration.tree.xpath.XPathExpressionEngine;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;public class xmltest {&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;	public static void main(String[] args) {&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;		XMLConfiguration XMLconfig;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;		try {&lt;br/&gt;
			XMLconfig = new XMLConfiguration(&quot;/tmp/sample.xml&quot;);&lt;br/&gt;
			XMLconfig.load();&lt;br/&gt;
			XMLconfig.setExpressionEngine(new XPathExpressionEngine());&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;			System.out.println(&quot;Retrieving firstname with id=2 via configurationsAt() ...&quot;);&lt;br/&gt;
			List&amp;lt;HierarchicalConfiguration&amp;gt; fields = XMLconfig.configurationsAt(&quot;names/firstname&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;@id=&amp;#39;2&amp;#39;&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;&quot;);&lt;br/&gt;
			for (HierarchicalConfiguration sub : fields) &lt;/p&gt;
{
				System.out.println(&quot;=&amp;gt; names/firstname[@id=&apos;2&apos;] = &quot; + sub.getString(&quot;.&quot;));
			}

&lt;p&gt;			System.out.println(&quot;\nRetrieving firstname with id=2 via getList() ...&quot;);&lt;br/&gt;
			List&amp;lt;Object&amp;gt; liObjects = XMLconfig.getList(&quot;names/firstname&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;@id=&amp;#39;2&amp;#39;&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;&quot;);&lt;br/&gt;
			for (Object obj : liObjects) &lt;/p&gt;
{
				System.out.println(&quot;=&amp;gt; names/firstname[@id=&apos;2&apos;] = &quot; + (String) obj);
			}

&lt;p&gt;			System.out.println(&quot;\nRetrieving firstname with id=2 via getString() ...&quot;);&lt;br/&gt;
			System.out.println(&quot;=&amp;gt; names/firstname&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;@id=&amp;#39;2&amp;#39;&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt; = &quot; + XMLconfig.getString(&quot;names/firstname&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;@id=&amp;#39;2&amp;#39;&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;&quot;));&lt;br/&gt;
		}&lt;br/&gt;
		catch (ConfigurationException e) &lt;/p&gt;
{
			e.printStackTrace();
		}
&lt;p&gt;	}&lt;br/&gt;
}&lt;br/&gt;
____________________________________________&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Output:&lt;br/&gt;
____________________________________________&lt;br/&gt;
Retrieving firstname with id=2 via configurationsAt() ...&lt;br/&gt;
=&amp;gt; names/firstname&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;@id=&amp;#39;2&amp;#39;&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt; = Michael&lt;br/&gt;
=&amp;gt; names/firstname&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;@id=&amp;#39;2&amp;#39;&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt; = Michael&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Retrieving firstname with id=2 via getList() ...&lt;br/&gt;
=&amp;gt; names/firstname&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;@id=&amp;#39;2&amp;#39;&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt; = Michael&lt;br/&gt;
=&amp;gt; names/firstname&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;@id=&amp;#39;2&amp;#39;&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt; = Michael&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Retrieving firstname with id=2 via getString() ...&lt;br/&gt;
=&amp;gt; names/firstname&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;@id=&amp;#39;2&amp;#39;&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt; = Michael&lt;br/&gt;
____________________________________________&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="12679732">CONFIGURATION-560</key>
            <summary>Receiving duplicate list entries for XPATH expression on XML document via org.apache.commons.configuration.HierarchicalConfiguration.configurationsAt</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="5" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/resolved.png" description="A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.">Resolved</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="8">Not A Problem</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="valetti">Martin Schlegel</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Mon, 18 Nov 2013 14:08:41 +0000</created>
                <updated>Fri, 6 Dec 2013 20:32:30 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Fri, 6 Dec 2013 20:32:30 +0000</resolved>
                                    <version>1.10</version>
                                                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>2</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="13825771" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Mon, 18 Nov 2013 20:54:37 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;It seems that you ran into a trap here. You created the configuration in the following way:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;XMLconfig = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; XMLConfiguration(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;/tmp/sample.xml&quot;&lt;/span&gt;);
XMLconfig.load();
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;This actually loads the data twice! The constructor already loads the specified file, the following load() operation loads it again constructing a union of the data already available. Thus you end up with duplicate entries.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Just remove the additional load() call. This should solve the problem.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="13835540" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Fri, 29 Nov 2013 20:53:17 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Any updates here? Did this solve your problem? Can we close this ticket?&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="13841669" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Fri, 6 Dec 2013 20:32:30 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Got no more feedback, so resolving this issue. Please reopen if you think that there is still a problem.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                    </comments>

            <title>[CONFIGURATION-558] Configuration no longer accepts List&lt;String&gt; as default for getList()</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CONFIGURATION-558</link>
                <project id="12310467" key="CONFIGURATION">Commons Configuration</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;The attached test used to work with configuration 1.7 when the getList(String key, List default) method did not take generics. The method needs to take an arbitrary List, not just List&amp;lt;Object&amp;gt;.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="12674747">CONFIGURATION-558</key>

<item>
            <title>[CONFIGURATION-557] Regression: MapConfiguration no longer accepts a Map&lt;String, String&gt; (compilation error)</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CONFIGURATION-557</link>
                <project id="12310467" key="CONFIGURATION">Commons Configuration</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;The attached test runs fine with configuration 1.7. It has a compilation error with 1.8 and 1.9. &lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The attached patch fixes the problem, which is a pure compiler verification problem. &lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="12674731">CONFIGURATION-557</key>
            <summary>Regression: MapConfiguration no longer accepts a Map&lt;String, String&gt; (compilation error)</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>

            <title>[CONFIGURATION-556] Regression with SystemProperties in 1.8 and 1.9</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CONFIGURATION-556</link>
                <project id="12310467" key="CONFIGURATION">Commons Configuration</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;The attached test case succeeds in commons configuration 1.7 but fails in 1.8 and 1.9. It does succeed on trunk again, probably due to the &quot;use properties directly&quot; changes in SystemProperties.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;As 2.0 is not yet released, it would be nice to get a 1.9.1 that is 1.9 + this bug fixed.&lt;/p&gt;

<item>
            <title>[CONFIGURATION-555] XMLConfiguration doesn&apos;t seem to be preserving whitespace for the current node where xml:space=&quot;preserve&quot; is set.</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CONFIGURATION-555</link>
                <project id="12310467" key="CONFIGURATION">Commons Configuration</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;if I give this in the configuration:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&amp;lt;test xml:space=&quot;preserve&quot;&amp;gt; a b c &amp;lt;/test&amp;gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;It does not seem to preserve the whitespace on the current node.  However, if I do&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&amp;lt;space xml:space=&quot;preserve&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
   &amp;lt;test&amp;gt; a b c &amp;lt;/test&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
&amp;lt;/space&amp;gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;it does preserve it. I would like to be able to turn on whitespace preservation on the current node without changing the path to my node.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I tested my values by printing out values retrieved from getList() method.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment>&lt;p&gt;Windows 7, Java 7 64 bit.&lt;/p&gt;</environment>
        <key id="12670385">CONFIGURATION-555</key>
            <summary>XMLConfiguration doesn&apos;t seem to be preserving whitespace for the current node where xml:space=&quot;preserve&quot; is set.</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="dwayne@predictabledata.com">Dwayne Smurdon @ Predictable Data</reporter>
                        <labels>
                            <label>xml:space</label>
                    </labels>
                <created>Tue, 24 Sep 2013 23:14:48 +0000</created>
                <updated>Mon, 28 Oct 2013 06:54:36 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Sun, 29 Sep 2013 20:20:08 +0000</resolved>
                                    <version>1.9</version>
                                    <fixVersion>2.0</fixVersion>
                    <fixVersion>1.10</fixVersion>
                                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>2</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="13777985" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Wed, 25 Sep 2013 19:37:35 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Any chance you could provide a simple JUnit test? This would help tracking down the problem.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="13781493" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Sun, 29 Sep 2013 20:20:08 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;There was indeed a bug with the handling of the xml:space attribute: the attribute value was only applied to sub elements, but not to the current element. This has been fixed in subversion in revision 1527396.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;However, after this fix one test case was failing related to the copy constructor of &lt;tt&gt;XMLConfiguration&lt;/tt&gt;. The reason is that now an XML element that does not have any content of its own (except for whitespace between its children), but has children and the xml:space attribute set to &quot;preserve&quot; is assigned a value consisting only of whitespace. When saving the configuration again, this additional whitespace value is written and scrambles formatting. This causes the test case to fail.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;This special corner case has been addressed by doing a trim in this constellation anyway, independent on the value of the xml:space attribute - we simply assume that the value has no meaning. So in this case, &lt;tt&gt;XMLConfiguration&lt;/tt&gt; behaves as before, while in other cases the xml:space attribute should now be evaluated correctly.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="13781511" author="dwayne@predictabledata.com" created="Sun, 29 Sep 2013 22:11:39 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Thanks for looking into and resolving this, Oliver.  &lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                    </comments>
                    <attachments>
                    </attachments>
                <subtasks>
                    </subtasks>

<item>
            <title>[CONFIGURATION-548] NoSuchMethodError if reloading strategy is specified in configuration XML - coommons-lang 2.6, commons configuration 1.9</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CONFIGURATION-548</link>
                <project id="12310467" key="CONFIGURATION">Commons Configuration</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;I&apos;m using the DefaultConfigurationBuilder to load the config.xml which contains the configuration definitions.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;DefaultConfigurationBuilder builder = new DefaultConfigurationBuilder();&lt;br/&gt;
builder.setFile(new File(&quot;config.xml&quot;));&lt;br/&gt;
CombinedConfiguration cc = builder.getConfiguration(true);&lt;/p&gt;



&lt;p&gt;It definitely finds the config.xml file, but it keeps throwing java.lang.NoSuchMethodError: getClass during the loading.&lt;/p&gt;


&lt;p&gt;java.lang.NoSuchMethodError: getClass&lt;br/&gt;
at org.apache.commons.configuration.beanutils.BeanHelper.loadClass(BeanH&lt;br/&gt;
elper.java:297)&lt;br/&gt;
at org.apache.commons.configuration.beanutils.BeanHelper.fetchBeanClass(&lt;br/&gt;
BeanHelper.java:322)&lt;br/&gt;
at org.apache.commons.configuration.beanutils.BeanHelper.createBean(Bean&lt;br/&gt;
Helper.java:244)&lt;br/&gt;
at org.apache.commons.configuration.beanutils.BeanHelper.createBean(Bean&lt;br/&gt;
Helper.java:266)&lt;br/&gt;
at org.apache.commons.configuration.beanutils.BeanHelper.initBean(BeanHe&lt;br/&gt;
lper.java:176)&lt;/p&gt;


&lt;p&gt;The config.xml file is:&lt;br/&gt;
&amp;lt;?xml version=&quot;1.0&quot; encoding=&quot;ISO-8859-1&quot; ?&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
&amp;lt;!-- This is the configuration file for the Apache Commons Configuration. --&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
&amp;lt;configuration&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
&amp;lt;override&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
&amp;lt;properties fileName=&quot;env.properties&quot; throwExceptionOnMissing=&quot;true&quot; config-name=&quot;uup&quot; config-optional=&quot;true&quot;&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
&amp;lt;reloadingStrategy refreshDelay=&quot;10&quot; config-class=&quot;org.apache.commons.configuration.reloading.FileChangedReloadingStrategy&quot;/&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
&amp;lt;/properties&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
&amp;lt;/override&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
&amp;lt;/configuration&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
If I remove the reloadingStrategy element from the config.xml file, everything works properly. I am sure  I have all the required commons jars in my classpath.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I read on another thread that I need to use latest version of commons-lang.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I am using commons-long 2.6 and commons-configuration 1.9. Any help is much appreciated.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment>&lt;p&gt;Windows, weblogic server 10.3&lt;/p&gt;</environment>
        <key id="12654383">CONFIGURATION-548</key>
            <summary>NoSuchMethodError if reloading strategy is specified in configuration XML - coommons-lang 2.6, commons configuration 1.9</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="6">Invalid</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="anuragk">Anurag Kshirsagar</reporter>
                        <labels>
                            <label>newbie</label>
                    </labels>
                <created>Sun, 23 Jun 2013 15:10:39 +0000</created>
                <updated>Mon, 5 Aug 2013 19:47:35 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Mon, 5 Aug 2013 19:47:15 +0000</resolved>
                                    <version>1.9</version>
                                    <fixVersion>2.0</fixVersion>
                                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>2</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="13692339" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Mon, 24 Jun 2013 20:26:46 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;This is the same situation as for &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CONFIGURATION-297&quot; title=&quot;NoSuchMethodError if reloading strategy is specified in configuration XML&quot; class=&quot;issue-link&quot; data-issue-key=&quot;CONFIGURATION-297&quot;&gt;&lt;del&gt;CONFIGURATION-297&lt;/del&gt;&lt;/a&gt;, and the answer is the same, too: It is with a high probability a classpath issue. Please check your classpath again and also make sure that you do not have multiple versions of required libraries.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I don&apos;t know Weblogic, but it may be the case that the server ships older versions of some Commons libraries in its lib directory and these versions take precedence over others in your classpath.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="13728977" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Sun, 4 Aug 2013 20:14:25 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Any updates here? I am going to close this ticket as invalid as there is nothing we can do.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="13729073" author="anuragk" created="Mon, 5 Aug 2013 02:05:47 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Please close this. I was able to resolve this issue.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Thanks and Regards&lt;br/&gt;
Anurag Kshirsagar | myAT&amp;amp;T DSS&lt;/p&gt;
</comment>
                            <comment id="13729868" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Mon, 5 Aug 2013 19:47:15 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Not a problem of Commons Configuration.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                    </comments>
                    <attachments>
                    </attachments>

<item>
            <title>[CONFIGURATION-547] Handling of backslashes</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CONFIGURATION-547</link>
                <project id="12310467" key="CONFIGURATION">Commons Configuration</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;Consider the following Unit Test:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;    @Test
    &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; void properlyProcessesBackslash() &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;throws&lt;/span&gt; Exception
    {
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt; key = &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;key&quot;&lt;/span&gt;;
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt; value = &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;\\\\&quot;&lt;/span&gt;;

        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; XMLConfiguration xmlConfig = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; XMLConfiguration();
        xmlConfig.addProperty(key, value);
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; StringWriter stringWriter = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; StringWriter();
        xmlConfig.save(stringWriter);

        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt; xml = stringWriter.toString();

        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; XMLConfiguration roundTrippedXmlConfig = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; XMLConfiguration();
        roundTrippedXmlConfig.load(&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; StringReader(xml));

        assertEquals(xmlConfig.getString(key), roundTrippedXmlConfig.getString(key));
    }
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The test case fails and I think it shouldn&apos;t. The version that introduced this behaviour was 1.7, 1.6 works fine.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="12653711">CONFIGURATION-547</key>
            <summary>Handling of backslashes</summary>

<item>
            <title>[CONFIGURATION-546] ClassCastException in BeanHelper constructing beans with a list of child beans</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CONFIGURATION-546</link>
                <project id="12310467" key="CONFIGURATION">Commons Configuration</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;If you wish to create a bean that has a collection as a property where that collection contains multiple beans, the code crashes as it assumes that you can only ever have single bean declarations as children. &lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;For example the following brief construct is not possible to build&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;class A {&lt;br/&gt;
   String name;&lt;br/&gt;
}&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;class B {&lt;br/&gt;
   List&amp;lt;A&amp;gt; children;&lt;br/&gt;
}&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The result is the following stack trace &lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Caused by: java.lang.ClassCastException: java.util.ArrayList cannot be cast to org.apache.commons.configuration.beanutils.BeanDeclaration&lt;br/&gt;
	at org.apache.commons.configuration.beanutils.BeanHelper.initBean(BeanHelper.java:212)&lt;br/&gt;
	at org.apache.commons.configuration.beanutils.TestBeanHelper$TestBeanFactory.createBean(TestBeanHelper.java:579)&lt;br/&gt;
	at org.apache.commons.configuration.beanutils.BeanHelper.createBean(BeanHelper.java:342)&lt;br/&gt;
	... 33 more&lt;/p&gt;


&lt;p&gt;It&apos;s pretty easy to see why when you look at the code beginning line 208:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;  for (Map.Entry&amp;lt;String, Object&amp;gt; e : nestedBeans.entrySet())&lt;/p&gt;
  {
     String propName = e.getKey();
     Class&amp;lt;?&amp;gt; defaultClass = getDefaultClass(bean, propName);
     initProperty(bean, propName, createBean(
 	   (BeanDeclaration) e.getValue(), defaultClass));
  }

&lt;p&gt;Note the silly assumption that e.getValue() only ever has BeanDeclaration instances, where it could be BeanDeclaration[], or Collection&amp;lt;BeanDeclaration&amp;gt; as other possible options - which is what the above example show. &lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Extended version of the existing unit test to follow that illustrates the problem.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="12651923">CONFIGURATION-546</key>
            <summary>ClassCastException in BeanHelper constructing beans with a list of child beans</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="4" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/minor.svg">Minor</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="justinc">Justin Couch</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Sun, 9 Jun 2013 12:02:54 +0000</created>
                <updated>Mon, 28 Oct 2013 06:54:36 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Wed, 12 Jun 2013 20:12:58 +0000</resolved>
                                    <version>1.8</version>
                    <version>1.9</version>
                                    <fixVersion>2.0</fixVersion>
                    <fixVersion>1.10</fixVersion>
                                    <component>Type conversion</component>
                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>2</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="13679019" author="justinc" created="Sun, 9 Jun 2013 12:05:20 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Updated unit test and new bean showing the crash. &lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="13679306" author="justinc" created="Mon, 10 Jun 2013 04:56:13 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Tweaked test and example implementation that passes the tests. &lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="13679801" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Mon, 10 Jun 2013 19:32:06 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Thank you for this contribution!&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Is there any chance you can provide the new functionality as patches (see &lt;a href=&quot;http://commons.apache.org/patches.html)?&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;http://commons.apache.org/patches.html)?&lt;/a&gt; This makes it easier to detect the actual changes.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="13680064" author="justinc" created="Tue, 11 Jun 2013 00:00:31 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Patch versions of the changes. &lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="13680098" author="justinc" created="Tue, 11 Jun 2013 00:31:49 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;BTW, the reason I didn&apos;t do patches before is that the links from the commons web pages are all wrong and had problems trying to find the correct page with required details. They all use /proper/foo.html rather than /foo.html. Probably because the original sources are relative URL paths rather than absolutes so that it ignores the subproject details. &lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="13680626" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Tue, 11 Jun 2013 20:22:57 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;I had a look at your patch, and it is really good.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;There is one thing I do not understand: How is the BeanDeclaration created in a way that it contains a collection of other BeanDeclarations as a property value? Do you create such declarations manually for your use case?&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I mean, typically a concrete implementation class like &lt;tt&gt;XMLBeanDeclaration&lt;/tt&gt; is used and initialized from a configuration. (This was the original intension of this whole subcomponent: to define service beans in configuration files.) The class extracts the information about the bean to be created and its properties from the passed in configuration object. But there is so far no support for list properties. So in order to make this new feature really usable, we would probably also have to extend &lt;tt&gt;XMLBeanDeclaration&lt;/tt&gt; to process declarations of list properties.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;WDYT?&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="13680797" author="justinc" created="Tue, 11 Jun 2013 23:12:19 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;In my case I have an external processor that loads configurations into my own implementation of BeanDeclaration (one example has the original definitions are coming from database information, not a text file) that is then used to build the appropriate beans. &lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;A simpler example is something like this (hope Jira doesn&apos;t mess the formatting &lt;img class=&quot;emoticon&quot; src=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/emoticons/smile.png&quot; height=&quot;16&quot; width=&quot;16&quot; align=&quot;absmiddle&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; border=&quot;0&quot;/&gt; ):&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;ThermalModel&amp;gt;
  &amp;lt;TemperaturePoints&amp;gt;
    &amp;lt;FahrenheitPoint id=&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;123&quot;&lt;/span&gt; type=&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;read&quot;&lt;/span&gt;/&amp;gt;
    &amp;lt;CelsiusPoint id=&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;abc&quot;&lt;/span&gt; type=&quot;read/&amp;gt;
  &amp;lt;/TemperaturePoints&amp;gt;
&amp;lt;/ThermalModel&amp;gt;
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The ThermalModel has a property that are a list of points that it may read from to do some averaging of them, for example without actually caring what the concrete class is. We use the Bean helper to take this configuration and load the implementations. When not driven by the database, we use domain-specific XML or JSON definitions for the beans so that end users that are not software developers can build system configurations. As such, we don&apos;t have any interest in the rest of the framework around bean declarations etc.  I could probably have a look into adding the capabilities, but that&apos;s going to be a bit in my spare time &lt;img class=&quot;emoticon&quot; src=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/emoticons/smile.png&quot; height=&quot;16&quot; width=&quot;16&quot; align=&quot;absmiddle&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; border=&quot;0&quot;/&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="13681579" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Wed, 12 Jun 2013 20:12:58 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;The patch was committed with minor changes in revision 1492404.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;It would be great if you can work on additional list property support for XML-based bean declarations. This would enable the new feature for the typical Configuration user.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I am marking this ticket as resolved. Further work in this area can be assigned to a new one. Thanks again.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                    </comments>

<item>
            <title>[CONFIGURATION-545] if attribute value contains , (comma), it returns arrayList instead of string</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CONFIGURATION-545</link>
                <project id="12310467" key="CONFIGURATION">Commons Configuration</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;Hi &lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I&apos;ve an xml element with an attribute &apos;name&apos;, it&apos;s value contains comma. If I access this attribute it is returning List instead of String. Can you guys fix it?&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;Method:
txnConfig.getProperty(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;stream(1)[@name]&quot;&lt;/span&gt;)

&amp;lt;someRoot&amp;gt;
&amp;lt;stream
      name=&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;some Release REL12973,CC#239487&quot;&lt;/span&gt;
      type=&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;snapshot&quot;&lt;/span&gt;
      time=&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;1342793128&quot;&lt;/span&gt;
      startTime=&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;1342793128&quot;&lt;/span&gt;/&amp;gt;

&amp;lt;someRoot&amp;gt;
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</description>

            <title>[CONFIGURATION-544] Missing dependencies in build.xml</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CONFIGURATION-544</link>
                <project id="12310467" key="CONFIGURATION">Commons Configuration</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;If I run &quot;ant jar&quot;, the dependencies commons.lang3 and the two libraries required by easymock cannot be found. Attached a patch for build.xml adding these libraries.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="12646090">CONFIGURATION-544</key>
            <summary>Missing dependencies in build.xml</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>

<item>
            <title>[CONFIGURATION-540] SystemConfiguration copies System.getProperties() instead of directly using it since 1.8</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CONFIGURATION-540</link>
                <project id="12310467" key="CONFIGURATION">Commons Configuration</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;In commons-configuration-1.7 the SystemConfiguration directly used the Map of System.getProperties(). Thus when changing the properties inside the SystemConfiguration, the changes were visible in the Map of System.getProperties().&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Since commons-configuration-1.8 the SystemConfiguration creates a new Map as a copy of System.getProperties() and thus changes in the SystemConfiguration Map are not visible in the System.getProperties() Map.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;In 1.7 this super constructor is used by SystemProperties:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; MapConfiguration(Map map) {
    &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;this&lt;/span&gt;.map = map;
}
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;In 1.9 this super constructor is used by SystemProperties:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; MapConfiguration(Properties props) {
    map = convertPropertiesToMap(props);
}
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;A fix could look like this:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; SystemConfiguration() {
    &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;super&lt;/span&gt;((Map)&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;System&lt;/span&gt;.getProperties());
}
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;This breaks the functionality I expected to be able to use SystemConfiguration as a replacement API for accessing and manipulating SystemProperties. For me this is a regression.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;My workaround is currently not to use:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; SystemConfiguration();
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;but instead use:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; MapConfiguration((Map) &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;System&lt;/span&gt;.getProperties());
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="12642013">CONFIGURATION-540</key>
            <summary>SystemConfiguration copies System.getProperties() instead of directly using it since 1.8</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="2" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/critical.svg">Critical</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="subes">subes</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Thu, 11 Apr 2013 10:43:44 +0000</created>
                <updated>Thu, 24 Mar 2016 20:20:58 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Sat, 13 Apr 2013 14:46:37 +0000</resolved>
                                    <version>1.8</version>
                    <version>1.9</version>
                                    <fixVersion>2.0</fixVersion>
                                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>2</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="13631065" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Sat, 13 Apr 2013 14:46:37 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;&lt;tt&gt;MapConfiguration&lt;/tt&gt; now directly uses the passed in &lt;tt&gt;Properties&lt;/tt&gt; object as its data store. Thus, changes on a property done by &lt;tt&gt;SystemConfiguration&lt;/tt&gt; directly affect the corresponding system properties.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Fixed in subversion in revision 1467644. Thanks for the report.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                    </comments>
