<item>
            <title>[CONFIGURATION-538] Saving PropertiesConfiguration using UTF-8 encoding doesn&apos;t work</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CONFIGURATION-538</link>
                <project id="12310467" key="CONFIGURATION">Commons Configuration</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;I created JUnit test &lt;a href=&quot;http://goo.gl/GCwi2&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;http://goo.gl/GCwi2&lt;/a&gt;, that uses two methods to save PropertiesConfiguration (with property value containing utf-8 characters) into file:&lt;br/&gt;
1) propsConf.save(file); // propsConf.setEncoding(&quot;UTF-8&quot;) was called before&lt;br/&gt;
and&lt;br/&gt;
2) propsConf.save(fileOutputStream, &quot;UTF-8&quot;);&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Test shows that file doesn&apos;t contain UTF-8 characters. Instead saved file contains unicode escapes of non ISO-8859-1 characters.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;This seems wrong, as documentation on setEncoding() method says:&lt;br/&gt;
&quot;Set the encoding used to store the configuration file&quot;.&lt;br/&gt;
PropertiesConfiguration.setEncoding() method currently seems to affect only loading the configuration.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I added one test method that shows that even java.util.Properties class saves the same property value without any problems using utf-8 characters (not unicode escapes that it ) when using smth like that:&lt;br/&gt;
props.store(new OutputStreamWriter(fos, &quot;UTF-8&quot;));&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;It looks like a bug to me, or did i misunderstood smth?&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment>&lt;p&gt;shouldn&apos;t be important, but 64bit Windows 7&lt;/p&gt;</environment>
        <key id="12639994">CONFIGURATION-538</key>
            <summary>Saving PropertiesConfiguration using UTF-8 encoding doesn&apos;t work</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/open.png" description="The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.">Open</status>
                    <statusCategory id="2" key="new" colorName="blue-gray"/>
                                    <resolution id="-1">Unresolved</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="atsu85">Ats</reporter>
                        <labels>
                            <label>PropertiesConfiguration,</label>
                            <label>charset</label>
                            <label>encoding,</label>
                            <label>save</label>
                    </labels>
                <created>Sun, 31 Mar 2013 17:34:56 +0000</created>
                <updated>Fri, 4 Jan 2019 13:55:27 +0000</updated>
                                            <version>1.9</version>
                                                        <due></due>
                            <votes>3</votes>
                                    <watches>6</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="13618445" author="atsu85" created="Sun, 31 Mar 2013 19:27:13 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;If private methods of org.apache.commons.configuration.PropertiesConfiguration.PropertiesWriter would be changed to protected, then it would be easier to plug in custom PropertiesWriter(that wouldn&apos;t escape non ISO-8859-1 characters) via &lt;br/&gt;
propsConf.setIOFactory()&lt;br/&gt;
without reinventing the wheel (copying too much existing code from existing classes).&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="13621019" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Wed, 3 Apr 2013 16:14:34 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Thanks for this report.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CONFIGURATION-515&quot; title=&quot;Make private methods in PropertiesConfiguration.PropertiesWriter protected&quot; class=&quot;issue-link&quot; data-issue-key=&quot;CONFIGURATION-515&quot;&gt;&lt;del&gt;CONFIGURATION-515&lt;/del&gt;&lt;/a&gt; is about making methods of &lt;tt&gt;PropertiesWriter&lt;/tt&gt; protected, and this will be done for the next release. So there should be a work-around then.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;So if I understand correctly, the problem currently is that an escaping is manually performed when saving properties which is not necessarily compatible with the specified encoding, right?&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="13624462" author="atsu85" created="Sat, 6 Apr 2013 17:38:50 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Nice, that workaround for this issue can be done with less effort.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&amp;gt; So if I understand correctly, the problem currently is that an escaping is manually performed when saving properties which is not necessarily compatible with the specified encoding, right?&lt;br/&gt;
I wouldn&apos;t phrase it exactly this way. Instead of &quot;escaping is manually performed&quot; i&apos;d say that escaping is automatically performed even for UTF-8 characters that can be expressed without escaping. I would say that this is unexpected behavior as if you store java.util.Properties to file like that:&lt;br/&gt;
      fos = new FileOutputStream(tmpPropsFile);&lt;br/&gt;
      w = new OutputStreamWriter(fos, &quot;UTF-8&quot;);&lt;br/&gt;
      properties.store(w, null);&lt;br/&gt;
then such escaping is not done. &lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I would expect that PropertiesConfiguration would behave similarly in following scenario:&lt;br/&gt;
    PropertiesConfiguration c = new PropertiesConfiguration();&lt;br/&gt;
    c.setProperty(&quot;testKey&quot;, &quot;example UTF-8 chars are &#353; &#245; &#228; &#246; &#252; &#382;&quot;);&lt;br/&gt;
    c.setEncoding(&quot;UTF-8&quot;);&lt;br/&gt;
    c.save(tmpPropsFile);&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;and/or in following scenario:&lt;br/&gt;
      fos = new FileOutputStream(tmpPropsFile);&lt;br/&gt;
      c.save(fos, &quot;UTF-8&quot;);&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="13625758" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Mon, 8 Apr 2013 20:17:49 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;In its &lt;tt&gt;escapeValue()&lt;/tt&gt; method &lt;tt&gt;PropertiesConfiguration.PropertiesWriter&lt;/tt&gt; performs an escaping of a configuration property before it gets written to file. The method used to call &lt;tt&gt;StringEscapeUtils.escapeJava()&lt;/tt&gt; from Commons Lang. For &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CONFIGURATION-516&quot; title=&quot;PropertiesConfiguration.save escapes double qoutes &amp;quot; unecessary&quot; class=&quot;issue-link&quot; data-issue-key=&quot;CONFIGURATION-516&quot;&gt;&lt;del&gt;CONFIGURATION-516&lt;/del&gt;&lt;/a&gt; this was changed to use a custom CharSequenceTranslator which is derived from the one used by &lt;tt&gt;StringEscapeUtils&lt;/tt&gt;, but has restricted encoding rules. (This is the current state in subversion.)&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Obviously, it still performs too much encoding, it especially incorporates a &lt;tt&gt;UnicodeEscaper.outsideOf(32, 0x7f)&lt;/tt&gt; rule. It should be possible to tweak the configuration of the CharSequenceTranslator used for this encoding, but I don&apos;t know which rules are actually necessary. Could this &lt;tt&gt;UnicodeEscaper&lt;/tt&gt; declaration be skipped completely?&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16734146" author="shahriar.robbani" created="Fri, 4 Jan 2019 13:55:27 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Maybe&#160;UnicodeEscaper.outsideOf(00, 0xff)?&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                    </comments>

<item>
            <title>[CONFIGURATION-534] PropertyConfiguration&apos;s handling of includes depends on the existence of a base path</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CONFIGURATION-534</link>
                <project id="12310467" key="CONFIGURATION">Commons Configuration</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;&lt;tt&gt;PropertiesConfiguration&lt;/tt&gt; has a property which controls whether include files are allowed. This property does not have a set method, it is set to &lt;b&gt;true&lt;/b&gt; automatically if a base path is set. There may be scenarios in which it makes sense to support include files anyway, e.g. if they are specified as fully qualified file names or URIs or can be retrieved by the standard lookup mechanism.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;So the set method should be public, and it makes sense to set this property to &lt;b&gt;true&lt;/b&gt; per default. If a file contains an &lt;em&gt;include&lt;/em&gt; property, the files it refers to should propably be loaded.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Also the get method for the property which controls file inclusion does not conform to the Java Beans specification; returning a &lt;b&gt;boolean&lt;/b&gt;, it should start with the prefix &lt;em&gt;is&lt;/em&gt;.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="12637400">CONFIGURATION-534</key>
            <summary>PropertyConfiguration&apos;s handling of includes depends on the existence of a base path</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="oheger">Oliver Heger</reporter>

                                    <version>1.9</version>

                    <fixVersion>1.10</fixVersion>

<item>
            <title>[CONFIGURATION-530] AbstractFileConfiguration.getProperty(String key) locking causes thread halt</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CONFIGURATION-530</link>
                <project id="12310467" key="CONFIGURATION">Commons Configuration</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;Every call to getProperty causes a lock (related to the reload functionality). In a near real-time system where we have many concurrent threads this affects heavily on the application TPS. &lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Possible solution will be: getProperty only returns current value. Reload when needed occurs in a background thread that updates the in-memory map (perhaps by using CopyOnWrite collections?).&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="12636235">CONFIGURATION-530</key>
            <summary>AbstractFileConfiguration.getProperty(String key) locking causes thread halt</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="2" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/critical.svg">Critical</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="yairogen">yair ogen</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Sun, 10 Mar 2013 12:54:43 +0000</created>
                <updated>Thu, 24 Mar 2016 20:20:49 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Mon, 3 Jun 2013 20:36:32 +0000</resolved>
                                    <version>1.9</version>
                                    <fixVersion>2.0</fixVersion>
                                    <component>File reloading</component>
                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>2</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="13601626" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Wed, 13 Mar 2013 20:57:15 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Currently, work on a redesigned version 2.0 is going on. This also includes reworking file-based configurations and improved support for concurrent access. There is already code in subversion showing the direction I would like to go. The basic ideas are as follows:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;ul&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;Configurations are now created by builder objects.&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;Reloading is moved from configurations to builders. This means, the content of a configuration will not change due to a reload while you work with it. Only if you query the builder again, it might return another configuration instance if a reload was performed in the meantime. So there is no need to synchronize because of possible reloads.&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;It is planed to rework the concept of concurrent access to configuration objects. The idea is to use a similar concept as for Java collection classes: Plain configurations are not thread-safe, but it should be possible to create synchronized configurations if required.&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;/ul&gt;
</comment>
                            <comment id="13604545" author="yairogen" created="Sun, 17 Mar 2013 08:32:33 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;I see. will version 2 be backward compatible? If not - are there any plans on fixing the concurrent access on the 1.x branch?&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="13604703" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Sun, 17 Mar 2013 18:16:24 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Version 2 will not be backwards compatible, there are some major design changes.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;AFAICT, there is currently no interest in working on the 1.x branch. Also, I am not sure whether the problems related to relading can be changed with reasonable effort and without breaking existing applications.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="13604913" author="yairogen" created="Mon, 18 Mar 2013 07:02:01 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;I understand. When is the planned 2.x release?&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="13605611" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Mon, 18 Mar 2013 20:48:07 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;There is still a lot to do before version 2.0 is ready. There is no planned release date yet (here in Commons we do not have fix release schedules).&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="13673524" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Mon, 3 Jun 2013 20:36:32 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;The anounced changes have now been implemented. A so-called &lt;tt&gt;Synchronizer&lt;/tt&gt; is now used to control concurrent access to a configuration. While the default synchronizer is just a dummy, applications can change it according to their use cases. There is also an implementation of &lt;tt&gt;Synchronizer&lt;/tt&gt; based on the JDK&apos;s &lt;tt&gt;ReentrantReadWriteLock&lt;/tt&gt; class.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="13674129" author="yairogen" created="Tue, 4 Jun 2013 07:16:59 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;great news. when is this release planned?&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="13675152" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Tue, 4 Jun 2013 19:44:35 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Unfortunately, there is not yet a concrete release schedule. There are still some important points open which need to be fixed before a release.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Because of all these incompatible changes (parts of the API have been completely redesigned) it certainly makes sense to get out some alpha or beta releases first to get feedback from the community.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                    </comments>

<item>
            <title>[CONFIGURATION-529] XML_PROVIDER figures twice in ConfigurationProvider[] array within DefaultConfigurationBuilder</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CONFIGURATION-529</link>
                <project id="12310467" key="CONFIGURATION">Commons Configuration</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;Source code excerpt: &lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt; /** An array with the providers for the default tags. */&lt;br/&gt;
    private static final ConfigurationProvider[] DEFAULT_PROVIDERS = &lt;/p&gt;
{
            PROPERTIES_PROVIDER, XML_PROVIDER, XML_PROVIDER, JNDI_PROVIDER,
            SYSTEM_PROVIDER, PLIST_PROVIDER, BUILDER_PROVIDER, INI_PROVIDER,
            ENV_PROVIDER
    }
&lt;p&gt;;&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="12635599">CONFIGURATION-529</key>
            <summary>XML_PROVIDER figures twice in ConfigurationProvider[] array within DefaultConfigurationBuilder</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="6">Invalid</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="quintilian">Jan van Oort</reporter>
                        <labels>
                            <label>features</label>
                    </labels>
                <created>Wed, 6 Mar 2013 16:06:26 +0000</created>
                <updated>Thu, 24 Mar 2016 20:20:43 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Wed, 6 Mar 2013 20:50:28 +0000</resolved>
                                    <version>1.9</version>
                                    <fixVersion>2.0</fixVersion>
                    <fixVersion>2.x</fixVersion>
                                    <component>Build</component>
                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>2</watches>
                                    <timeoriginalestimate seconds="3600">1h</timeoriginalestimate>
                            <timeestimate seconds="3600">1h</timeestimate>
                                        <comments>
                            <comment id="13594823" author="quintilian" created="Wed, 6 Mar 2013 16:09:46 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;This is silly. I am going to extend DefaultConfigurationBuilder for my own purposes, and discovered this while reading through the source code. Don&apos;t know yet what I will do - copy/paste existing source code minus the bug into my own mod_DCB, or correct the bug in Commons Configuration Build, compile and carry on. &lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="13595095" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Wed, 6 Mar 2013 20:50:28 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;This is actually done by intension: XML provider is registered twice for two different tag names, &lt;tt&gt;xml&lt;/tt&gt; and &lt;tt&gt;hierarchicalXml&lt;/tt&gt;. This is done for maintaining backwards compatibility with the older &lt;tt&gt;ConfigurationFactory&lt;/tt&gt; class which originally used the latter tag name.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="13595716" author="quintilian" created="Thu, 7 Mar 2013 09:30:43 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Huh ? Maintaining backward compatibility with a deprecated artifact ? The only difference between ConfigurationFactory and DefaultConfigurationBuilder is the use of elements from the org.apache.commons.digester package, as far as I can see. If you port that - fairly isolated - functionality toward DefaultConfigurationBuilder, you could abandon ConfigurationFactory altogether, couldn&apos;t you ? &lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="13596335" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Thu, 7 Mar 2013 20:37:51 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;It&apos;s about maintaining backwards compatibility with the configuration format. The intension was - and is - that &lt;tt&gt;DefaultConfigurationBuilder&lt;/tt&gt; can read the same configuration files as &lt;tt&gt;ConfigurationFactory&lt;/tt&gt;. And after both tags for XML configuration sources have been supported for many years now, I would not dare to remove one of them now.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                    </comments>

                    </attachments>
                <subtasks>
                    </subtasks>

<item>
            <title>[CONFIGURATION-528] ConfigurationInterpolator class does not load if security manager enabled</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CONFIGURATION-528</link>
                <project id="12310467" key="CONFIGURATION">Commons Configuration</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;ConfigurationInterpolator class does not load if security manager is enabled because its static initializer instantiate EnvironmentLookup which instantiate EnvironmentConfiguration which use System.getenv()in its constructor. But System.getenv() can fail if RuntimePermission(&quot;getenv.*&quot;) is not granted.&lt;br/&gt;
Notice this &quot;bug&quot; is annoying to catch because a NoClassDefFoundError is thrown when classloading ConfigurationInterpolator without the good AccessControlException showing the real source of the problem.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="12635033">CONFIGURATION-528</key>
            <summary>ConfigurationInterpolator class does not load if security manager enabled</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="4" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/minor.svg">Minor</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="sauvage">Laurent Sauvage</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Sun, 3 Mar 2013 18:54:42 +0000</created>
                <updated>Wed, 6 Mar 2013 14:32:49 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Wed, 6 Mar 2013 14:32:49 +0000</resolved>
                                    <version>1.9</version>
                                    <fixVersion>2.0</fixVersion>
                                    <component>Interpolation</component>
                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>2</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="13592617" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Mon, 4 Mar 2013 20:50:27 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;We are currently working on version 2.0 of Commons Configuration, and there have been some major changes, also in the area of interpolation. The problem you describe is probably solved in the meantime.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&lt;tt&gt;ConfigurationInterpolator&lt;/tt&gt; still instantiates default lookups in a static block. However, &lt;tt&gt;EnvironmentLookup&lt;/tt&gt; no longer uses &lt;tt&gt;EnvironmentConfiguration&lt;/tt&gt;; rather it queries the environment in its &lt;tt&gt;lookup()&lt;/tt&gt; method. So the security manager should only complain if environment variables are acutally used for interpolation.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Is this solution okay for you or do you have another proposal?&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="13594740" author="sauvage" created="Wed, 6 Mar 2013 14:32:49 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Perfect. Thanks.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                    </comments>
                    <attachments>
                    </attachments>

                    </subtasks>

            <title>[CONFIGURATION-525] PropertiesConfigurationLayout does not preserve comments at bottom of a file</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CONFIGURATION-525</link>
                <project id="12310467" key="CONFIGURATION">Commons Configuration</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;Example:&lt;br/&gt;
helloWorld.properties&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;hello = world&lt;br/&gt;
#this comments would not be preserved&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="12632446">CONFIGURATION-525</key>
            <summary>PropertiesConfigurationLayout does not preserve comments at bottom of a file</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="4" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/minor.svg">Minor</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>

                        <labels>

                <created>Thu, 14 Feb 2013 19:35:14 +0000</created>

                                        <comments>
                            <comment id="13578655" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Thu, 14 Feb 2013 20:42:17 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Thanks for the report.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The current implementation assigns a comment to the following property. This explains why a comment at the bottom of the file gets lost. We will have to think about a workaround.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="13604330" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Sat, 16 Mar 2013 17:54:43 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Fixed in revision 1457278.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&lt;tt&gt;PropertiesConfiguration&lt;/tt&gt; now reads a comment at the end of a configuration file and makes it available through the new &lt;tt&gt;getFooter()&lt;/tt&gt; method. With &lt;tt&gt;setFooter()&lt;/tt&gt; the end comment can be changed.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>

<item>
            <title>[CONFIGURATION-524] AbstractConfiguration does not interpolate correctly after cloning</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CONFIGURATION-524</link>
                <project id="12310467" key="CONFIGURATION">Commons Configuration</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;If you clone a Configuration, does not clone the StrSubstitutor when it has been instanced, so the cloned copy has the same StrSubstituor than the original composite. If you change a property in the original compoiste it is changed in the cloned copy.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Way to reproduce it :&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;class &lt;/span&gt;SampleConfiguration {
    &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;static&lt;/span&gt; void main(&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt;[] args) {
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt; sentence = &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;SELECT * FORM TABLE WHERE YEAR=${year} and QUARTER=${quarter}&quot;&lt;/span&gt;;
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; CompositeConfiguration cp = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; CompositeConfiguration();
        cp.addProperty(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;year&quot;&lt;/span&gt;, &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;2000&quot;&lt;/span&gt;);
        cp.addProperty(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;quarter&quot;&lt;/span&gt;, &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;2&quot;&lt;/span&gt;);

        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; AbstractConfiguration clonedConfig = (AbstractConfiguration) ConfigurationUtils.cloneConfiguration(cp);

        cp.setProperty(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;year&quot;&lt;/span&gt;, &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;2001&quot;&lt;/span&gt;);
        clonedConfig.setProperty(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;year&quot;&lt;/span&gt;, &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;2002&quot;&lt;/span&gt;);

        &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;System&lt;/span&gt;.out.println(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;Original sentence &quot;&lt;/span&gt; + PropertyConverter.interpolate(sentence, cp));
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;System&lt;/span&gt;.out.println(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;Cloned sentence &quot;&lt;/span&gt; + PropertyConverter.interpolate(sentence, clonedConfig));

        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; AbstractConfiguration clonedConfig2 = (AbstractConfiguration) ConfigurationUtils.cloneConfiguration(cp);

        cp.setProperty(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;year&quot;&lt;/span&gt;, &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;2003&quot;&lt;/span&gt;);
        clonedConfig2.setProperty(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;year&quot;&lt;/span&gt;, &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;2004&quot;&lt;/span&gt;);

        &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;System&lt;/span&gt;.out.println(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;Original sentence &quot;&lt;/span&gt; + PropertyConverter.interpolate(sentence, cp));
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;System&lt;/span&gt;.out.println(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;Cloned (after interpolate with same strSubstitutor )sentence &quot;&lt;/span&gt;
                + PropertyConverter.interpolate(sentence, clonedConfig2));
    }
}  
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The solution can be to make in the following ways:&lt;br/&gt;
Make the clone of the strSubstitutor in the AbstractConfigutration class.&lt;br/&gt;
Create a clone method inside the StrSubtitutor  and invoke it from the AbstractConfiguration class.&lt;br/&gt;
Set null the strSubstituror when the clone method is invoked in the Abstract Configuration class. The next invocation to interpolate methos instances the strSubstitutor.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="12630369">CONFIGURATION-524</key>
            <summary>AbstractConfiguration does not interpolate correctly after cloning</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="oheger">Oliver Heger</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="diego7427">Juan Diego Gago Perez</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Fri, 1 Feb 2013 13:00:21 +0000</created>
                <updated>Thu, 24 Mar 2016 20:20:51 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Fri, 12 Apr 2013 20:30:09 +0000</resolved>
                                                    <fixVersion>2.0</fixVersion>
                                    <component>Build</component>
                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>2</watches>
                                    <timeoriginalestimate seconds="86400">24h</timeoriginalestimate>
                            <timeestimate seconds="86400">24h</timeestimate>
                                        <comments>
                            <comment id="13569612" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Sat, 2 Feb 2013 18:28:47 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Thank you for the report.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;There have been some changes recently in the current development version in the field of interpolation. However, I am pretty sure that the problem still exists.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="13630590" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Fri, 12 Apr 2013 20:30:09 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Fixed in subversion in revision 1467449.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The &lt;tt&gt;ConfigurationInterpolator&lt;/tt&gt; is now cloned, too, by all implementations of the &lt;tt&gt;clone()&lt;/tt&gt; method. The following &lt;tt&gt;clone()&lt;/tt&gt; implementations had to be adapted:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;ul&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;BaseConfiguration&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;BaseHierarchicalConfiguration&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;CompositeConfiguration&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;MapConfiguration&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;/ul&gt;


&lt;p&gt;I hope I did not forget one.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>

<item>
            <title>[CONFIGURATION-523] DefaultConfigurationBuilder is not reloading its base file</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CONFIGURATION-523</link>
                <project id="12310467" key="CONFIGURATION">Commons Configuration</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;Create a DefaultConfigurationBuilder with this example file master-config.xml :&lt;br/&gt;
&amp;lt;?xml version=&quot;1.0&quot; encoding=&quot;UTF-8&quot; ?&amp;gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&amp;lt;configuration&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
	&amp;lt;header&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
		&amp;lt;result forceReloadCheck=&quot;true&quot;/&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
	&amp;lt;/header&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
	&amp;lt;system/&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
	&amp;lt;override&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
		&amp;lt;properties fileName=&quot;webapp-commons.properties&quot;  throwExceptionOnMissing=&quot;true&quot;&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
			&amp;lt;reloadingStrategy refreshDelay=&quot;1000&quot; config-class=&quot;org.apache.commons.configuration.reloading.FileChangedReloadingStrategy&quot;/&amp;gt;		&lt;br/&gt;
		&amp;lt;/properties&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
	&amp;lt;/override&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
&amp;lt;/configuration&amp;gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;A modification to &quot;webapp-commons.properties&quot; is well detected and the file is reloaded.&lt;br/&gt;
But if you modify the master-config.xml itself, nothing is reloaded, no event are thrown.&lt;/p&gt;
</description>
                <environment>&lt;p&gt;Windows / Eclipse&lt;/p&gt;</environment>
        <key id="12628454">CONFIGURATION-523</key>
            <summary>DefaultConfigurationBuilder is not reloading its base file</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="2" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/critical.svg">Critical</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="jmcollin92">Jean-Marc</reporter>
                        <labels>
                            <label>DefaultConfigurationBuilder</label>
                            <label>reloading</label>
                    </labels>
                <created>Sun, 20 Jan 2013 09:45:37 +0000</created>
                <updated>Thu, 24 Mar 2016 20:20:56 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Thu, 11 Apr 2013 20:17:39 +0000</resolved>
                                    <version>1.9</version>
                                    <fixVersion>2.0</fixVersion>
                                    <component>File reloading</component>
                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>2</watches>
                                    <timeoriginalestimate seconds="7200">2h</timeoriginalestimate>
                            <timeestimate seconds="7200">2h</timeestimate>
                                        <comments>
                            <comment id="13558293" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Sun, 20 Jan 2013 16:12:00 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;The reloading strategy declared in &lt;tt&gt;master-config.xml&lt;/tt&gt; is associated with the specific child configuration only.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;In order to enable reloading for &lt;tt&gt;DefaultConfigurationBuilder&lt;/tt&gt; itself, you have to set a reloading strategy at the builder object, e.g.:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;DefaultConfigurationBuilder builder = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; DefaultConfigurationBuilder();
builder.setFile(masterConfigFile);
builder.setReloadingStrategy(&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; FileChangedReloadingStrategy());
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="13558457" author="jmcollin92" created="Mon, 21 Jan 2013 00:23:22 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Thank&apos;s for your answer. I still try your solution but without success. This don&apos;t work (and I can&apos;t figure why).&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="13559105" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Mon, 21 Jan 2013 21:13:38 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Hm, it seems that the support for reloading the definition file of a &lt;tt&gt;DefaultConfigurationBuilder&lt;/tt&gt; is quite limited. The problem is that a reload check is only performed when a property of a configuration is accessed. But this is typically not the case for a &lt;tt&gt;DefaultConfigurationBuilder&lt;/tt&gt; after it has created its result configuration.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;A workaround may be to query a synthetic property on the builder to manually trigger a reload check. But then you also have to find out whether a reload actually happened and - if so - query the builder for a new configuration.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;That said, there is currently work going on for a version 2.0 of Configuration, and one area which is to be improved is reloading support (see also &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CONFIGURATION-520&quot; title=&quot;Rework reloading mechanisms&quot; class=&quot;issue-link&quot; data-issue-key=&quot;CONFIGURATION-520&quot;&gt;&lt;del&gt;CONFIGURATION-520&lt;/del&gt;&lt;/a&gt;). There is already some code in SVN which allows for periodic, timer-based reload checks. It will also work for a &lt;tt&gt;CombinedConfigurationBuilder&lt;/tt&gt; (which is the replacement for &lt;tt&gt;DefaultConfigurationBuilder&lt;/tt&gt; in 2.0). However, unfortunately, this is all work in progress and still in an early stage.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="13559438" author="jmcollin92" created="Tue, 22 Jan 2013 06:58:29 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;OK. Thank&apos;s for your answer. I will wait the 2.0 and &quot;manually&quot; reload periodically.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="13629305" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Thu, 11 Apr 2013 20:17:39 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;In version 2.0, builders for creating configurations have been significantly reworked. The replacement of &lt;tt&gt;DefaultConfigurationBuilder&lt;/tt&gt; - in this case &lt;tt&gt;ReloadingCombinedConfigurationBuilder&lt;/tt&gt; - is capable of detecting changes on its definition file and can trigger reloads automatically. The test suite contains corresponding tests.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                    </comments>

<item>
            <title>[CONFIGURATION-521] fileFromUrl: decoding of encoded % character does not work</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CONFIGURATION-521</link>
                <project id="12310467" key="CONFIGURATION">Commons Configuration</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;If ConfigurationUtils.fileFromUrl(URL) should create a file from a URL containing an enoced % sign (%25), then it does not work.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I saw that the code apache.commons.io now is really different, but seems to work. Why isn&apos;t apache.commons.io directly used?&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="12628020">CONFIGURATION-521</key>
            <summary>fileFromUrl: decoding of encoded % character does not work</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="koppor">Oliver Kopp</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Thu, 17 Jan 2013 11:07:47 +0000</created>
                <updated>Thu, 24 Mar 2016 20:20:53 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Wed, 23 Jan 2013 20:50:49 +0000</resolved>
                                    <version>1.9</version>
                                    <fixVersion>2.0</fixVersion>
                                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>2</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="13556064" author="koppor" created="Thu, 17 Jan 2013 11:08:28 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;This patch fixes the described bug.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="13556582" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Thu, 17 Jan 2013 20:52:51 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Thanks for the report.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;We do not use Commons IO directly because this would mean an additional dependency just for this single method we use. The drawback is - as you have noticed - that the code has changed in the meantime.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;So rather than applying a punctual fix, should we again copy the code from IO? This is surely more mature and will handle more cases.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="13556631" author="koppor" created="Thu, 17 Jan 2013 21:43:54 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;A quick test revealed that the new IO version also works here. I&apos;ll attach a patch. It obeys the renaming from fileFromURL(URL) to toFile(URL).&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="13557620" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Fri, 18 Jan 2013 21:25:33 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Hi, many thanks for the updated patch. I think this is the way to go. Some minor comments:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;ul&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;I would rather keep the old method name. We are currently working on a major relase, and thus we could introduce changes breaking backwards compatibility, but we should do so only for a compelling reason. Staying as compatible as possible will make migration for clients smoother.&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;Would it be possible to also provide a unit test demonstrating that the original problem is fixed now?&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;Commons Configuration obviously uses a slightly different coding style than IO. Can you adapt the formatting to the style used in this project? (This is not strictly necessary, I can also do the reformat if needed.)&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;/ul&gt;
</comment>
                            <comment id="13558628" author="koppor" created="Mon, 21 Jan 2013 08:58:25 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;I created a transitional method with the old name, marked as @Deprecated. To enable track changes across projects, I did not reformat the literally copied code. I think, literally copied code should not be modified, but always kept as literal code (if possible).&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Test case added.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="13559994" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Tue, 22 Jan 2013 20:43:29 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;I understand the motivation to keep the code as close to the origin as possible so that it is easier to detect deviations in future. However, for multiple reasons I am not happy with the current state of the solution:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;ul&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;Having a single method in a class formatted differently looks strange. There is a high probability that it is reformatted later, maybe by accident.&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;Checkstyle will complain. (I am not sure whether it is possible to filter on specific methods.)&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;The method name &lt;tt&gt;toFile()&lt;/tt&gt; is not very speaking. It makes sense in the context of &lt;tt&gt;FileUtils&lt;/tt&gt; where there is a bunch of overloaded conversion methods, but for &lt;tt&gt;ConfigurationUtils&lt;/tt&gt; you don&apos;t see on a single glance what it is expected to do.&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;/ul&gt;


&lt;p&gt;How about the following compromise:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;ul&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;We create a new class &lt;tt&gt;FileUtils&lt;/tt&gt; next to &lt;tt&gt;ConfigurationUtils&lt;/tt&gt; with default visibility so that it does not become part of the public API.&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;In the Javadoc of this class it is stated that it contains code copied from Commons IO.&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;The &lt;tt&gt;toFile()&lt;/tt&gt; method is copied literally.&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;&lt;tt&gt;ConfigurationUtils&lt;/tt&gt; keeps its &lt;tt&gt;fileFromURL()&lt;/tt&gt; method, but the implementation delegates to &lt;tt&gt;FileUtils&lt;/tt&gt;.&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;In the checkstyle suppression configuration the &lt;tt&gt;FileUtils&lt;/tt&gt; class can be excluded.&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;/ul&gt;


&lt;p&gt;Does this make sense?&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="13560154" author="koppor" created="Tue, 22 Jan 2013 23:11:51 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;It does definitely make sense. I added another patch. Hope, the new checkstyle rule works.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="13561075" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Wed, 23 Jan 2013 20:50:49 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Patch applied in revision 1437723.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The checkstyle suppressions seem to work fine; class &lt;tt&gt;FileUtils&lt;/tt&gt; does not show up in the report.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Many thanks again for your work.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                    </comments>

<item>
            <title>[CONFIGURATION-516] PropertiesConfiguration.save escapes double qoutes &quot; unecessary</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CONFIGURATION-516</link>
                <project id="12310467" key="CONFIGURATION">Commons Configuration</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;Add a property with a value containing &quot; (double quote character) and saving it back to file will result in the value being modified and unecessary escaping of the quote character.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The reason is that PropertiesConfig calls into the StringEscapeUtils#escapeJavaStyleString that escapes quotes. This is not correct for propertiesfiles. &lt;a href=&quot;http://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/util/Properties.html#load(java.io.Reader&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;http://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/util/Properties.html#load(java.io.Reader&lt;/a&gt;) says &quot;Escapes are not necessary for single and double quotes&quot;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Here is a test case:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;@Test&lt;br/&gt;
public void shouldNotEscapeQuotesInTheResult() throws ConfigurationException, IOException {&lt;br/&gt;
    final String value = &quot;-Djava.io.tmpdir=\&quot;${TEST_TEMP_DIR}\&quot;&quot;;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    PropertiesConfiguration testConfig = new PropertiesConfiguration();&lt;br/&gt;
    testConfig.addProperty(&quot;testKey1&quot;, value);&lt;br/&gt;
    File testFile = new File(tempTestDir.getPath() + &quot;&lt;br class=&quot;atl-forced-newline&quot; /&gt;prop-with-quotes.properties&quot;);&lt;br/&gt;
    testConfig.save(testFile) ;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    String testFileContent = FileUtils.readFileToString(testFile);&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    Assert.assertTrue(testFileContent.contains(value));&lt;br/&gt;
}&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="12616951">CONFIGURATION-516</key>
            <summary>PropertiesConfiguration.save escapes double qoutes &quot; unecessary</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="4" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/minor.svg">Minor</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="oheger">Oliver Heger</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="jmaasing">Johan Maasing</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Tue, 20 Nov 2012 15:44:19 +0000</created>
                <updated>Thu, 24 Mar 2016 20:20:47 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Fri, 5 Apr 2013 13:12:22 +0000</resolved>
                                    <version>1.9</version>
                                    <fixVersion>2.0</fixVersion>
                                        <due></due>
                            <votes>1</votes>
                                    <watches>3</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="13501263" author="jmaasing" created="Tue, 20 Nov 2012 16:13:58 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;If &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CONFIGURATION-515&quot; title=&quot;Make private methods in PropertiesConfiguration.PropertiesWriter protected&quot; class=&quot;issue-link&quot; data-issue-key=&quot;CONFIGURATION-515&quot;&gt;&lt;del&gt;CONFIGURATION-515&lt;/del&gt;&lt;/a&gt; was implemented it would have been pretty easy to work around this (&lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CONFIGURATION-516&quot; title=&quot;PropertiesConfiguration.save escapes double qoutes &amp;quot; unecessary&quot; class=&quot;issue-link&quot; data-issue-key=&quot;CONFIGURATION-516&quot;&gt;&lt;del&gt;CONFIGURATION-516&lt;/del&gt;&lt;/a&gt;) by inheriting and post-process the value from PropertiesQriter#escapeValue.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="13502273" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Wed, 21 Nov 2012 20:18:44 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;If the escaping behavior is incorrect, we should fix it rather than only providing users a way to work around the problem. Any chance that you can submit a patch?&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="13623606" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Fri, 5 Apr 2013 13:12:22 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;The escaping logic was changed so that double quotes are no longer escaped. Fixed in subversion in revision 1464966.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="13876321" author="okal" created="Mon, 20 Jan 2014 10:32:38 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Was this issue rectified in 1.10? That doesn&apos;t seem to be the case judging from the release history.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="13876841" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Mon, 20 Jan 2014 20:37:56 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Fix version is set to 2.0, and the change report for 1.10 does not mention this issue. So it obviously did not make it into 1.10.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="13877298" author="okal" created="Tue, 21 Jan 2014 07:22:50 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Apologies, I completely missed that the fix version was 2.0. I just looked at the date the issue was created and noted that it preceded the 1.10 release.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                    </comments>
                <issuelinks>
                            <issuelinktype id="10030">
                    <name>Reference</name>
                                                                <inwardlinks description="is related to">
                                        <issuelink>
            <issuekey id="12616117">CONFIGURATION-515</issuekey>
        </issuelink>
                            </inwardlinks>
                                    </issuelinktype>
                    </issuelinks>
                <attachments>

<item>
            <title>[CONFIGURATION-511] ConfigurationUtils cannot locate classpath file when current Thread is RMI</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CONFIGURATION-511</link>
                <project id="12310467" key="CONFIGURATION">Commons Configuration</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;I noticed the problem when a registered MBean method is invoked over JMX (=RMI) and it calls ConfigurationUtils.locate(&quot;some.properties&quot;).&lt;br/&gt;
The classloader is not able to find the resource then.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;A possible fix would be to change&lt;br/&gt;
ClassLoader loader = Thread.currentThread().getContextClassLoader();&lt;br/&gt;
to&lt;br/&gt;
ClassLoader loader = ConfigurationUtils.class.getClassLoader();&lt;br/&gt;
in method locateFromClasspath. But i am not sure what other Effects that would have since I have no insight into commons-configuration.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Tested with 1.6, 1.8, 1.9.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="12612645">CONFIGURATION-511</key>
            <summary>ConfigurationUtils cannot locate classpath file when current Thread is RMI</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="lorenz">Lorenz Schumann</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Fri, 19 Oct 2012 09:49:46 +0000</created>
                <updated>Thu, 24 Mar 2016 20:20:58 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Sat, 8 Nov 2014 20:50:47 +0000</resolved>
                                    <version>1.6</version>
                    <version>1.8</version>
                    <version>1.9</version>
                                    <fixVersion>2.0</fixVersion>

                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="13480312" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Fri, 19 Oct 2012 19:46:02 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;I will have to look into the code. Maybe the class loader of &lt;tt&gt;ConfigurationUtils&lt;/tt&gt; can be used as fallback if the TCCL fails.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="13502277" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Wed, 21 Nov 2012 20:22:22 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;The whole location mechanism is currently pretty static. I would like to go for an approach where users can plug in their own specific search strategy. Actually, this is already possible using the FileSystem API. However, there is surely room for improvements to make this easier and more transparent.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="13502701" author="lorenz" created="Thu, 22 Nov 2012 10:36:47 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Although the project in which i noticed that behavior and where i wanted to improve something got cancelled in the meantime, an improvement for resource locating would be a nice thing to have &lt;img class=&quot;emoticon&quot; src=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/emoticons/smile.png&quot; height=&quot;16&quot; width=&quot;16&quot; align=&quot;absmiddle&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; border=&quot;0&quot;/&gt;&lt;br/&gt;
Thanks in advance!&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="14203592" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Sat, 8 Nov 2014 20:50:48 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;The whole mechanism for locating configuration files has been reworked and can now be customized. So I think this issue can be closed.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>

<item>
            <title>[CONFIGURATION-510] XMLPropertyListConfiguration parses Map members containing commas when instructed not to</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CONFIGURATION-510</link>
                <project id="12310467" key="CONFIGURATION">Commons Configuration</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;XMLPropertyListConfiguration does not properly handle String properties containing commas when added to the plist as part of a Map.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The following code demonstrates the problem.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeHeader panelHeader&quot; style=&quot;border-bottom-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;b&gt;Sample Code&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;class &lt;/span&gt;FooBar &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;extends&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;Object&lt;/span&gt; {

   &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;static&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; void main(&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt;[] args) &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;throws&lt;/span&gt; Exception {
      XMLPropertyListConfiguration config =&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; XMLPropertyListConfiguration();
      config.setListDelimiter(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&apos;\0&apos;&lt;/span&gt;);
      config.setDelimiterParsingDisabled(&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;true&lt;/span&gt;);

      config.setProperty(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;one&quot;&lt;/span&gt;, &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;this&lt;/span&gt;, that&quot;&lt;/span&gt;);

      Map&amp;lt;&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt;, &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt;&amp;gt; map =&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; HashMap&amp;lt;&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt;, &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt;&amp;gt;();
      map.put(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;two&quot;&lt;/span&gt;, &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;this&lt;/span&gt;, that&quot;&lt;/span&gt;);
      config.addProperty(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;foo&quot;&lt;/span&gt;, map);

      StringWriter strwriter =&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; StringWriter();
      config.save(strwriter);
      &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;System&lt;/span&gt;.out.println(strwriter.toString());
   }
}
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;This code produces the following plist.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-xml&quot;&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;?xml version=&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;1.0&quot;&lt;/span&gt;?&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;!DOCTYPE plist SYSTEM &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;file://localhost/System/Library/DTDs/PropertyList.dtd&quot;&lt;/span&gt;&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;plist version=&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;1.0&quot;&lt;/span&gt;&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;
    &lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;dict&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;key&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;one&lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;/key&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;string&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;this, that&lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;/string&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;

        &lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;key&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;foo&lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;/key&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;dict&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;
            &lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;key&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;two&lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;/key&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;
            &lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;array&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;
                &lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;string&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;this&lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;/string&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;
                &lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;string&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;that&lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;/string&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;
            &lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;/array&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;/dict&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;
    &lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;/dict&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;/plist&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Note that &quot;this, that&quot; has been split into two properties, despite the list delimiter being set away from the comma default and delimiter parsing disabled.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The problem is in XMLPropertyListConfiguration&apos;s printValue(PrintWriter, int, Object) method.  This method create a MapConfiguration containing the (transformed) &quot;foo&quot; Map.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeHeader panelHeader&quot; style=&quot;border-bottom-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;b&gt;Existing XMLPropertyListConfiguration code&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;   printValue(out, indentLevel, &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; MapConfiguration(map));
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The XMLPropertyListConfiguration&apos;s delimiter-related settings are never passed to the MapConfiguration, which retains the enabled and comma defaults.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The following patch to XMLPropertyListConfiguration.java makes Commons Configuration more correct.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeHeader panelHeader&quot; style=&quot;border-bottom-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;b&gt;XMLPropertyListConfiguration.java Patch&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;413c413,416
&amp;lt;             printValue(out, indentLevel, &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; MapConfiguration(map));
---
&amp;gt;             MapConfiguration mapconfig =&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; MapConfiguration(map);
&amp;gt;             mapconfig.setDefaultListDelimiter(getDefaultListDelimiter());
&amp;gt;             mapconfig.setDelimiterParsingDisabled(isDelimiterParsingDisabled());
&amp;gt;             printValue(out, indentLevel, mapconfig);
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;With this patch applied, the program outputs the expected plist.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-xml&quot;&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;?xml version=&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;1.0&quot;&lt;/span&gt;?&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;!DOCTYPE plist SYSTEM &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;file://localhost/System/Library/DTDs/PropertyList.dtd&quot;&lt;/span&gt;&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;plist version=&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;1.0&quot;&lt;/span&gt;&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;
    &lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;dict&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;key&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;one&lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;/key&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;string&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;this, that&lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;/string&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;

        &lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;key&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;foo&lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;/key&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;dict&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;
            &lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;key&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;two&lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;/key&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;
            &lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;string&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;this, that&lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;/string&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;/dict&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;
    &lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;/dict&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;/plist&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;While this patch may provide correct functionality for most use cases, it is still not correct.  Major structural work needs to be done to fix the problem.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The documentation for AbstractConfiguration&apos;s setDefaultListDelimiter(char) method states, &quot;This value will be used only when creating new configurations. Those already created will not be affected by this change&quot;.  AbstractConfiguration&apos;s documentation for setListDelimiter(char) states, &quot;Note: this change will only be effective for new parsings. If you want it to take effect for all loaded properties use the no arg constructor and call this method before setting the source.&quot;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;MapConfiguration extends AbstractConfiguration, yet does not honor the inherited contracts.  That MapConfiguration does not have a no arg constructor is fair enough, though would be somewhat limiting if it did follow the contracts.  That invocations of setDefaultListDelimiter() and setListDelimiter() effect previously added properties is simply wrong.  Unless state is maintained for each added property (which would be a messy implementation), the parsing must not be executed within the getProperty(String) method.  Instead, values must be parsed upon being added to the MapConfiguration.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The same problem exists within XMLPropertyListConfiguration.  The delegated parsing at issue in the bug report is invoked from the printValue(PrintWriter, int, Object) method, which is far too late (again, barring state-saving), to honor the contract that added properties are parsed, or not, according to the delimiter settings in place at the time each property is added.&lt;/p&gt;
</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="12611417">CONFIGURATION-510</key>
            <summary>XMLPropertyListConfiguration parses Map members containing commas when instructed not to</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/open.png" description="The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.">Open</status>
                    <statusCategory id="2" key="new" colorName="blue-gray"/>
                                    <resolution id="-1">Unresolved</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="kend">Ken</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Thu, 11 Oct 2012 19:17:50 +0000</created>
                <updated>Fri, 12 Oct 2012 19:39:15 +0000</updated>
                                            <version>1.9</version>
                                                    <component>Format</component>
                        <due></due>
                            <votes>1</votes>
                                    <watches>3</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="13475282" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Fri, 12 Oct 2012 19:39:15 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Many thanks for this detailed report.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The problem you describe - the output generated by &lt;tt&gt;XMLPropertyListConfiguration&lt;/tt&gt; -  is certainly a bug. So I think the patch should be applied to fix this. (Would it be possible for you to convert the test program to a unit test case and add it to &lt;tt&gt;TestXMLPropertyListConfiguration&lt;/tt&gt;? You can attach a combined patch with the test case and the fix to this issue.)&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Regarding your comments about &lt;tt&gt;MapConfiguration&lt;/tt&gt;, I am not sure whether it should be allowed to parse for delimiters at a later stage or not. This configuration implementation is a bit of a special case as it exposes an already existing &lt;tt&gt;Map&lt;/tt&gt; object through the &lt;tt&gt;Configuration&lt;/tt&gt; interface. Thus there is no control over the entries in the map, and if list splitting is to be supported, there is no earlier point in time when this could be done. At least this behavior is documented in the Javadocs.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                    </comments>
                    <attachments>
                    </attachments>
                <subtasks>
                    </subtasks>
                <customfields>
                                                                            <customfield id="customfield_12310310" key="com.atlassian.jira.toolkit:attachments">
                        <customfieldname>Attachment count</customfieldname>
                        <customfieldvalues>
                            <customfieldvalue>0.0</customfieldvalue>
                        </customfieldvalues>
                    </customfield>
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        <customfield id="customfield_12310220" key="com.atlassian.jira.ext.charting:firstresponsedate">
                        <customfieldname>Date of First Response</customfieldname>
                        <customfieldvalues>
