<item>
            <title>[CONFIGURATION-441] CompositeConfiguration does not resolve referenced properties correctly</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CONFIGURATION-441</link>
                <project id="12310467" key="CONFIGURATION">Commons Configuration</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;Imagine a composite configuration consisting of &lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;config_x : configuration one&lt;br/&gt;
property.one=one&lt;br/&gt;
property.two=two&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;config_y : configuration two&lt;br/&gt;
property.one.ref=${property.one}&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;When getProperty() is called on a CompositeConfiguration, property interpolation does not work if a property in config_x refers to a property in config_y, in the example, property.one.ref won&apos;t translate into &quot;one&quot;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;This seems to be caused by the getProperty() implementation of CompositeConfiguration&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeHeader panelHeader&quot; style=&quot;border-bottom-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;b&gt;CompositeConfiguration.getProperty(String)&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;/**
     * Read property from underlying composite
     *
     * @param key key to use &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;for&lt;/span&gt; mapping
     *
     * @&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;return&lt;/span&gt; object associated with the given configuration key.
     */
    &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;Object&lt;/span&gt; getProperty(&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt; key)
    {
        Configuration firstMatchingConfiguration = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;null&lt;/span&gt;;
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;for&lt;/span&gt; (Iterator i = configList.iterator(); i.hasNext();)
        {
            Configuration config = (Configuration) i.next();
            &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;if&lt;/span&gt; (config.containsKey(key))
            {
                firstMatchingConfiguration = config;
                &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;break&lt;/span&gt;;
            }
        }

        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;if&lt;/span&gt; (firstMatchingConfiguration != &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;null&lt;/span&gt;)
        {
            &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;return&lt;/span&gt; firstMatchingConfiguration.getProperty(key);
        }
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;else&lt;/span&gt;
        {
            &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;return&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;null&lt;/span&gt;;
        }
    }
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The methods finds the first configuration containing the key, and delegates the call to that particular configuration.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;A possible fix would be to try interpolation against every configuration until an interpolation succeed.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment>&lt;p&gt;all&lt;/p&gt;</environment>
        <key id="12502911">CONFIGURATION-441</key>
            <summary>CompositeConfiguration does not resolve referenced properties correctly</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="6">Invalid</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="fabien_nisol">Fabien Nisol</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Wed, 30 Mar 2011 18:19:25 +0000</created>
                <updated>Thu, 8 Sep 2011 09:20:06 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Wed, 6 Apr 2011 10:14:44 +0000</resolved>
                                    <version>1.5</version>
                                    <fixVersion>1.7</fixVersion>
                                    <component>Interpolation</component>
                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>0</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="13014142" author="fabien_nisol" created="Thu, 31 Mar 2011 18:59:46 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;I think overriding the &lt;em&gt;interpolate(Object)&lt;/em&gt; and &lt;em&gt;getProperty(String key)&lt;/em&gt; on CompositeConfiguration like this should do the trick:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;/**
     * Read property from underlying composite
     *
     * @param key key to use &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;for&lt;/span&gt; mapping
     *
     * @&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;return&lt;/span&gt; object associated with the given configuration key.
     */
    &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;Object&lt;/span&gt; getProperty(&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt; key)
    {
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;Object&lt;/span&gt; value = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;null&lt;/span&gt;;
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;for&lt;/span&gt; (Iterator i = configList.iterator(); i.hasNext();)
        {
            Configuration config = (Configuration) i.next();
            &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;if&lt;/span&gt; (config.containsKey(key))
            {
                value = config.getProperty(key); 
            }
        }
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;if&lt;/span&gt;(value==&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;null&lt;/span&gt;)
            &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;return&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;null&lt;/span&gt;;
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;else&lt;/span&gt;
            &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;return&lt;/span&gt; interpolate(value);

    }

    ...

    /**
     * Read property from underlying composite
     *
     * @param key key to use &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;for&lt;/span&gt; mapping
     *
     * @&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;return&lt;/span&gt; object associated with the given configuration key.
     */
    &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;Object&lt;/span&gt; getProperty(&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt; key)
    {
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;Object&lt;/span&gt; value = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;null&lt;/span&gt;;
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;for&lt;/span&gt; (Iterator i = configList.iterator(); i.hasNext();)
        {
            Configuration config = (Configuration) i.next();
            &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;if&lt;/span&gt; (config.containsKey(key))
            {
                value = config.getProperty(key); 
            }
        }
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;if&lt;/span&gt;(value==&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;null&lt;/span&gt;)
            &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;return&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;null&lt;/span&gt;;
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;else&lt;/span&gt;
            &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;return&lt;/span&gt; interpolate(value);

    }
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="13016328" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Wed, 6 Apr 2011 10:14:44 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;The problem here is that you use getProperty() which does not support variable substitution (This is documented in the Configuration interface.). If you call getString() instead, the reference will be correctly resolved.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;To verify, I have added the following test case:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; void testInterpolationInMultipleConfigs()
    {
        Configuration c1 = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; PropertiesConfiguration();
        c1.addProperty(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;property.one&quot;&lt;/span&gt;, &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;one&quot;&lt;/span&gt;);
        c1.addProperty(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;property.two&quot;&lt;/span&gt;, &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;two&quot;&lt;/span&gt;);
        Configuration c2 = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; PropertiesConfiguration();
        c2.addProperty(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;property.one.ref&quot;&lt;/span&gt;, &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;${property.one}&quot;&lt;/span&gt;);
        cc.addConfiguration(c1);
        cc.addConfiguration(c2);
        assertEquals(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;Wrong interpolated value&quot;&lt;/span&gt;, &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;one&quot;&lt;/span&gt;,
                cc.getString(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;property.one.ref&quot;&lt;/span&gt;));
    }
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</comment>
                    </comments>

<item>
            <title>[CONFIGURATION-440] setProperty in XmlConfiguration escapes backslashes</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CONFIGURATION-440</link>
                <project id="12310467" key="CONFIGURATION">Commons Configuration</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;When setPropery sets a new value that has backslashes (like path), backslashes are escaped. When that value is loaded again, all backslashes are duplicated. &lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Following test keeps failing. Don&apos;t know if there is some kind of formatting.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;public class XmlConfigurationTest {&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    private static final String XML_CONFIGURATION_PATH = &quot;resources/xml/config.xml&quot;;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    private static final String PATH1 = &quot;c:\\temp\\path&lt;br class=&quot;atl-forced-newline&quot; /&gt;file.txt&quot;;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    private static final String PATH2 = &quot;c:\\temp1\\path1&lt;br class=&quot;atl-forced-newline&quot; /&gt;file1.txt&quot;;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    private static final String PATH3 = &quot;c:\\temp2\\path2&lt;br class=&quot;atl-forced-newline&quot; /&gt;file2.txt&quot;;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    @Test&lt;br/&gt;
    public void testXmlConfiguration() throws IOException {&lt;br/&gt;
	File resourceFile = null;&lt;br/&gt;
	try &lt;/p&gt;
{

	    assertNotNull(_bundleContext);
	    resourceFile = new File(SystemUtils.getTargetDirectory(),
		    XML_CONFIGURATION_PATH);
	    assertTrue(resourceFile.getParentFile().mkdirs());

	    String value = null;

	    XMLConfiguration configuration = new XMLConfiguration();
	    configuration.setExpressionEngine(new XPathExpressionEngine());
	    configuration.setDelimiterParsingDisabled(true);
	    configuration.addProperty(&quot; key1&quot;, PATH1);
	    configuration.setProperty(&quot; key2&quot;, PATH2);
	    configuration.save(resourceFile);
            /* All values are saved with non escaped backslashes */

	    value = configuration.getString(&quot;key1&quot;);
	    assertEquals(value, PATH1);
	    value = configuration.getString(&quot;key2&quot;);
	    assertEquals(value, PATH2);

	    /*
	     * Set again same property with different value. Setting property
	     * with this configuration will escape backslashes. Even though
	     * assert will pass, path with escaped backslashes will be written
	     * in a file (don&apos;t know if it is setProperty or save that is causing troubles).
	     */
	    configuration.setProperty(&quot; key2&quot;, PATH3);
	    configuration.save(resourceFile);
	    value = configuration.getString(&quot;key2&quot;);
	    assertEquals(value, PATH3);

	    /*
	     * Create new configuration and load values from previously saved
	     * file.
	     */
	    XMLConfiguration newConfiguration = new XMLConfiguration();
	    newConfiguration.setExpressionEngine(new XPathExpressionEngine());
	    newConfiguration.setDelimiterParsingDisabled(true);
	    newConfiguration.load(resourceFile);

	    /*
	     * At this point, configuration will load escaped backslashes, and
	     * the test will fail.
	     */
	    value = newConfiguration.getString(&quot;key2&quot;);
	    assertEquals(value, PATH3);

	}
&lt;p&gt; catch (Throwable e) &lt;/p&gt;
{
	    e.printStackTrace();
	    fail(e.getLocalizedMessage());
	}
&lt;p&gt; finally &lt;/p&gt;
{
	    /*
	     * Delete resource file
	     */
	    resourceFile.delete();
	}

&lt;p&gt;    }&lt;br/&gt;
}&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment>&lt;p&gt;Windows 7&lt;/p&gt;</environment>
        <key id="12500285">CONFIGURATION-440</key>
            <summary>setProperty in XmlConfiguration escapes backslashes</summary>

                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>

                                    <resolution id="3">Duplicate</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="bjevtic">B</reporter>

<item>
            <title>[CONFIGURATION-438] JNDIConfiguration logs Exception when prefix does not exist</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CONFIGURATION-438</link>
                <project id="12310467" key="CONFIGURATION">Commons Configuration</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;A JNDIConfiguration logs an exception when it&apos;s prefix does not exist and getKeys() is called. This is for instance the case when a JNDIConfiguration is used in a DefaultConfigurationBuilder. It does not log an exception when a key does not exist when using getProperty() (that was fixed in issue #44). This seems like an inconsistency to me. Attached patch fixes the problem by ignoring the NameNotFoundException.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="12500070">CONFIGURATION-438</key>
            <summary>JNDIConfiguration logs Exception when prefix does not exist</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="5" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/trivial.svg">Trivial</priority>

<item>
            <title>[CONFIGURATION-437] BasePath not set on with DefaultConfigurationBuilder/ConfigurationBuilderProvider</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CONFIGURATION-437</link>
                <project id="12310467" key="CONFIGURATION">Commons Configuration</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;The DefaultConfigurationBuilder does not set the basepath of nested DefaultConfigurationBuilders:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I&apos;ve the following structure:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;/WEB-INF/config/defs/def-1.xml&lt;br/&gt;
/WEB-INF/config/defs/def-2.xml&lt;br/&gt;
/WEB-INF/config/config1.properties&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I use a DefaultConfigurationBuilder, with the following contents in the&lt;br/&gt;
def-1.xml:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&amp;lt;configuration&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
&amp;lt;override&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
&amp;lt;properties fileName=&quot;../config1.properties&quot;/&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
&amp;lt;configuration fileName=&quot;def-2.xml&quot;/&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
&amp;lt;/override&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
&amp;lt;/configuration&amp;gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I use this code:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;DefaultConfigurationBuilder builder = new DefaultConfigurationBuilder();&lt;br/&gt;
builder.setURL(ctx.getResource(&quot;/WEB-INF/config/defs/def-1.xml&quot;));&lt;br/&gt;
Configuration c = builder.getConfiguration(true);&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;This gives an exception:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Caused by: org.apache.commons.configuration.ConfigurationException:&lt;br/&gt;
Cannot locate configuration source def-2.xml&lt;br/&gt;
at&lt;br/&gt;
org.apache.commons.configuration.AbstractFileConfiguration.load(AbstractFileConfiguration.java:217)&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;...&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Seems to be that AbstractFileConfiguration.basePath is not set by the&lt;br/&gt;
DefaultConfigurationBuilder.ConfigurationBuilderProvider, while it is&lt;br/&gt;
set by DefaultConfigurationBuilder.FileConfigurationProvider (in&lt;br/&gt;
initBeanInstance(Object, BeanDeclaration)).&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I&apos;ll attach a quick n dirty fix against 1.6 (can&apos;t get trunk to build), but I doubt it&apos;s the best fix. It&apos;s just a copy of FileConfigurationProvider#initBeanInstance in ConfigurationBuilderProvider.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="12500068">CONFIGURATION-437</key>
            <summary>BasePath not set on with DefaultConfigurationBuilder/ConfigurationBuilderProvider</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>

                            <comment id="13017370" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Fri, 8 Apr 2011 09:59:01 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;A fix was applied in revision 1090176 which is a bit more broader: The most important properties of the current DefaultConfigurationBuilder are now inherited by child builders. This includes the base path.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>

<item>
            <title>[CONFIGURATION-435] Timestamp version in repository for commons configuration</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CONFIGURATION-435</link>
                <project id="12310467" key="CONFIGURATION">Commons Configuration</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;Hi&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I&apos;m using &quot;Maven Version plugin&quot; with an option that updates the release to the newest one, actually with this option &apos;mvn versions:use-next-releases&apos; or &apos;mvn versions:display-dependency-updates&apos;.&lt;br/&gt;
However, there is a deployed version of your plugin (commons configuration) in 2004, and the other plugin thinks that is the newest version.&lt;br/&gt;
I took a look in the Maven repository and I found that.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;http://mvnrepository.com/artifact/commons-configuration/commons-configuration&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;http://mvnrepository.com/artifact/commons-configuration/commons-configuration&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;There is a possibility to undeploy these old releases (2003 and 2004). I think there are just alpha versions, because you history release starts after there releases (&lt;a href=&quot;http://commons.apache.org/configuration/changes-report.html&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;http://commons.apache.org/configuration/changes-report.html&lt;/a&gt;)&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Best regards,&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment>&lt;p&gt;Any, &lt;/p&gt;</environment>
        <key id="12498368">CONFIGURATION-435</key>
            <summary>Timestamp version in repository for commons configuration</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>

                            <comment id="12993507" author="joehni" created="Fri, 11 Feb 2011 14:29:21 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Commons configuration has nothing to do with the maven versions plugin. If that plugin is not capable to sort out such SNAPSHOT releases that report it as bug of the plugin. And note that the central Maven repository is read-only. We cannot even change this even if we would.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="12993564" author="sebb@apache.org" created="Fri, 11 Feb 2011 16:21:57 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;There appears to be a problem in the maven-metadata.xml file - for some reason, that does not list any releases after 1.2,&lt;br/&gt;
It ought to have been updated with 1.3,...,1.6 as they were added but was not for some reason.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I think this is something that can be fixed, but not by Commons - it is a Maven issue.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I&apos;ll see if I can find the correct place to request that this be fixed.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>

<item>
            <title>[CONFIGURATION-434] In HierarchicalINIConfiguration, after saving a property by calling setProperty() and save() methods, the contents after semicolon disappeared in the saved file.</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CONFIGURATION-434</link>
                <project id="12310467" key="CONFIGURATION">Commons Configuration</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;Hi!&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I am developing an application using Commons Configuration API.&lt;br/&gt;
And I got this problem.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;In the ini file like this:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;Environment&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br/&gt;
Application Type=any&lt;br/&gt;
Class Path=C:\Program Files\jar\manage.jar;C:\Program Files\jar\guiLauncher.jar;C:\Program Files\jar\appStart.jar;%USERPROFILE%;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I changed the value of &apos;Application Type&apos; from &apos;any&apos; to &apos;gui&apos; by using class HierarchicalINIConfiguration.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The value was successfully modified, but instead the value of &apos;Class Path&apos; was cut in the middle.&lt;br/&gt;
It is reduced like this :  &apos;Class Path=C:\Program Files\jar\manage.jar&apos;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;In my opinion, the Configuration System regards the contents after &apos;;&apos; as comments, which disappeared from the file.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Is this a kind of bug? Or is there a way to show all the contents after &apos;;&apos; properly?&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I appreciate if you give comments on this.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Thank you.&lt;/p&gt;




</description>
                <environment>&lt;p&gt;ini file in windows7 64bit&lt;/p&gt;</environment>
        <key id="12497970">CONFIGURATION-434</key>
            <summary>In HierarchicalINIConfiguration, after saving a property by calling setProperty() and save() methods, the contents after semicolon disappeared in the saved file.</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="oheger">Oliver Heger</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="jhj4050">Jin Ho Jo</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Tue, 8 Feb 2011 10:02:18 +0000</created>
                <updated>Thu, 8 Sep 2011 09:20:13 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Wed, 9 Feb 2011 21:16:10 +0000</resolved>
                                    <version>1.6</version>
                                    <fixVersion>1.7</fixVersion>
                                    <component>File reloading</component>
                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>0</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="12992706" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Wed, 9 Feb 2011 20:40:45 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;As some testing shows, the problem is already in the loading of the configuration. After loading the test configuration the &lt;em&gt;Class Path&lt;/em&gt; property has been stripped after the first semicolon.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Your assumption is correct that the semicolon is interpreted as comment character, and the remaining part of the line is ignored. However, I think the semicolon should only be treated as comment character if there is at least one whitespace before it. I will try to fix this.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="12992722" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Wed, 9 Feb 2011 21:16:10 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Fixed in subversion in revision 1069110.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;A comment character must now be preceded by whitespace, otherwise it is considered part of the property value. Thus it is now possible to define file paths using a semicolon as delimiter in ini files read by &lt;tt&gt;HierarchicalINIConfiguration&lt;/tt&gt;.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="12992805" author="jhj4050" created="Thu, 10 Feb 2011 00:11:29 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Thank you very much for your quick fix.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                    </comments>
                    <attachments>
                    </attachments>
                <subtasks>
                    </subtasks>
                <customfields>
                                                                            <customfield id="customfield_12310310" key="com.atlassian.jira.toolkit:attachments">
                        <customfieldname>Attachment count</customfieldname>

<item>
            <title>[CONFIGURATION-433] ConfigurationDynaBean does not work as advertised regarding indexed properties</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CONFIGURATION-433</link>
                <project id="12310467" key="CONFIGURATION">Commons Configuration</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;The Javadoc of &lt;tt&gt;ConfigurationDynaBean&lt;/tt&gt; says: &quot;Setting an indexed property always throws an exception.&quot; However, there is a reasonable implementation for setting indexed properties.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The get() method for indexed properties tries to figure out whether a property is indexed and throws an exception if not. However, it does not discover all cases of invalid access to non-indexed properties.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="12497797">CONFIGURATION-433</key>
            <summary>ConfigurationDynaBean does not work as advertised regarding indexed properties</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="4" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/minor.svg">Minor</priority>

<item>
            <title>[CONFIGURATION-432] ConfugrationConverter treats properties different by type</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CONFIGURATION-432</link>
                <project id="12310467" key="CONFIGURATION">Commons Configuration</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;The ConfigurationConverter is behaving differently depending on if I added an int or a string to a configuration object.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Consider the following code:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;01       Configuration confInt = new BaseConfiguration();&lt;br/&gt;
02       Configuration confString = new BaseConfiguration();&lt;br/&gt;
03       confInt.setProperty(&quot;port&quot;, 80);&lt;br/&gt;
04       confString.setProperty(&quot;port&quot;, &quot;80&quot;);&lt;br/&gt;
05       assertEquals(80, confInt.getInt(&quot;port&quot;));&lt;br/&gt;
06       assertEquals(80, confString.getInt(&quot;port&quot;));&lt;br/&gt;
07&lt;br/&gt;
08       Properties propString = ConfigurationConverter.getProperties(confString);&lt;br/&gt;
09       assertEquals(&quot;80&quot;, propString.getProperty(&quot;port&quot;));&lt;br/&gt;
10&lt;br/&gt;
11       Properties propInt = ConfigurationConverter.getProperties(confInt);&lt;br/&gt;
12&lt;br/&gt;
13       assertEquals(&quot;80&quot;, propInt.getProperty(&quot;port&quot;));&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;As you can see the code is basically duplicated one set uses an int the other set uses a String.  However an exception blows out of line 11.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&apos;port&apos; doesn&apos;t map to a List object: 80, a java.lang.Integer&lt;br/&gt;
org.apache.commons.configuration.ConversionException: &apos;port&apos; doesn&apos;t map to a List object: 80, a java.lang.Integer&lt;br/&gt;
        at org.apache.commons.configuration.AbstractConfiguration.getList(AbstractConfiguration.java:1144)&lt;br/&gt;
        at org.apache.commons.configuration.AbstractConfiguration.getList(AbstractConfiguration.java:1109)&lt;br/&gt;
        at org.apache.commons.configuration.ConfigurationConverter.getProperties(ConfigurationConverter.java:116) &lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I interpreted the interface to mean that everything up to and include line 13 would pass.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment>&lt;p&gt;Linux Ubuntu&lt;/p&gt;</environment>
        <key id="12497402">CONFIGURATION-432</key>
            <summary>ConfugrationConverter treats properties different by type</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="oheger">Oliver Heger</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="mpower@alumni.calpoly.edu">Mike Power</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Wed, 2 Feb 2011 00:24:09 +0000</created>
                <updated>Thu, 8 Sep 2011 09:20:15 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Mon, 7 Feb 2011 21:07:12 +0000</resolved>
                                    <version>1.6</version>
                                    <fixVersion>1.7</fixVersion>
                                    <component>Type conversion</component>
                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>0</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="12991045" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Sat, 5 Feb 2011 19:59:26 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;The problem actually lies in the &lt;tt&gt;AbstractConfiguration.getList()&lt;/tt&gt; method which is called by &lt;tt&gt;ConfigurationConverter&lt;/tt&gt;. Here Strings are treated in a special way while other data types cause the exception menationend in this report. The method &lt;tt&gt;getStringArray()&lt;/tt&gt; behaves analogously.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="12991608" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Mon, 7 Feb 2011 21:07:12 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;A fix was applied in subversion, revision 1068130.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;AbstractConfiguration now has a protected method &lt;tt&gt;isScalarValue()&lt;/tt&gt; which is called by &lt;tt&gt;getList()&lt;/tt&gt; and &lt;tt&gt;getStringArray()&lt;/tt&gt;. If this method returns &lt;b&gt;true&lt;/b&gt;, a list (or an array) with a single element is created with the value transformed to a string. &lt;tt&gt;isScalarValue()&lt;/tt&gt; currently accepts the wrapper types for the primitive data types (e.g. Integer, Double, etc.). If other objects should be treated in the same way, the method can be overridden in a subclass.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;A test case was added for &lt;tt&gt;ConfigurationConverter&lt;/tt&gt; to verify that the changes on &lt;tt&gt;getList()&lt;/tt&gt; solve the problem reported in this issue.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                    </comments>
                    <attachments>
                    </attachments>
                <subtasks>
                    </subtasks>

<item>
            <title>[CONFIGURATION-431] Code caused NullPointer error in XMLConfiguration</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CONFIGURATION-431</link>
                <project id="12310467" key="CONFIGURATION">Commons Configuration</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;In class XMLConfiguration there is a code structure like below:&lt;br/&gt;
	public static void main(String[] args) &lt;/p&gt;
{
		new B();
	}

&lt;p&gt;	static abstract class A {&lt;br/&gt;
		A()&lt;/p&gt;
{
			print();
		}
&lt;p&gt;		abstract void print();&lt;br/&gt;
	}&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;	static class B extends A{&lt;br/&gt;
		String s = new String(&quot;asdf&quot;);&lt;br/&gt;
		B()&lt;/p&gt;
{
			super();
		}

&lt;p&gt;		void print()&lt;/p&gt;
{
			System.out.println(s);
		}
&lt;p&gt;	}&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;While in B.print the field s is actually not initialized because it is called from the super() method.&lt;br/&gt;
In XMLConfiguration the not properly initialized field is registeredEntities, which will defenitly cause nullpointer in some case.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="12493175">CONFIGURATION-431</key>
            <summary>Code caused NullPointer error in XMLConfiguration</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/open.png" description="The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.">Open</status>
                    <statusCategory id="2" key="new" colorName="blue-gray"/>
                                    <resolution id="-1">Unresolved</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="gentboy">gentboy</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Tue, 14 Dec 2010 11:47:22 +0000</created>
                <updated>Thu, 24 Mar 2016 20:12:58 +0000</updated>
                                            <version>1.6</version>
                                    <fixVersion>2.x</fixVersion>
                                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>0</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="12971416" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Tue, 14 Dec 2010 21:21:10 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;There are probably other classes which have the same issue. I think the problem is caused by the different constructors of AbstractFileConfiguration which already load the configuration file and call non-final methods which are overridden in subclasses.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;A safe solution would be to deprecate all these constructors except for the standard constructor. Client code should create a configuration instance by calling the default constructor and then load the data in a second step.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;WDYT, would this solve the problem?&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="12996804" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Sat, 19 Feb 2011 16:37:39 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Any updates on this?&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="13079566" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Thu, 4 Aug 2011 20:17:27 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Setting fix version to 2.0 because a fix would probably break binary compatibility.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                    </comments>

<item>
            <title>[CONFIGURATION-429] configuration values of nodes with children inconsistent</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CONFIGURATION-429</link>
                <project id="12310467" key="CONFIGURATION">Commons Configuration</project>
                    <description>&lt;blockquote&gt;
&lt;p&gt;	&amp;lt;core&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
		&amp;lt;multicore&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
			&amp;lt;numberOfCores&amp;gt;2&amp;lt;/numberOfCores&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
		&amp;lt;/multicore&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
		&amp;lt;singlecore /&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
	&amp;lt;/core&amp;gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/blockquote&gt;

&lt;p&gt;In an XML configfile (see above) where I want to check if a specific node is specified. I do this using the containsKey() method on the configuration.&lt;br/&gt;
In this case it will return true for the key &quot;core.singlecore&quot; but not for the key &quot;core.multicore&quot;.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;If I change the multicore part to this (adding text as a child), it does return true.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;blockquote&gt;
&lt;p&gt;&amp;lt;multicore&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
	ABC&lt;br/&gt;
	&amp;lt;numberOfCores&amp;gt;2&amp;lt;/numberOfCores&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
&amp;lt;/multicore&amp;gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/blockquote&gt;

&lt;p&gt;As the containsKey() method depends on the getProperty() method, the same problem exists in that method.&lt;br/&gt;
In the first case:&lt;br/&gt;
&quot;core.singlecore&quot; returns an empty string&lt;br/&gt;
&quot;core.multicore&quot; returns null&lt;br/&gt;
and in the second case, &quot;ABC&quot; is returned.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I would like it to also return an empty string in the first case for &quot;core.multicore&quot;.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;This behaviour is caused by the code in lines 642-644 of XMLConfiguration.java (svn):&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;blockquote&gt;
&lt;p&gt;       if (text.length() &amp;gt; 0 || (!node.hasChildren() &amp;amp;&amp;amp; node != getRoot()))&lt;br/&gt;
        {&lt;br/&gt;
            node.setValue(text);&lt;br/&gt;
        }&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/blockquote&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I think it can be changed to just this:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;blockquote&gt;
&lt;p&gt;        if (node != getRoot() || text.length() &amp;gt; 0) &lt;br/&gt;
        {&lt;br/&gt;
            node.setValue(text);&lt;br/&gt;
        }&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/blockquote&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="12480804">CONFIGURATION-429</key>
            <summary>configuration values of nodes with children inconsistent</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="8">Not A Problem</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="silasdm">Silas De Munck</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Wed, 24 Nov 2010 14:40:23 +0000</created>
                <updated>Tue, 30 Nov 2010 08:39:41 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Tue, 30 Nov 2010 08:39:41 +0000</resolved>
                                    <version>1.6</version>
                                                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>0</watches>
                                    <timeoriginalestimate seconds="300">5m</timeoriginalestimate>
                            <timeestimate seconds="300">5m</timeestimate>
                                        <comments>
                            <comment id="12935483" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Wed, 24 Nov 2010 20:57:52 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;This is a little bit of a philosopic discussion. Probably you can find good arguments for both options: whether a key with children should be assigned an explicit value or not. At least XMLConfiguration is consistent with PropertiesConfiguration in this regard. If you have a properties file with the content&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;multicore.numberOfCores=2
singlecore=
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;a containsKey(&quot;multicore&quot;) would also return false.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The main problem I see with this issue is that the behavior is like that from the very beginning. Changing this could break existing code in an unpredictable way. For instance, in order to be consistent, we would then have to include all these keys in the iterator returned by getKeys(). So an application updating to a new version of Commons Configuration would suddenly see lots of unexpected keys.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;As an alternative: Would it make sense to add a new method like &lt;tt&gt;containsElement()&lt;/tt&gt; to HierarchicalConfiguration? The drawback is that this method would not be part of the generic Configuration interface.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="12935679" author="silasdm" created="Thu, 25 Nov 2010 08:09:29 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;I understand your concerns about backwards compatibility.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The containsElement() would be a viable alternative, but why shouldn&apos;t it be part of the generic Configuration interface? In case of the PropertiesConfiguration you presented, the same function can work fine? &lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="12935689" author="silasdm" created="Thu, 25 Nov 2010 08:32:13 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Another option is to make this optional behaviour...? &lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;setFullKeyHierarchy(boolean) or something like that.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="12935730" author="joehni" created="Thu, 25 Nov 2010 11:57:57 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;I don&apos;t think that there is any extension necessary. Configuration.containsKey() does exactly what it is supposed to do. If you want to know if there are elements in the hierarchy, you can use:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;configuration.subset(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;foo&quot;&lt;/span&gt;).isEmpty()
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="12935734" author="silasdm" created="Thu, 25 Nov 2010 12:09:38 +0000"  >
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;configuration.subset(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;foo&quot;&lt;/span&gt;).isEmpty()
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;foo exists but is empty -&amp;gt; true&lt;br/&gt;
foo does not exist -&amp;gt; true&lt;br/&gt;
foo exists and is not empty -&amp;gt; false&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The result also depends on the contents of foo...&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="12936092" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Fri, 26 Nov 2010 20:29:55 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;To your questions:&lt;br/&gt;
The reason why the method cannot be added to the Configuration interface is also related to backwards compatibility. We have the rule that minor releases must be binary backwards compatible. Adding a method to an interface is not a binary compatible change. So this allowed only for a major release.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Making the behavior optional would be possible, but to be honest, I do not like this approach very much. We have done this in the past for some flags (e.g. for the handling of list delimiters), and it always makes the code pretty complex. Also, from an API user&apos;s point of view this solution does not seem to be ideal. If you accidently set your flags wrong, you will get unpredictable behavior and errors hard to debug.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;But maybe you can use the &lt;tt&gt;getMaxIndex()&lt;/tt&gt; method: it returns values &amp;gt;= 0 if the key is present and -1 otherwise.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="12964717" author="silasdm" created="Mon, 29 Nov 2010 12:07:50 +0000"  >&lt;blockquote&gt;
&lt;p&gt;But maybe you can use the getMaxIndex() method: it returns values &amp;gt;= 0 if the key is present and -1 otherwise.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/blockquote&gt;


&lt;p&gt;With this, I can implement my own containsElement method, which is good enough for me.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Thank you for your help/time.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="12964931" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Mon, 29 Nov 2010 20:39:46 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;You are welcome. So, can this issue be closed?&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                    </comments>

<item>
            <title>[CONFIGURATION-428] The Windows file path cannot be saved correctly as expected in XMLConfiguration</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CONFIGURATION-428</link>
                <project id="12310467" key="CONFIGURATION">Commons Configuration</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;I want to generate a XML as:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-xml&quot;&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;?xml version=&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;1.0&quot;&lt;/span&gt; encoding=&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;UTF-8&quot;&lt;/span&gt; standalone=&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;no&quot;&lt;/span&gt;?&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;Test&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;
    &lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;Cluster&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;Server location=&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;C:\Server92&quot;&lt;/span&gt;/&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;
    &lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;/Cluster&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;/Test&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Java Code:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-style: solid;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeHeader panelHeader&quot; style=&quot;border-bottom-width: 1px;border-bottom-style: solid;&quot;&gt;&lt;b&gt;Test.java&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;XMLConfiguration config = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; XMLConfiguration();
config.setRootElementName(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;Test&quot;&lt;/span&gt;);
config.addProperty(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;Cluster.Server[@location]&quot;&lt;/span&gt;,  &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;C:\\Server92&quot;&lt;/span&gt;);
config.save(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;C:\\NEW.xml&quot;&lt;/span&gt;);
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;BUT after running the Java Code, the generated XML looks like:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-xml&quot;&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;?xml version=&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;1.0&quot;&lt;/span&gt; encoding=&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;UTF-8&quot;&lt;/span&gt; standalone=&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;no&quot;&lt;/span&gt;?&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;Test&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;Cluster&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;Server location=&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;C:\\Server92&quot;&lt;/span&gt;/&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;/Cluster&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;/Test&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;You will find that the location is &quot;C:\ \Server92&quot;, BUT what I expected is &quot;C:\Server92&quot;.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment>&lt;p&gt;WIN2K3&lt;/p&gt;</environment>
        <key id="12479568">CONFIGURATION-428</key>
            <summary>The Windows file path cannot be saved correctly as expected in XMLConfiguration</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="oheger">Oliver Heger</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="terrencexu">Terrence Xu</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Wed, 10 Nov 2010 06:43:46 +0000</created>
                <updated>Thu, 8 Sep 2011 09:20:11 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Thu, 11 Nov 2010 21:11:41 +0000</resolved>
                                    <version>1.6</version>
                                    <fixVersion>1.7</fixVersion>
                                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>1</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="12930772" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Wed, 10 Nov 2010 21:02:20 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Thank you for reporting this, it is indeed a bug.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The problem is (again) related to the handling of lists, list delimiters, and escaping of list delimiters. As a workaround you can disable parsing of list delimiters (provided that you do not need this feature). Just add the following line to your test class after creating the configuration:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;config.setDelimiterParsingDisabled(&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;true&lt;/span&gt;);
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I will have to think about a proper fix.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="12930887" author="terrencexu" created="Thu, 11 Nov 2010 01:26:41 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Hi Oliver, thanks for your comments, it&apos;s indeed a workaround, and has worked correctly in my component.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I also look at the source code, and I think it&apos;s issue at PropertyConverter.java&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-style: solid;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeHeader panelHeader&quot; style=&quot;border-bottom-width: 1px;border-bottom-style: solid;&quot;&gt;&lt;b&gt;PropertyConverter.java&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;static&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt; escapeDelimiters(&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt; s, &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;char&lt;/span&gt; delimiter) {
    &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt; s1 = StringUtils.replace(s, LIST_ESCAPE, LIST_ESCAPE + LIST_ESCAPE);
    &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;return&lt;/span&gt; StringUtils.replace(s1, &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt;.valueOf(delimiter), LIST_ESCAPE + delimiter);
}
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="12931200" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Thu, 11 Nov 2010 21:11:41 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;A fix was applied to subversion in revision 1034125. This should solve the immediate problem. However, there are probably still issues related to list delimiters and backslashes in attributes. With our current implementation of list handling it is probably not possible to resolve all these issues with a reasonable affort. Therefore I added a corresponding remark and warning to the user&apos;s guide.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;In Commons Configuration 2.x list handling will probably be redesigned. For this reason I did not port the fix for this issue to the Configuration 2 branch.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                    </comments>

<item>
            <title>[CONFIGURATION-427] XMLPropertyListConfiguration cannot save arrays in the correct plist form</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CONFIGURATION-427</link>
                <project id="12310467" key="CONFIGURATION">Commons Configuration</project>
                    <description>&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;groovy&amp;gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;import&lt;/span&gt; org.apache.commons.configuration.plist.* 
groovy&amp;gt; def config = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; XMLPropertyListConfiguration() 
groovy&amp;gt; config.addProperty(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;things&quot;&lt;/span&gt;, [&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&apos;chair&apos;&lt;/span&gt;, &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&apos;hat&apos;&lt;/span&gt;, &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&apos;door&apos;&lt;/span&gt;])  
groovy&amp;gt; config.save(&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;System&lt;/span&gt;.out) 
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;results in&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-xml&quot;&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;?xml version=&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;1.0&quot;&lt;/span&gt;?&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;!DOCTYPE plist SYSTEM &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;file://localhost/System/Library/DTDs/PropertyList.dtd&quot;&lt;/span&gt;&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;plist version=&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;1.0&quot;&lt;/span&gt;&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;
    &lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;dict&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;key&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;things&lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;/key&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;string&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;chair&lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;/string&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;

        &lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;key&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;things&lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;/key&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;string&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;hat&lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;/string&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;

        &lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;key&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;things&lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;/key&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;string&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;door&lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;/string&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;
    &lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;/dict&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;/plist&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;expecting&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-xml&quot;&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;?xml version=&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;1.0&quot;&lt;/span&gt;?&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;!DOCTYPE plist SYSTEM &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;file://localhost/System/Library/DTDs/PropertyList.dtd&quot;&lt;/span&gt;&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;plist version=&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;1.0&quot;&lt;/span&gt;&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;
    &lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;dict&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;key&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;things&lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;/key&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;array&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;
          &lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;string&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;chair&lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;/string&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;
          &lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;string&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;hat&lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;/string&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;
          &lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;string&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;door&lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;/string&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;
      &lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;/array&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;
    &lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;/dict&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;/plist&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</description>
                <environment>&lt;p&gt;should show up in any environment, as the test cases are disabled for arrays and maps:&lt;br/&gt;
&lt;a href=&quot;http://commons.apache.org/configuration/xref-test/org/apache/commons/configuration/plist/TestXMLPropertyListConfiguration.html#199&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;http://commons.apache.org/configuration/xref-test/org/apache/commons/configuration/plist/TestXMLPropertyListConfiguration.html#199&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br/&gt;
I was testing 1.6 using groovy console under Mac OS X 10.6&lt;/p&gt;</environment>
        <key id="12479050">CONFIGURATION-427</key>
            <summary>XMLPropertyListConfiguration cannot save arrays in the correct plist form</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="4" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/minor.svg">Minor</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="ebourg">Emmanuel Bourg</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="smee">matthew smith</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Wed, 3 Nov 2010 22:53:18 +0000</created>
                <updated>Tue, 25 Jun 2019 06:32:39 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Wed, 29 Oct 2014 20:29:12 +0000</resolved>
                                    <version>1.6</version>
                                    <fixVersion>2.0</fixVersion>
                                    <component>Format</component>
                        <due></due>

                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="12928163" author="ebourg" created="Thu, 4 Nov 2010 08:42:58 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Nested array structures are also flattened.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;For example:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;XMLPropertyListConfiguration config = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; XMLPropertyListConfiguration();
config.addProperty(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;array&quot;&lt;/span&gt;, &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt;[][]{{&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;element1&quot;&lt;/span&gt;, &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;element2&quot;&lt;/span&gt;},{&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;element3&quot;&lt;/span&gt;, &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;element4&quot;&lt;/span&gt;}});
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;turns into:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-xml&quot;&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;plist version=&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;1.0&quot;&lt;/span&gt;&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;
    &lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;dict&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;key&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;array&lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;/key&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;string&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;element1&lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;/string&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;

        &lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;key&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;array&lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;/key&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;string&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;element2&lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;/string&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;

        &lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;key&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;array&lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;/key&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;string&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;element3&lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;/string&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;

        &lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;key&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;array&lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;/key&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;string&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;element4&lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;/string&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;
    &lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;/dict&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-tag&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;/plist&amp;gt;&lt;/span&gt;
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="12928591" author="ebourg" created="Fri, 5 Nov 2010 14:03:27 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;The array structure is lost for two reasons:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;ol&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;adding an array of values is done by adding the values separately&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;in a hierarchical configuration, a new node is created for each value&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;/ol&gt;


&lt;p&gt;That means that adding an array like &lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;&amp;#39;element1&amp;#39;, &amp;#39;element2&amp;#39;&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt; results in the creation of two nodes for the same key. This is correct for an XMLConfiguration, it isn&apos;t for a plist.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;A solution is to change how the nodes are added and ensure that paths are unique. I&apos;ve implemented that for XMLPropertyListConfiguration and it works fine for the case reported. However it doesn&apos;t solve the issue with multidimensional arrays, this one is not specific to plist configuration.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="12928593" author="ebourg" created="Fri, 5 Nov 2010 14:04:36 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Attaching the proposed change for review&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="14061345" author="filamoon" created="Mon, 14 Jul 2014 22:14:32 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;I think this is a major bug on an important feature (adding &amp;lt;array&amp;gt; nodes to a plist file). How come it has been pending for so many year? Is XMLPropertyListConfiguration abandoned or not?&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="14063999" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Wed, 16 Jul 2014 19:54:46 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Currently, I am the only maintainer of this code base, and - unfortunately - I am not familiar with the plist format. This is the reason why this request has been open for so long.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;So if you know the format and can provide a patch, this would be highly appreciated.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="14159073" author="respirer2" created="Sat, 4 Oct 2014 11:10:49 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Oliver Heger!&lt;br/&gt;
I think the addProperty and setProperty method in the XMLPropertyListConfiguration class is wrong.&lt;br/&gt;
They regard &apos;List&apos; class as a list of inputs not array.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Original source :&lt;br/&gt;
    @Override&lt;br/&gt;
    public void addProperty(String key, Object value)&lt;br/&gt;
    {&lt;br/&gt;
        if (value instanceof byte[])&lt;/p&gt;
        {
            fireEvent(EVENT_ADD_PROPERTY, key, value, true);
            addPropertyDirect(key, value);
            fireEvent(EVENT_ADD_PROPERTY, key, value, false);
        }&lt;br/&gt;
        else&lt;br/&gt;
        {
            super.addProperty(key, value);
        }&lt;br/&gt;
    }&lt;br/&gt;
&lt;br/&gt;
Expected source(My opinion) :&lt;br/&gt;
   @Override&lt;br/&gt;
    public void addProperty(String key, Object value)&lt;br/&gt;
    {&lt;br/&gt;
        if (value instanceof byte[] || value instanceof List)&lt;br/&gt;
        {            fireEvent(EVENT_ADD_PROPERTY, key, value, true);            addPropertyDirect(key, value);            fireEvent(EVENT_ADD_PROPERTY, key, value, false);        }
&lt;p&gt;        else&lt;/p&gt;
        {
            super.addProperty(key, value);
        }
&lt;p&gt;    }&lt;/p&gt;
</comment>
                            <comment id="14162384" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Tue, 7 Oct 2014 19:37:56 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Thanks for your contribution.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;As I said, I am not familiar with this file format and thus cannot judge whether your proposal solves the problem. Could you provide a unit test demonstrating that your patch works as expected?&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="14162895" author="respirer2" created="Wed, 8 Oct 2014 01:13:01 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Of course, it&apos;s my pleasure.&lt;br/&gt;
My suggestion code cannot recognize String[]. But it can recognize List.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;------------- Test code ---------------&lt;br/&gt;
package mytest;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;import java.io.StringWriter;&lt;br/&gt;
import java.util.ArrayList;&lt;br/&gt;
import java.util.List;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;import org.apache.commons.configuration.ConfigurationException;&lt;br/&gt;
import org.apache.commons.configuration.plist.XMLPropertyListConfiguration;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;class test {&lt;br/&gt;
	public static void main(String[] args) throws ConfigurationException {&lt;br/&gt;
		XMLPropertyListConfiguration config = new XMLPropertyListConfiguration();&lt;br/&gt;
		List&amp;lt;String&amp;gt; strings = new ArrayList&amp;lt;String&amp;gt;();&lt;br/&gt;
		strings.add(&quot;element1&quot;);&lt;br/&gt;
		strings.add(&quot;element2&quot;);&lt;br/&gt;
		strings.add(&quot;element3&quot;);&lt;br/&gt;
		config.addProperty(&quot;arrayTest&quot;, strings);&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;		StringWriter writer = new StringWriter();&lt;br/&gt;
		try &lt;/p&gt;
{
			config.save(writer);
		}
&lt;p&gt; catch (ConfigurationException e) &lt;/p&gt;
{
			e.printStackTrace();
		}
&lt;p&gt;		System.out.println(writer.toString());&lt;br/&gt;
	}&lt;br/&gt;
}&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;--------- Result ----------&lt;br/&gt;
&amp;lt;?xml version=&quot;1.0&quot; encoding=&quot;UTF-8&quot;?&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
&amp;lt;!DOCTYPE plist PUBLIC &quot;-//Apple//DTD PLIST 1.0//EN&quot; &quot;http://www.apple.com/DTDs/PropertyList-1.0.dtd&quot;&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
&amp;lt;plist version=&quot;1.0&quot;&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
    &amp;lt;dict&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
        &amp;lt;key&amp;gt;arrayTest&amp;lt;/key&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
        &amp;lt;array&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
            &amp;lt;string&amp;gt;element1&amp;lt;/string&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
            &amp;lt;string&amp;gt;element2&amp;lt;/string&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
            &amp;lt;string&amp;gt;element3&amp;lt;/string&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
        &amp;lt;/array&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
    &amp;lt;/dict&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
&amp;lt;/plist&amp;gt;&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="14165626" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Thu, 9 Oct 2014 19:46:46 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Based on your proposal, I have created a patch. It also checks whether the object to be added is a list. In addition, it checks for arrays and converts them to lists. Please double-check whether this solves the original issue.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The problem I see with this approach and the way &lt;tt&gt;XMLPropertyListConfiguration&lt;/tt&gt; is implemented is that the internal data representation used by this class differs from the way other hierarchical configuration implementations store their data. For instance, a list structure is stored in a single node with a value of type &lt;tt&gt;List&lt;/tt&gt;; other configurations use multiple nodes for the single values of the list. So the enhanced query facilities offered by hierarchical configurations do not work well here.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;It would probably be a better solution to store the data in the &quot;native&quot; representation used by hierarchical configurations and to convert to PList-specific structures when saving to disk. But this is probably not trivial to implement.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="14166441" author="respirer2" created="Fri, 10 Oct 2014 06:14:23 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Hmm.. I didn&apos;t think about other hierarchical configuration implementations.^^ As you said, it lacked consistency.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Thanks for your kind reply.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="14168170" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Sat, 11 Oct 2014 14:23:29 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Hi Ho-jin,&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;don&apos;t get me wrong. I think your patch is perfectly in-line with the implementation of &lt;tt&gt;XMLPropertyListConfiguration&lt;/tt&gt;. If nobody objects, we can apply it because it actually improves this class and fixes a problem.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;It is just that I think that ideally the whole class needs to be reworked to be more consistent with other configuration implementations.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="14181310" author="respirer2" created="Thu, 23 Oct 2014 13:10:12 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;No, I don&apos;t. Please, don&apos;t mind. &lt;img class=&quot;emoticon&quot; src=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/emoticons/smile.png&quot; height=&quot;16&quot; width=&quot;16&quot; align=&quot;absmiddle&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; border=&quot;0&quot;/&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="14188939" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Wed, 29 Oct 2014 20:29:12 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Patch applied in revision 1635294.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;This solves the problem reported in this ticket, but I am still not happy with the overall design of XMLPropertyListConfiguration. But this can be addressed in a separate ticket.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>

<item>
            <title>[CONFIGURATION-426] ConcurrentModificationException  is thrown from CompositeConfiguration.getList</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CONFIGURATION-426</link>
                <project id="12310467" key="CONFIGURATION">Commons Configuration</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;ConcurrentModificationException  is thrown from CompositeConfiguration.getList although the object is used as &quot;read only&quot;. &lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Stack trace:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;java.util.ConcurrentModificationException&lt;br/&gt;
    at java.util.LinkedList$ListItr.checkForComodification(LinkedList.java:632)&lt;br/&gt;
    at java.util.LinkedList$ListItr.next(LinkedList.java:567)&lt;br/&gt;
    at&lt;br/&gt;
org.apache.commons.configuration.CompositeConfiguration.getList(CompositeConfiguration.java:294)&lt;br/&gt;
    at&lt;br/&gt;
org.apache.commons.configuration.AbstractConfiguration.getList(AbstractConfiguration.java:1108)&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="12478802">CONFIGURATION-426</key>
            <summary>ConcurrentModificationException  is thrown from CompositeConfiguration.getList</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="8">Not A Problem</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="tamirla">Tamir Lahav</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Mon, 1 Nov 2010 12:57:43 +0000</created>
                <updated>Wed, 10 Nov 2010 20:40:33 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Wed, 10 Nov 2010 20:40:33 +0000</resolved>
                                                    <fixVersion>1.7</fixVersion>
                                    <component>Build</component>
                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
