                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="12926997" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Mon, 1 Nov 2010 14:53:35 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Could you please provide some more information:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;ul&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;A short code fragment how the configuration object is created and accessed&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;Does the exception happen all the time or occasionally?&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;Which version of Commons Configuration do you use?&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;/ul&gt;
</comment>
                            <comment id="12928195" author="tamirla" created="Thu, 4 Nov 2010 12:30:17 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;we have a singleton class that extends CompositeConfiguration and uses addConfiguration method to add configuration files:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;public class CentralConfigurationListener implements ConfigurationListener, ConfigurationErrorListener&lt;br/&gt;
{&lt;br/&gt;
  // implementation of listener&lt;br/&gt;
}&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;public class CentralConfigurationValidator implements ErrorHandler&lt;br/&gt;
{&lt;br/&gt;
  // implementation of validator&lt;br/&gt;
}&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;public class CentralConfiguration extends CompositeConfiguration &lt;br/&gt;
{&lt;br/&gt;
  private static final CentralConfiguration sCentralConfiguration = new CentralConfiguration();&lt;br/&gt;
  private static final CentralConfigurationListener mListener = new CentralConfigurationListener();&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;  public boolean doConfigure(String pluginXmlFileName)&lt;/p&gt;
  {
        CentralConfigurationValidator validator = new CentralConfigurationValidator();
        FileChangedReloadingStrategy  reloadStrategy = new FileChangedReloadingStrategy();
        XMLConfiguration pluginXmlFile = new XMLConfiguration(); 
        pluginXmlFile.setFileName(pluginXmlFileName);
        pluginXmlFile.setDocumentBuilder(validator.createDocumentBuilder());
        pluginXmlFile.setValidating(true);
        pluginXmlFile.load();
        SubnodeConfiguration pluginXmlTierExtentionNode = pluginXmlFile.configurationAt(cConfigurationXmlTagName,true);
        
        // Adding pluginXmlFile to CentralConfiguration 
        sCentralConfiguration.addConfiguration(pluginXmlTierExtentionNode);
        pluginXmlFile.setReloadingStrategy(reloadStrategy);
  
        // Setting a configuration listener on the PluginXmlFile. 
        
        pluginXmlFile.addConfigurationListener(mListener);
        pluginXmlFile.addErrorListener(mListener);
  }

&lt;p&gt;  // other configuration methods&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;}&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The exception is sporadic and we&apos;re using Commons Configuration 1.6&lt;/p&gt;
</comment>
                            <comment id="12928341" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Thu, 4 Nov 2010 20:38:36 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;CompositeConfiguration is not thread-safe. If you add a new child configuration in one thread while accessing the configuration in another thread, such ConcurrentModificationExceptions can occur. Admitted, there is no explicit warning in the Javadocs, but the user&apos;s guide has a general note about thread-safety of configuration implementations:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;http://commons.apache.org/configuration/userguide/overview.html#Threading_issues&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;http://commons.apache.org/configuration/userguide/overview.html#Threading_issues&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;When using an instance as a singleton you have to provide proper synchronization yourself.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="12929336" author="tamirla" created="Sun, 7 Nov 2010 13:51:20 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Ok, makes sense &lt;img class=&quot;emoticon&quot; src=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/emoticons/smile.png&quot; height=&quot;16&quot; width=&quot;16&quot; align=&quot;absmiddle&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; border=&quot;0&quot;/&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;thanks for the quick reply&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="12930766" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Wed, 10 Nov 2010 20:40:33 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Works as expected, so closing this issue.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>

<item>
            <title>[CONFIGURATION-425] FileChangedReloadingStrategy works differently on Unix and Windows</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CONFIGURATION-425</link>
                <project id="12310467" key="CONFIGURATION">Commons Configuration</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;I created a unit test for a configuration class that uses commons configuration. It loads both a set of static properties and a set of dynamic properties, the latter uses FilechangeReloadingStragegy. The unit test copies a file containing an initial set of of dynamic properties (using commons-io FileUtils.copy()) , verifies the values are as expected and then copies an updated set of properties, sleeps longer than the refresh delay and then verifies the new values are in place. &lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;On WIndows it works as expected. It recognizes that FileUtils.copy() has replaced the dynamic.properties file with an updated version and it loads the new property values. &lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;On Linux, nothing I do makes it recognize that the file has been replaced except by actually opening a shell and editing the dynamic.properties values. Then it works as expected.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;This may well be my lack of understanding of some Unix filesystem behavior but it seems like FilechangeReloadingStrategy should notice the change to the file one way or the other.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The unit test looks like so:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;		&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; ConfigurationManager cm = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; StandardConfigurationManager(staticTestPropertiesFileName, dynamicTestPropertiesFileName);

		/*
		 * Initialize the configuration manager. This should read all the initial values.
		 */
		cm.init();

		Assert.assertEquals(&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;System&lt;/span&gt;.getProperty(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;java.user&quot;&lt;/span&gt;), cm.retrieveUserName());

		/*
		 * Verify that the &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;static&lt;/span&gt; properties were read.
		 */
		Assert.assertEquals(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;1.00&quot;&lt;/span&gt;, cm.retrieveVersionId());

		/*
		 * Verify that the initial values &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;for&lt;/span&gt; the dynamic properties were read.
		 */
		Assert.assertEquals(100, cm.retrieveMaxConcurrentLogons());

		&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;if&lt;/span&gt; (copyFile(updatedConfigFileName, dynamicTestPropertiesFileName))
		{
			/*
			 * The &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;default&lt;/span&gt; update window &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;for&lt;/span&gt; Apache commons configuration file reload strategy is 5 seconds
			 * so wait more than 5 seconds to ensure the &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; value will be read.
			 */			
			log.info(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;Sleeping until configuration refresh delay has passed&quot;&lt;/span&gt;);
			sleep(6000L);
			log.info(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;Woke, resuming test, maxConcurrentLogons = &quot;&lt;/span&gt; + cm.retrieveMaxConcurrentLogons());
				
			/*
			 * Verify that the property was updated to the expected &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; value.
			 */
&amp;gt;&amp;gt;&amp;gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;this&lt;/span&gt; fails every time on Linux:	Assert.assertEquals(1, cm.retrieveMaxConcurrentLogons());
		}
		&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;else&lt;/span&gt;
		{
			Assert.fail(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;Couldn&apos;t copy updated test properties file&quot;&lt;/span&gt;);
		}
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I&apos;ve tried everything I could think of to trigger the reload strategy. After calling FileUtils.copy() on the file I added a FileUtils.touch() on the destination file. That didn&apos;t work so I added a &quot;Process process = runtime.exec(&quot;touch &quot; + destFile.getAbsolutePath());&quot; to be absolutely 100% certain the file timestamp is being updated. It gets updated, but the reloading strategy never recognizes it. &lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I googled and searched the JIRA incidents and the only thing I can find that looks similar are some references to a problem in V1.1 that was fixed long ago.&lt;/p&gt;
</description>
                <environment>&lt;p&gt;Windows 7 x64 and Ubuntu 10.04 Server&lt;/p&gt;</environment>
        <key id="12477584">CONFIGURATION-425</key>
            <summary>FileChangedReloadingStrategy works differently on Unix and Windows</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="4" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/minor.svg">Minor</priority>
                        <status id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/open.png" description="The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.">Open</status>
                    <statusCategory id="2" key="new" colorName="blue-gray"/>
                                    <resolution id="-1">Unresolved</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="dphaynes">Dan Haynes</reporter>

                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="12921912" author="dphaynes" created="Sun, 17 Oct 2010 22:25:27 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;I just realized I should have mentioned I&apos;m running this unit test on a local file system, not on an NFS mounted one.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="12926434" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Fri, 29 Oct 2010 19:59:29 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Unfortunately I am no expert on Linux file systems either.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;However, in the test class for &lt;tt&gt;FileChangedReloadingStrategy&lt;/tt&gt; we have a test which basically does the same as you describe:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;ul&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;A properties file is created which assigns a value to a property.&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;A PropertiesConfiguration object is created which loads this properties file.&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;A FileChangedReloadingStrategy object is created and associated with the configuration.&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;Then a file operation is performed which changes the content of the properties file.&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;The current thread sleeps a while to ensure that the refresh interval is reached.&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;Finally we check whether the configuration object sees the changed value to verify that the reload actually happened.&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;/ul&gt;


&lt;p&gt;Below is the complete code of this test method:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;    &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; void testAutomaticReloading() &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;throws&lt;/span&gt; Exception
    {
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// create a &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; configuration
&lt;/span&gt;        File file = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; File(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;target/testReload.properties&quot;&lt;/span&gt;);

        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;if&lt;/span&gt; (file.exists())
        {
            file.delete();
        }

        &lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// create the configuration file
&lt;/span&gt;        FileWriter out = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; FileWriter(file);
        out.write(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;string=value1&quot;&lt;/span&gt;);
        out.flush();
        out.close();

        &lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// load the configuration
&lt;/span&gt;        PropertiesConfiguration config = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; PropertiesConfiguration(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;target/testReload.properties&quot;&lt;/span&gt;);
        FileChangedReloadingStrategy strategy = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; FileChangedReloadingStrategy();
        strategy.setRefreshDelay(500);
        config.setReloadingStrategy(strategy);
        assertEquals(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;Initial value&quot;&lt;/span&gt;, &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;value1&quot;&lt;/span&gt;, config.getString(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;string&quot;&lt;/span&gt;));

        &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;Thread&lt;/span&gt;.sleep(2000);

        &lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// change the file
&lt;/span&gt;        out = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; FileWriter(file);
        out.write(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;string=value2&quot;&lt;/span&gt;);
        out.flush();
        out.close();

        &lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// test the automatic reloading
&lt;/span&gt;        assertEquals(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;Modified value with enabled reloading&quot;&lt;/span&gt;, &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;value2&quot;&lt;/span&gt;, config.getString(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;string&quot;&lt;/span&gt;));
    }
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;This test executes successfully for me under Ubuntu 10 (actually it is a virtual machine running under Windows 7, but this should not make a difference).&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Can you verify that this basic test works for you? If so, the problem seems to be somewhere else, maybe in the configuration manager?&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="12931928" author="dphaynes" created="Mon, 15 Nov 2010 00:04:33 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;I did not have a chance to run the unit test you mentioned, but I did find a workaround for the problem.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;While I was trying to fix the code before, to be absolutely sure the file was being updated I used FileUtils.forceDelete() on the destination file before doing the file copy. I had  hoped that the Linux version would pick up on the file system change due to the delete. That didn&apos;t work, it did not reload the properties file even though a &apos;cat&apos; of the file showed that it had indeed been completely replaced. &lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;In the source of the unit test you supplied I happened to notice that it uses file.delete() while I&apos;m  using FileUtils.forceDelete(). I changed my code to use FileUtils.deleteQuietly() instead of FileUtilsforceDelete() and that makes the difference!&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;			File srcFile = new File(sourceFileName);&lt;br/&gt;
			File destFile = new File(destFileName);&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;			FileUtils.forceDelete(destFile);  &amp;lt;-- this doesn&apos;t work - the properties never gets reloaded &lt;br/&gt;
			FileUtils.deleteQuietly(destFile);  &amp;lt;-- this works, the properties file is reloaded on the next access, as expected.&lt;br/&gt;
                        destFile.delete() &amp;lt;-- this doesn&apos;t work either, the properties are never reloaded&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;			FileUtils.copyFile(srcFile, destFile, false);&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I also tried it using destFile.delete(). Strangely enough, this also fails. Commons configuration does not notice that the properties file has been modified (actually not just modified but completely replaced)&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I have try/catches for all possible exceptions, I see no exception thrown when using forceDelete() or delete() - and technically speaking it doesn&apos;t seem like they should be needed since FileUtils.copyFile() replaces the contents. Again, I verified that the properties file is updated by doing a &apos;cat&apos; on the file during the test and it shows the updated properties but for some reason commons configuration never reloads the file. &lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;If I externally use &apos;cp&apos; to copy a new properties file into place it does recognize the change and reloads the properties as it should.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I&apos;ll see if I can find the time to build commons-configuration on the Linux box and run the unit tests, but it may be a while. &lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Thank you for your help!&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="12935479" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Wed, 24 Nov 2010 20:43:54 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;This is really strange. I must admit, I have no idea what is going on.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The only thing I could imagine is that an exception is thrown for some reason (maybe because the file is not found) which gets somehow swallowed. However, this is not very likely because in the reload() method there is a catch block which catches all exceptions and passes them to the error listeners registered at the configuration. If you do no have changed the default error listeners, the exception should at least be logged.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="13426054" author="oliver.heger@t-online.de" created="Tue, 31 Jul 2012 19:40:10 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Any news here?&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="13426323" author="dphaynes" created="Wed, 1 Aug 2012 04:23:21 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;I have not had the time to go back and do anything with it. I&apos;ll try to squeeze in some time this weekend as I&apos;m starting another project soon that will use commons-configuration.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                    </comments>

                        </customfieldvalues>

                        <customfieldname>Rank (Obsolete)</customfieldname>
                        <customfieldvalues>
                            <customfieldvalue>266039</customfieldvalue>
                        </customfieldvalues>
                    </customfield>

<item>
            <title>[CONFIGURATION-424] HierachicalINIConfiguration has problems with configurations only containing a global section</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CONFIGURATION-424</link>
                <project id="12310467" key="CONFIGURATION">Commons Configuration</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;HierachicalINIConfiguration#getSections() does not correctly deal with configurations containing only a globalSection() leading for example to a configuration containing only a global section to be saved as a zero length file.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The current code only acknowledges a global section when at least one other named section is present, if none is present it just returns an empty set.&lt;br/&gt;
Since HierachicalINIConfiguration#save() saves only the contents of the set returned by getSections() this leads to an ini file being loaded and saved again to be saved as a zero length file resulting in the loss of all data in the file (thus the critical priority).&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Workaround:&lt;br/&gt;
Create at least one named section&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Proposed fix (sourcecode): &lt;br/&gt;
Set sections = new ListOrderedSet();&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;for (Iterator it = getRootNode().getChildren().iterator(); it.hasNext()&lt;img class=&quot;emoticon&quot; src=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/emoticons/wink.png&quot; height=&quot;16&quot; width=&quot;16&quot; align=&quot;absmiddle&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; border=&quot;0&quot;/&gt;&lt;br/&gt;
{&lt;br/&gt;
    ConfigurationNode node = (ConfigurationNode) it.next();&lt;br/&gt;
    if (isSectionNode(node))&lt;/p&gt;
    {
        sections.add(node.getName());
    }
&lt;p&gt;    else&lt;/p&gt;
    {
        sections.add(null);
    }
&lt;p&gt;}&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;return sections;&lt;/p&gt;


&lt;p&gt;Beware:&lt;br/&gt;
I have NOT tested this (at all).&lt;br/&gt;
It&apos;s just the way I would write this method instead of the way it was written before. But since I don&apos;t know the big picture maybe there was a (good) reason to write the current version the way it is now so my seemingly easy fix could not work correctly.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="12477508">CONFIGURATION-424</key>
            <summary>HierachicalINIConfiguration has problems with configurations only containing a global section</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="2" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/critical.svg">Critical</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="oheger">Oliver Heger</assignee>

            <title>[CONFIGURATION-423] TestFileChangedReloadingStrategy fails incorrectly in testFromClasspath() </title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CONFIGURATION-423</link>
                <project id="12310467" key="CONFIGURATION">Commons Configuration</project>

                <environment>&lt;p&gt;Windows XP Pro 2002 SP 3&lt;/p&gt;</environment>

<item>
            <title>[CONFIGURATION-421] VFSFileChangedReloadingStrategy.init() uses configuration before checking it for null</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CONFIGURATION-421</link>
                <project id="12310467" key="CONFIGURATION">Commons Configuration</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;VFSFileChangedReloadingStrategy.init() uses configuration before checking it for null:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;preformatted panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;preformattedContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre&gt;        if (configuration.getURL() == null &amp;amp;&amp;amp; configuration.getFileName() == null)
        {
            return;
        }
        if (this.configuration == null)
        {
            throw new IllegalStateException(&quot;No configuration has been set for this strategy&quot;);
        }
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The if statements should be swapped.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;Note found by Findbugs&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="12466452">CONFIGURATION-421</key>
            <summary>VFSFileChangedReloadingStrategy.init() uses configuration before checking it for null</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/open.png" description="The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.">Open</status>
                    <statusCategory id="2" key="new" colorName="blue-gray"/>
                                    <resolution id="-1">Unresolved</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="sebb">Sebb</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Tue, 8 Jun 2010 12:31:02 +0000</created>
                <updated>Thu, 24 Mar 2016 20:12:59 +0000</updated>
                                                            <fixVersion>2.x</fixVersion>
                                    <component>File reloading</component>
